loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm equipment, seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest.

Henry operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a favourable place, and his primary customers are individuals.

Henry will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, sweets and other items.

loans.name: Teodevie

texts.en:
Teodevie is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teodevie is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Teodevie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Teodevie requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed.

Teodevie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Teodevie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is a 42-year-old mother with 7 children She runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches and toast sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Annie has requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, box of fish canned (tuna), plastic bags, container, butter, and mayonnaise to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. Annie became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, box of fish canned (tuna), plastic bags, container, butter, and mayonnaise

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde hace 10 años, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así poder seguir con sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Dora is 39 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and daughter. She has been cultivating basic grains for 10 years. Dora sells her products in the nearby towns and has many customers. With the income she earns from her work and the help of her husband, she and her family have been able to move forward.

Dora is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, and other supplies. As a result, she can continue to grow her crops in order to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is a 25-year-old mother with three children. She has a small business selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Tina has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her run the business. Tina hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Mesepi

texts.en:
Mesepi is a 54-year-old mother with five children.  She owns and operates a small business in which she cooks and sells BBQ in her community to earn a living.

To help her with the business, Mesepi has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, banana, and a sack of rice. Mesepi hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, banana, and a sack of rice

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest.

Eunice operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

Eunice will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large-scale farm within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a single woman. She has four children. She describes herself as capable. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a single man. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a retail business where he sells mobile phones. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital. 

Simon will use this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more stock of mobile phones. His business goal is to own a big shop within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be a supplier of electronics. 

This is Simon's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mobile phones

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as honest. Rose operates a retail business where she sells fruit. She has been involved in this business for three years. 

Rose's business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. Rose will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruit. Her business goal is to own a big shop within five years. This is Rose's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her banana farming

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Victoria is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Victoria has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for five years. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Zamreen

texts.en:
Zamreen is a 37-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Zamreen is also providing sewing services and earning income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of clothes, and machine oil for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Zamreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Resham

texts.en: Resham, 52 years old, is a very enthusiastic person. She is married with five children. Her son (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a general store. He offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, he needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. For this reason, Resham has requested a loan from Murabaha of 30,000 PKR for her son, who will buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, he will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at his store and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Ameer

texts.en:
Ameer is a 50-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past ten years, and he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Ameer's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items, for his business. But due to financial constraints Ameer's husband is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products to resell. Therefore Ameer has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and help him earn the maximum profitable income to manage their household and business. 

Ameer is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his general store business

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en: Ioana is a 66-year-old mother with 4 children. She runs a small business of selling ice cake in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Ioana has requested a loan to buy a freezer, sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bag, and coolio to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business in her community. Ioana became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bag, coolio

loans.name: Sailau

texts.en: Sailau is a 71-year-old mother with 2 children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Sailau has requested a loan to buy a freezer, box of twisties, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. Sailau became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of twisties, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, plastic bags

loans.name: Julia Saturnina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA JULIA CUENTA CON UN NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE FRESCO AMBULANTE DESDE HACE 6 AÑOS ELLA ES UNA MUJER TRABAJADORA QUE LUCHA POR SALIR ADELANTE CON SU FAMILIA ELLA INICIA UN DIA DE TRABAJO DESDE LAS 6:00 AM QUE INICIA LA FABRICASION DE SUS FRESCO HASTA LAS 3 DE LA TARDE QUE TERMINA SU VENTA ELABORADA LA SEÑORA SOLICITA EL FINANCIAMIENTO CADA TRES MESES PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA QUE UTILIZA PARA SUS FRESCO.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia has a business in which she sells soft drinks as a street vendor. She has been doing this for six years. Julia is a hardworking woman who strives to get ahead along with her family. She starts her work day at 6:00 A.M., which is when she begins making soft drinks. Julia finishes her sales at 3:00 P.M.

Sra. Julia requests a loan every three months in order to buy supplies that she uses for making her soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making soft drinks.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  CHASKA ÑAHUI, el socio continua  dedicándose a ejercer su profesión  como médico, él socio tiene un consultorio médico donde trabaja y puede atender a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar materiales quirúrgicos.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Communal Bank “Chaska Ñahui” and continues to work as a doctor. He has a medical practice where he works and attends to all of his patients who request his services. The borrower is a responsible and diligent individual who works in this manner so that he and his family can get ahead.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy surgical supplies.

loans.use: to buy surgical supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase his income from supplying milk to customers.

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “BUENA VISTA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Pascuala ella es casada y tiene 70 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos, cafe, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto deespues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These group members belong to the Buena Vista communal bank. This bank is located in the Huayopata district, which belongs to the province of La Convención in the department of Cusco.

This member is Pascuala. She is married, is 70 years old, and has three children. She works at her business growing fruit. She has some land where she grows bananas, coffee, mandarins and oranges. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. and now carries many years in this business, and it is going very well. Her dream is to enlarge her farmland. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

The member whose photo is pasted in the bottom of the group photo was not at the meeting for work reasons. The other members work in animal sales, agriculture, a grocery store business, and food sales.

Pascuala is thankful to those who form part of her dream through these means, and she promises to make all the repayments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Cecilia Eva

texts.en:
Cecilia Eva is 45 years old and married with four children. With all of her children in school, Cecilia Eva works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia Eva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, coffee, home product care and other groceries.

Cecilia Eva has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items, including coffee, biscuits, sugar, eggs, beverages, canned goods, condiments, and other groceries. 

In the future, Cecilia Eva would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, coffee, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 45-year-old married woman with six children. Three of her children are in school.

Cristina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cristina has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana works hard to support her family. Marciana has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marciana requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, soft drinks, beers, biscuits, noodles, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Marciana has been in this business for six years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Marciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, soft drinks, beers, biscuits, noodles, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old and married. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for her family.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, drinks, biscuits, candies, sugar, and other groceries. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and married with three children.

Maria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her store.

Maria has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from frozen foods vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maria aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Jonabel

texts.en:
Jonabel is 34 years old and married with four children.

Jonabel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store, such as biscuits, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Jonabel has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from electronic loads.

Jonabel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, such as biscuits, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her four children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running his own scrap business and one of her sons has been running a mobile shop for the past five years. 

Suriya's son wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, her son is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Suriya has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her son to purchase relevant items for his business purpose so that he can earn a more profitable income to manage his business and household. Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son to increase his mobile business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 46 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is 37 years old and has 4 children. Janepher is married and has three children who are in school.

Janepher is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Janepher requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Janepher has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Janepher would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ambreen

texts.en:
Ambreen is a 34-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 3 children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years and is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Ambreen is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of clothes, and machine oil for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and will also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Ambreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Silia

texts.en: Silia is a 42-year-old mother with one child. She has a small business selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Silia has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her run the business. Silia hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Vanessa es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 12, 10, 4 y 1 año, y su negocio es la venta de gaseosas.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, decidida, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en el barrio ‘Convipec’ de la zona plan 3000, caracterizado porque sus pobladores son inmigrantes; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, situado al sur de la ciudad, donde se asentaron y formaron un gran comercio, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-36 grados centígrados.
Vanessa es de tez  morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, estatura mediana, complexión física mediana su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (de pie, la segunda de la izquierda, viste solera negra y short blanco). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y sus cuatro hijos que colaboran en el trabajo transportando las cajas vacías y llenas, los dos mayores estudian en la escuela, los menores aún no se encuentran en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus sueños de mejorar su negocio la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida snack, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, carnicería, tienda de vídeos, venta de comida y artesanía en yeso, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de gaseosas; ella se ocupa de comprar hielo para refrigerar sus gaseosas y tenerlas frías, sus clientes la conocen y saben que es el único lugar de este tipo. Para continuar con su negocio ella quiere abrir una tienda de barrio para generar mejores ingresos y ayudar con los gastos de sus hijos. “decidí ampliar mi negocio abriendo una tienda de barrio, necesito el préstamo para comprar los productos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no existen tiendas cercanas de este tipo, la desventaja es que le falta capital de inversión. Su sueño es tener una tienda completa de gaseosas y abarrotes, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad, como; azúcar, fideo, arroz, harina, huevos, etc. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Vanessa solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad para abrir una tienda de barrio y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Vanessa is a 31 year old woman. She lives with her partner and has four children who are 12, 10, 4, and 1. She is enterprising, determined, responsible, very hardworking, and a good mother.

She works in the Convipec neighborhood of the '3000 Plan' zone, a place characterized by its immigrant residents: Aymarás, Quechuas, and Guaraníes. It is located toward the south of the city, where they settled and initiated a lot of commerce, and it has a warm, tropical climate with day temperature ranges between 18 and 36 degrees Celcius. 

Vanessa has a dark complexion, long black hair that she keeps tied up, dark eyes, and medium build. Her first language is Spanish, and she also knows Guarani from her family. (She is standing, second from the left, wearing a black tanktop and white shorts.)

She lives her life with her partner, who works in construction, and their four children who help out with the business by carrying the empty and filled boxes. The two older ones are in school, but the younger ones are not yet school age. They live in their own house, which is made of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof. It has running water, electricity, and plumbing.

Her dreams of improving her business led her to join a bank of people with jobs such as selling snack foods, selling sports clothes, running a neighborhood store, a butcher shop, a video store, selling food, and gypsum handicrafts, so that she could request a loan and expand her activities. She sells soda for a living and commits to buying ice to refrigerate her soda and keep it cold. Her customers know her and know that her business is the only one of its kind.

To continue her business, she wants to open a neighborhood store to earn more income and help cover her children's costs. "I decided to expand my business, opening a neighborhood store. I need the loan to buy products," she says. The advantage of her business is that there are no nearby stores of this type; the disadvantage is that she lacks capital to invest.

Her dream is to have a complete store with soda and groceries. She wants to expand her business by purchasing basic foods like sugar, noodles, rice, flour, eggs, etc. This is her second loan sequence with the institution in the 3 years she has had her business.

For these reasons, Vanessa is requesting a loan to purchase basic foods to open a neighborhood store and expand her business

loans.use: to buy basic foods to open a neighborhood store and expand her business

loans.name: Ma. Nora

texts.en:
Ma. Nora is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Nora is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ma. Nora has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from poultry.

Ma. Nora is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Dita

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of our Ruma agents, Dita. Dita lives in West Bandung, a suburban area located in West Java, about three hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Dita lives there with her husband and children. 

Dita owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it was really important for her to help her husband increase their income, so they can save more money for their children’s education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. 

As the business grows, Dita needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Dita’s goal in the near future is to provide an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Dita is the one who is standing. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 38-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a printing shop. He is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all the family members. Shabana has been running her own beauty salon for the past six years. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e. creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business. Therefore, Shabana has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Shabana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics to increase her parlor business

loans.name: Yuli

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Yuli. Yuli lives in a city in East Java, located about two hours from Jakarta by plane. She is happily married and together with her husband, they have two children. Yuli owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories. She joined Ruma almost a year ago and was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she wanted to expand her business using technology. Yuli is a hardworking woman and her community sees her as a trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Yuli needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far apart they are. Yuli’s goal towards Ruma in the near future, is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, using Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Yuli is the one who is standing in her stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 37-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store for the past six years.  Zahida's husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of their entire family. 

Zahida's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities for his business, such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items. But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products to resell. Therefore Zahida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also be helpful for him to earn additional profitable income to manage their household and business. 

Zahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her husband in increasing his general store business

loans.name: Fiapito

texts.en: Fiapito is a 43-year-old mother with nine children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community to earn a living. Fiapito has requested a loan to buy fishing gear, fishing net, an ice bag, container, canoe, and torch to help her run the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. Fiapito became a member of SPBD in 2007. She will use her profit to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear, fishing net, an ice bag, container, canoe, and torch

loans.name: Yunuke

texts.en:
Yunuke is 54 years old, married to Momanyi, and is blessed with five children. She has been a dairy farmer for the last 12 years and earns a monthly income of KES 6,000 from the business.

Yunuke has used her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to add to her income from the supply of milk to her customers. She plans to use the generated profits to educate her children.

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to add to her income from the supply of milk to her customers.

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn is 23 years old and married with two children. With one of her children in school, Jennylyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jennylyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like beverages, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Jennylyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, shampoo, coffee, toothpaste, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Jennylyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like beverages, eggs, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 33 years old and married with three children. With all of her children in school, Marife works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, liquor, home care products, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, beverages, condiments, coffee, soap, candies, biscuits, and other groceries. 

In the future, Marife would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, liquor, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Vaione

texts.en:
Vaione is a 43-year-old mother with 2 children. She has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a  year. 

Vaione has requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her with running the business. Vaione hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2008.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Her name is Chona, 52, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Felizardo, an OFW, and has two children, one of whom is in High School and the other one in Elementary Level. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment the family income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her children to school. 

Chona operates a small general store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store that sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as rice, canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are her family's source to meet their daily expense and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Chona hopes to maintain and grow her business and to improve their quality of living. She desires to always have a harmonious and happy family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 45 years old and married with one child.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, dried fish, home care products and other groceries.

Nilda has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Nilda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, dried fish, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is happy to serve her customers in her meat vending business. She is 38 years old, married and has three kids. Two of her kids are in school -  one in college and the other in high school. Maricel's husband is her partner in managing and growing their meat vending business. They have run the business for ten years and hopes it will last as their main source of income. Maricel wants to borrow a loan of PHP50,000 to buy meat such as chicken, pork, beef, and fish to sell. Maricel and her husband are doing their best to manage their business well to assure that it is productive. Maricel and her husband are striving to provide for the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy meat such as chicken, pork, beef, and fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two cattle

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 39 years old, married to Eucabeth, and blessed with four children. He has been both a cafe operator and a farmer for the last 12 years.  He earns a monthly income of KES. 13,000 from the businesses.

Charles applied his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow, which will increase his income from the greater supply of milk available to his customers. He plans to use the generated profits to educate his children.

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase his income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for groceries, toiletries, cell phone cases and prepaid phone cards to sell

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is 55 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Prescila is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Prescila has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Zaria

texts.en: Zaria is a 41 year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. His rickshaw has not been working properly. As a result, he is unable to generate any income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. Therefore Zaria has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Zaria is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband repair his rickshaw

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 61 years old and has eight children. Rosa is married, and one of her children is in school.

Rosa is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosa requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosa has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina and her husband manage a bakery business. They purely make and sell hot bread. In order to sell their bread faster, aside from their vendors, Divina and her husband also sell bread around their nearby villages. Divina plans to get a stall in the market to better identify their homemade breads. 

Therefore, Divina is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and other ingredients used in making bread. Divina hopes to increase her income from her business, and soon will fulfill her plans.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and other ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase his income from the supply of milk to his clients.

loans.name: Odessa

texts.en:
Odessa is 40 years old. She is the mother of two children whom she is presently sending to school. Her husband is a former OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) who worked abroad. She invested her remittance in a dry goods business when her husband worked abroad. 

Now, she and her husband manage their dry goods business, which is selling of variety of clothes. They also offer a package deal of catering services and gowns for rent for weddings, debuts, and any other occasion. 

Odessa wants to avail herself of a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy clothes and other materials needed for their business. Odessa hopes that someday, they will have more customers to serve and increase their income as well for the future of their children.

loans.use: to buy clothes and other materials needed for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase his income from the supply of milk to his clients.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 41-year-old woman and mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession, selling fruits such as apples, bananas, and grapes. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Shaheen's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose so that he can grow his business, improve his sales and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business. Therefore, Shaheen has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase fruit for reselling

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.en:
Rosaura is 59 years old and has one child. Rosaura is a married woman.

Rosaura is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosaura requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosaura has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Rosaura would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Zaheena

texts.en:
Zaheena is a 47-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. Unfortunately, his rickshaw is not working properly because her husband is unable to generate enough income to conduct proper repairs. Her husband wants to do this as soon as possible.

However, due to the lack of money her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Zaheena has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

This will help him to continue his business. Zaheena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his rickshaw.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 44 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like cigarettes, beverages, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, eggs, and mineral water. 

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like cigarettes, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise is 31 years old. She is married with two children aged 3 and 6 years who do not yet to go school. She owns a butcher shop, and she has been in a business for the past two years, while her husband is a driver. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more goats to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house and improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 26 years old and married with two children. Sheila works very hard to provide for them.

Sheila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Sheila has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, condiments, candies, vinegar, junk foods, soy sauce and other groceries. 

In the future, Sheila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sonia is 52 years old now.

Sonia has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines. Sonia requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell in her business.

Sonia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Sonia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell in her business

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah has completely repaid the first loan which he received from Kiva lenders. He is very thankful for Kiva lenders for the loan which helped him increase his income as well as his profits. 

Abdullah has applied for a second loan of 300,000 YER from Kiva to purchase more stock to expand his business. This loan will help Abdullah to attract new customers that will help him increase his profits. The profits from this loan will help him to provide his family with a better living condition. 

His house needs renovation from the inside and he hopes that in the coming months he will be able to make that renovation. Abdullah looks forward to purchasing a vehicle to use it for his business. He hopes this loan will be funded also.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to expand his business .

loans.name: Liberathe

texts.en: Liberathe is 61 years old. She is married with one child who has 18 years and goes to school. She sells vegetables, and she has been in a business for the past 14 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cabbages and tomatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. In the future, she wishes to earn at least 200,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, age 48, is a mother of five children. She has been running a knitting business, which is the only source of income for the family. She needs to purchase a new variety of knitting material to resell. However due to lack of money, she finds it difficult. This will help her to offer more variety to her customers and to continue her work efficiently and professionally. For that reason, Parveen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her family.

She will purchase knitting accessories and a new variety of knitting materials. Parveen is feeling happy that she will be able to be helped with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her knitting business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 29 years old and married. She has two children, eight and four years old respectively, of whom she supports. Regina has been growing vegetables for ten years now. She is taking her first loan to purchase farm inputs.

Regina intends to use anticipated profit to expand her current business. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is 46 years old. She is married with 8 children aged between 3 and 23 years, 7 of whom are in school. Her husband is a business man. 

Therese owns a shop and she has been in this business for the past 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, she aims to earn at least 400,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres La Bendicion Group

texts.es:
María (la primera del lado izquierdo de blusa blanca) una mujer de 37 años, esta simplemente juntado con su esposo con el que tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre nueve y veinte años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá. 
María una madre de familia dedicada y entregada con sus hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración de ropas típicas desde hace 15 años, ella cuenta que gracias a esta labor ha logrado mantener a su familia.
María ahora quiere mejorar sus servicios y ofrecerle a la clientela una mejor calidad de producto, comprando hilos, de diferentes estilos y colores pero con lo que ella gana no le alcanza para comprar sus materiales, pero ella con el afán  de mejorar sus ingresos a organizado a un grupo de mujeres, para solicitar un crédito que lo utilizara para comprar hilos de seda, alemán mish y lustrina.
El gran sueño de María es poder comprar más máquinas de coser para mejorar aún más sus servico.
texts.en:
María (the first from the left in the white blouse) is 37 years old. She lives is in a common-law marriage with her husband, with whom she has a beautiful family of three children, ages nine to twenty years. They live in the community of Sololá. 

María is a dedicated and devoted mother. She has been making traditional clothing for 15 years. She explains that thanks to this work she has been able to support her family. María now wishes to improve her services and offer her clients a better quality product. She wants to buy different colors and styles of threads, but what she earns isn’t sufficient to buy the materials. But with an eagerness to improve her income, she has organized a group of women in order to request a loan that she will use to buy silk threads, German thread, and embroidery threads. 

María’s greatest dream is to be able to buy more sewing machines so she can improve her services even more.

loans.use: to buy silk threads, German thread, and embroidery threads.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel es un hombre de 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre dieciséis y veinticinco, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Samuel es un hombre trabajador y honrado, el para generar sus ingresos y poyar a su familia se dedica a varias actividades pues tiene varias habilidades este admirable hombre es albañil, soldador, electricista, y carpintero toda estas labores los desempeña según la necesidad en su momento, pero en la actividad que más se ha destaca es la albañilería pues tiene ya 18 años de desempeñarlo.
Samuel ahora quiere mejorar el lugar donde se prepara los alimentos que es la cocina, pero lamentablemente él no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder realizar la remodelación que su cocina necesita por lo que a considerado necesario un crédito que lo utilizara para comprar un gabinete de cocina y lavamanos para mejor presentación de la cocina.
Samuel sueña con construir una casa de terraza y comprar un mototaxi.
texts.en:
Samuel is a 42 year old man, he is married and he has a nice family with four children, aged between 16 and 25. They live in a community of Sololá.
Samuel is a hard-working and honest man. To generate an income and support his family, he has various occupations, as he has several skills. This remarkable man is a construction worker, welder, electrician, and carpenter. He does all of this work depending on what is needed at the moment, but the occupation in which he stands out is construction, as he has been doing it for 18 years.
Samuel now wants to improve the place where he prepares food, which is the kitchen, but unfortunately he does not have enough money to be able to do the remodeling that his kitchen needs. This is why he thinks it is necessary to get a loan, which he will use to buy a kitchen cabinet and sink to improve the appearance of his kitchen. 
Samuel dreams of building a house with a terrace and to buy a mototaxi (a motorcycle with a cabin to transport people).

loans.use: to  purchase a kitchen cabinet and sink to improve the appearance of his kitchen.

loans.name: Sofia Dávila Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOFIA DAVILA” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Primitiva es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: carnicería, taller mecánico, venta de frutas, venta de polleras, servicio de té, venta de comida, venta de regalos. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Primitiva es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de carnicería; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, ya que conocía la forma de trabajo de un empleo anterior que tenía, cuando decide guardar un capital emprende su negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la facilidad de la obtención del crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Sofia Davila” communal bank began its seventh loan cycle at Pro Mujer, at the Panamericana offices. It’s made up of nine members and is led by a leadership group of which Primitiva is the president. The business that the loan group members own are various, among them:  butcher shop, car repair shop, fruit sales, selling traditional skirts, tea service, food sales, and gift shop.

The loan they will obtain will benefit the small business owners in the group where Primitiva is a member. She explains that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago. She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a butcher shop business. She says that she started this business several years ago. She learned the work from a previous job that she had. She decided to save her money to start a business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital (buying meat at whole sale price), which she will obtain from sellers in the city of El Alto and then sell in her shop. This work allows her to generate income to support her family economically. She lives with her partner and has three children.

When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys the ease of obtaining the loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy meat at wholesale price.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 30 years old. She is married with three children between one and eight years old and all of them go to school. She owns a shop and she has been in business for the past five years. Her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy sugar, soap and Colgate to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school for her children.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and Colgate to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia Erika se dedica al trabajo como cantante,la socia anima diferentes eventos como matrimonios y cumpleaños,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Erika works as a singer by performing at different events, such as weddings and birthday parties. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. Through this business, she is able to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to open a grocery store. She is requesting a loan in order to buy sound equipment for her home.

Erika is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for her home.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a 45-year-old mother from the Kisumu region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She supports five people in her family.

Nelly has a tailoring stall which she has been operating for the last 10 years and which generates a monthly income of KES 12,000. She is taking out her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase clothing materials. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her current business.

Nelly's dream is to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing material for making full dresses for her customers

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 42 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 4 and 8 years old, and all of them go to school. 

Francine owns a shop, and she has been in this business for the past 13 years. Her husband drives a motorcycle. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house. 

In the future, she aims to earn at least 200,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 21 years old, married and has one child.

Eden is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm equipment. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 32 years old. She is married with three children aged 4 and 8, and they all go to school. 

Jeanne owns a shop, and she has been in this business for the past 4 years. Her husband is a business man. With the loan, she would like to buy items such as rice, salt and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will used to increase her savings. 

In the future, she aims to earn at least 400,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy items such as rice, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 30-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a printing shop, and he is the guardian of the family and responsible for meeting the needs of all the family members. Shabana has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years, so she also contributes her income, with that of her husband, towards managing the household.
 
Shabana now needs to buy different types of cosmetics and other accessories for her beauty salon, for example creams and hair brushes, but due to financial constraints she is not able to buy these items for her business. She has therefore applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn maximum profitable income to meet the needs of her business and family.

Shabana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance .

loans.use: to increase her beauty salon business

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr: Etant mariée, Brigitte est âgée de 52 ans et habite avec son mari et son enfant dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Brigitte vend de la boisson dans une boutique pour avoir son économie. Grâce  ce commerce Brigitte trouve le bénéfice nécessaire afin d’aider son mari à subvenir aux charges de la famille. Brigitte s’approvisionne une fois par semaine auprès de ses fournisseurs. Brigitte demande ce prêt pour commander des casiers de boissons. Grâce au bénéfice, Brigitte souhaite favoriser l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Brigitte is a 52-year-old married woman, who lives with her husband and child in the district of Adidogome. Brigitte sells beverages in a shop to generate her own income. 

Thanks to her business Brigitte's earnings help her husband provide for family expenditures. She stocks up once a week from her suppliers.

Brigitte is requesting this loan to order cases of beverages. She wants to use the profits to ensure her child's education.

loans.use: buy 29 cases of beverages

loans.name: Yamen

texts.en:
Yamen is a 31 year old Palestinian painter who lives with his wife and two daughters in a refugee camp located in North Lebanon. His wife is unemployed and his daughters and two and four years old. Yamen's hard work is therefore essential in providing his family with decent living conditions especially with his second daughter starting school next year. 
He has been working as a house painter inside the camp for more than 10 years now and his professionalism and honesty have allowed him to maintain a respectable reputation among his many clients. 
Yamen is asking for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He is planning on using the loan to buy a new steel ladder to replace the one he has been using for several years. The new ladder will allow him to work more efficiently in a safer environment.

loans.use: to buy a new steel ladder to improve his productivity

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en: Muborak is a hardworking woman who was born in 1968. She is married and has four children. She is planning to open a new business keeping livestock. She wants to buy cheaper cattle and sell it for an extra price in the domestic market. She considers that if she starts a new business, it would help her to live better. Muborak is a kind, honest and helpful person. She is first in business but knows how to keep livestock. She has experience keeping livestock from her childhood. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy calves. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is 36 years old. She is married with two children who are five and seven years old and both of them go to school. She owns a bakery and she has been in business for the past four years. Her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy sugar and baking powder to make bread to  sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school for her children.

loans.use: To buy sugar and baking powder to make bread to sell.

loans.name: Belancille

texts.en: Belancille is 33 years old. She is married with two children between one and three years old and not yet in school. She owns a shop and she has been in business for the past 11 years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, salt and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house and increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mercedes is 50 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Mercedes has a sewing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her sewing business.

Mercedes has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Mercedes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Juan David un muchacho de 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Juan David un joven disciplinado y perseverante que lucha por sus sueños, el para apoyar a sus padres se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 2 años en un lugar muy lejano de su comunidad, él cuenta que gracias a esta actividad ha logrado mejorar sus ingresos.
Juan David desde hace algún tiempo había decidido construir su dormitorio pues él no cuenta con un lugar donde poder descansar cunado llega a su casa, aunque este humilde joven ha buscado toda la forma de poder construir su dormitorio no lo ha logrado, por lo que ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, arena, cal y hierro.
El gran anhelo de Juan David es poder construir poco a poco su casa, para que cuando decida formar una familia tenga ya donde acogerlos.
texts.en:
Juan David is a young man of 32, he lives with his parents in a community in Suchitepéquez. Juan David is a disciplined and persevering young man who fights to achieve his dreams. To support his parents he has been working as a builder for 2 years in a place very far from where he lives. He says that thanks to this job he has been able to improve his income. 

Juan David decided a while ago to build a bedroom for himself because he has no space to rest when he gets home. Although this humble young man has tried hard to find a way to build his bedroom he has not succeeded, which is why he has now taken the decision to request a loan that he will use to buy cement, sand, lime and iron. Juan David's greatest wish is to be able to build a house for himself bit by bit, so that when he decided to set up a family he will have a place to house them.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, lime and iron to build a bedroom.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose es de la ciudad de Caacupé, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, tiene una despensa copetín en donde trabaja y se esfuerza por poder salir adelante con su familia. El comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder comprar golosinas para su copetín.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para la compra de golosinas y comestibles varios para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en: Jose is from the city of Caacupe.  He is a very hard-working, enterprising person who runs a small store where he strives and makes every effort to provide for his family.  He says the previous loan was used to buy a variety of sweets and groceries to continue with sales.  He is grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: To buy a variety of sweets and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy henna for resale.

loans.name: Apostol Santiago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “APOSTOL SANTIAGO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paola es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de mantas, venta de CD y DVD’s, venta de zapatos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paola es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que fue a su domicilio a invitarle. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su amiga, ya que trabajaba con estos productos, ella le aconsejo en la forma de adquisición y forma de venta de los mismos. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos por mayor) que adquirirá de vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido de la cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “APOSTOL SANTIAGO” [St. James the Apostle] is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II centre. The group has eight members and is run by a management committee whose president is señora Paola. The businesses run by the members of this communal bank are varied, including: sale of vegetables, food sales, sale of blankets, DVD and CD sales, shoe sales.

The loan they wish to take out will benefit these small microenterprises, one of which is run by señora Paola. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a woman advisor who came to her house to invite her to join. At present, she has a business selling cosmetics; she says that she learnt this business from a friend who worked with these products and advised her how to purchase and sell them. 

The loan she wishes to take out is to increase her stock (purchase of wholesale cosmetics) that she will buy from women who sell wholesale in the city of La Paz and she will subsequently sell them to clients who have ordered them. 

This way of working enables her to generate income to financially support her family, as she is single with one child. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cosmetics

loans.name: Edo Kayissan

texts.fr: Edo Kayissan une femme de 40ans se bat pour apporter son aide à son enfant de 17ans qui est scolarisé. En 2013, elle a ouvert un bar dans lequel elle vend des boissons à ses clients. Elle demande un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Edo Kayissan souhaite agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Edo Kayissan is a 40-year-old woman who works hard to support her 17-year-old child who is still in school.  In 2013, she opened a bar where she sells drinks to her customers.

Edo Kayissan has requested her first loan to buy merchandise for her bar.  She would like to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 30 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. She is a farmer and grows maize and vegetables to sell, a business she has done for the last 10 years. 

She will be using the loan to purchase energy saving cooking stoves to sell and make more income. She will be able to pay school fees and also buy more farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer from the income generated.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to provide the basic needs to the family and live a prosperous life.

loans.use: To purchase energy saving cook stoves to sell and make more income to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 41 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a buy and sell of beverages business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy soft drinks, etc. to sell in her stall.

Thelma has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell in her stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: increase his working capital and buy lots of soap and a large amount of salt for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 44 years old and has five children. Phoebe is married woman and two of her children are still in school.

Phoebe is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm equipment.

Phoebe has been farming for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She would like to save enough to buy more farm land and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm equipment

loans.name: Awovi

texts.fr: Awovi est femme mariée qui est âgée de 33 ans et vit à Adidogomé. Awovi vit avec ses cinq enfants. Awovi vend des produits d’alimentations générales et des poissons fumés dans son quartier pour avoir son revenu. Ce commerce lui procure une rentabilité nécessaire pour assurer la survie quotidienne de ses enfants et leur éducation. Awovi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des poissons et des gombos, Awovi demande ce prêt pour la réalisation de son objectif et augmenter sa rentabilité
texts.en:
Awovi is a 33-year-old married woman living in Adidogome with her five children.

Awovi sells general food products and smoked fish in her neighborhood to generate income. This business ensures sufficient profitability to ensure her children's daily subsistence as well as their education. Awovi resupplies twice a month at the market.

Awovi is requesting this loan to buy fish and okra, so she can reach her goals and increase her profitability.

loans.use: buy seven baskets of fish and 27 bags of okra

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy many items of clothing for resale.

loans.name: 17 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “17 DE OCTUBRE” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Petrona es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: carnicería, taller mecánico, venta de frutas, venta de polleras, servicio de té, venta de comida, venta de regalos. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Petrona es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, ya que conocía la forma de trabajo de un empleo anterior que tenía, decide guardar un capital para emprender su negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra conservas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "17 de Octubre" is starting its tenth loan cycle through Pro Mujer, which is part of the Panamericana Social Center.  The group has eight members and its president is Petrona.  The businesses carried out by the members are varied and include: a butcher store, a mechanic workshop, fruit sales, skirt sales, tea service, food sales and gift sales.

The loan will benefit small business owners, including Petrona who has been in Pro Mujer for six years.  She joined by invitation through a friend who is a customer of the institution.  Petrona currently runs a neighborhodd store which she started several years ago.  She learned about this type of work through a previous job, saved her money and decided to open her own business.

The loan she is requesting now is to increase her work capital to buy wholesale canned goods from vendors in the city of El Alto.  She will sell the goods at her store, which will allow her to generate income to support her family economically.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says its the savings offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy wholesale canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more repair parts for his business.

loans.name: Wildo

texts.es:
El Sr. Wildo tiene 33 años,  está acompañado con Claudia con quien tiene dos hijos, quienes son su razón de ser y de lucha. Él se dedica a la compra y venta de combustibles (nafta eco y especial) que lo vuelve a vender a sus clientes en zonas rurales, ya tiene muy buena clientela, y comenta que con su trabajo lucha por poder dar a su familia todo lo que el no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar combustibles en cantidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
