Wildo, 33, and his partner, Claudia, have two children who are their motivation in life.  He buys and sells fuel (eco and special petrol) to customers in rural areas where he has many good customers.  He says that through his work he wants to give his family everything he could not have.

The loan he is requesting is to buy sizeable amounts of fuel to continue the sales work he is doing.

loans.use: To buy a sizeable amount of fuel to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: CARLOS ALBERTO: Es un señor sonriente, jovial, de 33 años de edad, casado con una hija de 8 años de edad que estudia su primer grado. Trabaja en una empresa de Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas como técnico electricista,  desde hace 3 años le han prestado un cuarto para vivir. Con el propósito de tener su propia vivienda y bridarle a su familia un lugar digno, cómodo y seguro donde vivir, está solicitando un préstamo a para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, zinc, clavo y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida y velar por la educación de su hijita.
texts.en: Carlos Alberto, 33, is a smiling, cheerful man who is married and has an eight-year-old daughter in first grade.  He works at a company in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas as an electrician.   For three years they have loaned him a room to live in.  But in order to have his own house and give his family a dignifified, comfortable and safe place to live, he is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as wood, metal sheeting and nails; and to pay labor costs.  His dream is to improve his quality of lfie and insure his daughter gets an education.

loans.use: To buy construction materials: wood, metal sheeting and nails; and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.en:
Ursulina is 49 years old and married with five children.

Ursulina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ursulina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the raising of pigs business for three years and also earns an income from her general store.

Ursulina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El Sr. Pablo es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es casado, tiene 5 hijos mayores, que junto a su esposa ha podido mantener y sacar adelante. Pablo tiene una fábrica de ladrillo, donde produce más de 80 mil ladrillos en forma mensual.
Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere poder ayudar a sus seres queridos, es por ello que está esforzándose cada día. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar tierra y leña, de manera a poder seguir haciendo los ladrillos para la venta.
texts.en:
Pablo is from the city of Encarnacion.  He is married and has five adult children.  Together with his wife he has been able to support and provide for the family.  Pablo has a brick factory where he produces over 80,000 bricks a month.

He is a very hard worker and struggles to help his loved ones every day.  He is requesting a loan to buy clay and firewood to continue making bricks to sell.

loans.use: To buy clay and firewood to make bricks.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana vive en la ciudad de Paraguarí, ella tiene 62 años es comerciante, tiene una despensa bien surtida es única en la zona. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, y viene luchando para poder tener más adelante una vejez digna.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, panificados, carne y otros, de manera a poder seguir cumpliendo con las demandas de sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the city of Paraguarí. She is 62 years old and is a businesswoman. Her well-stocked shop is the only one in the area. She is a very hardworking woman and she has been fighting hard in order to be able to enjoy a decent old age later on.  

She is asking for this loan in order to buy various supplies for her shop such as: vegetables, fruit, bread and meat among other things. This will allow her to continue to satisfy her clients' demands. She is grateful for this opportunity that will allow her to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, bread and meat among other things

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ñepytyvo está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que se unió con la esperanza de poder mejorar sus vidas por medio del trabajo unido.
La señora Hilda, una de las integrantes, junto con su marido se ayudan para ayudar a su familia con una olería que tienen, ella independientemente trabaja como Empleada Doméstica en una casa de familia, esto demuestra que tiene un espíritu emprendedor.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar arcilla y leña, y con ello poder seguir con su olería, el cual es el sostén de su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Ñepytyvo is in its 1st loan cycle with the women's committee program. It is a new group whose members came together with the hope that they could improve their lives by working together.  

Hilda is one of the group's members. She works together with her husband in a brick-making workshop they have in order to support their family. She also works independently as a housekeeper in a family home, which demonstrates her enterprising spirit.  

She is asking for this loan to buy clay and firewood, which will allow her to continue working in her brick-making workshop which is what provides for the family.

loans.use: to buy clay and firewood.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 37 years old, married and is blessed with two children. She has been operating as a wholesaler for the past six years and earns a monthly income of KES 12,000 per month.

Josephine has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to increase her supply of milk for more income. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to open more wholesale businesses.

Her future plan is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase her supply of milk.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydia, a 50-year-old mother and farmer from Kiangondu, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her children as a primary caregiver. For the past 30 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, poultry and keeping dairy cows. Lydia has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Lydia never received any formal employment but this hasn't killed the spirit she had of succeeding in life. “I have to do something for my family," she said. Lydia is requesting a loan to buy an egg incubator. An incubator is used to keep eggs uniformly warm and moist as it would be under a hen’s tummy. Through this loan Lydia will be able to hatch eggs of a rare breed. Lydia will be able to sell the chicks to her neighbours and to the local market. An improved income level will assure her family a secure future. 

By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets. Lydia believes that if female smallholder farmers had the same access to capital as men, world poverty would be reduced in half.

loans.use: to buy an egg incubator.

loans.name: Jennifer Lucila

texts.es: JENNIFER LUCILA: Es una joven amable, sonriente de 23 años de edad, originaria de Bilwi, Municipio d Puerto Cabezas, soltera, vive en la  casa de sus padres. Es una joven luchadora, con deseos de superación, desde su niñez habita en una vivienda de tambo y madera. Con el propósito de apoyar a sus padres a mejorar su humilde vivienda, solicita su primer financiamiento para cambiar postes de madera y la estructura de la vivienda, comprar materiales de construcción: madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña con contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres y en un futuro construir su propia de vivienda de concreto, ya que es de mayor durabilidad y seguridad.
texts.en: JENNIFER LUCILA is a friendly young and smiling woman. She is 23 years old and from Bilwi, municipality of Puerto Cabezas. She is single and lives in her parents' house. She is a fighter who wants to get ahead. Since she was a child she has lived in a wooden house on stilts. With the aim of helping her parents improve their humble home, she is asking for her first loan to change the wooden posts and the house' structure by buying construction materials such as planed wood, nails and to pay for the labor costs. She dreams of contributing to a better quality of life for her parents and in the future to build her own home out of concrete, because it is more stable and safer.

loans.use: to help her parents improve their humble home.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de Ciudad del Este, se llama Kuña Kyrey, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas y cada una de ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar.
Virginia, una de las integrantes de este grupo, según su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostró un nivel de pobreza extrema. Ella se dedica como peluquera, ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, creativa y es capaz de emprender un negocio y tener éxito. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para poder surtir su negocio y poder dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, como ser: shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y luchando.
texts.en:
This group is from Ciudad del Este and calls itself Kuña Kyrey. They are part of the poverty-elimination program, where each and every one of the women is making her best effort to be able to grow and improve. 

Virginia, one of the members of this group, demonstrated a level of extreme poverty according to her poverty-elimination survey. She works as a hairdresser. She is characterized as an enterprising and creative woman and she is capable of starting a business and being successful.

She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase various items to stock her business and to allow her to give her clients better service. Among the items are: shampoo, hair rinse products, dyes, conditioners, and others. She appreciates the opportunity that she receives to be able to continue growing and fighting.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, hair rinse products, dyes, conditioners, and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
Las 17 mujeres que integran este grupo forman el comité llamado Mujeres En Acción está en su ciclo número 26º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. En  la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza todas  se encuentran en el nivel 3 de  la línea de pobreza.
Una persona que se destaca por trabajar y luchar, es la Sra. Nilda, quien vende prendas de todo tipo y muy variada. Ella es muy trabajadora y se esfuerza siempre por poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, short, camisillas, pantalones, polleras, toalla, etc. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y luchando.
texts.en:
The 17 women that make up this group are a part of the committee called Mujeres En Acción. It is in its 26th cycle in the women's committee, where they all work and help each other to get ahead. In the poverty elimination survey, all of them are on level 3 of the poverty line.

One person who stands out for working and being a fighter is Nilda. She sells all types of varied clothing. She is very hardworking and always strives to be able to help her family and her loved ones. She is asking for this loan to buy t-shirts, shorts, tank tops, pants, skirts, towels, etc. She is grateful for the opportunity she is getting to be able to keep growing and fighting.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shorts, tank tops, pants, skirts, towels, etc.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Antonio está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una situación de pobreza extrema, pero luchan y se esfuerzan por poder salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lucia quien tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy tarde en la noche. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada que quiere esforzarse por poder mejorar cada día.
Lucia pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, frutas, lácteos, panificados, y otros, de manera a poder seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que piden. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
The San Antonio group is in its 1rst cycle of the women's committee. All of the are doing the poverty elimination, and 4 members are below the poverty line, that is, in extreme poverty. But they fight and strive every day to get ahead.  

One of the members is Lucia, who has a store where she works every day since the very early hours in the morning until very late at night. She is a very hardworking and dedicated person who wants to strive to improve every day.

Lucia is asking for this loan to be able to buy vegetables, meat, fruit, dairy products, baked goods and more, so that she can keep giving her customers everything they ask for. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to continue with her micro-enterprise.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruit, dairy products, baked goods and more.

loans.name: Kabuswa Moricho Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Joyce, a member of Kabuswa Moricho group. She is 31-years-old, married and has four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. She does maize and bean farming. She has learnt and gained more experience in enterprise start-up and development. Joyce also learnt skills in financial management which has helped her manage her finances well. She is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs such as hybrid seeds and fertilizer. This will enable her to increase the crop yield, thus meeting the demand of maize and beans in her locality and improving her income which will help her educate her children. 

Joyce is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and increase productivity, hence more income.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Kuña Guapa, ya que todas se esfuerzan por poder crecer y salir adelante, también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder mejorar sus vidas por medio de su trabajo unido.
La Sra. Analia , una de las integrantes, solicita este préstamo para la compra de variedad y más cantidad de materiales que sirven para la elaboración de los bijouteries, como ser canutillos, hilos, pinzas y otros, ya que ella se dedica a ello.
Cabe destacar que este grupo ha trabajado y logrado unirse más entre las integrantes, han aprendido a trabajar entre todas para cumplir con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The group is named Kuña Guapa ("beautiful woman") since all of the members work hard to be able to grow and get ahead. They also make up part of the program to eliminate poverty so they are able to improve their lives by working together.

Analia, one of the members, is requesting this loan to buy a variety and a greater quantity of materials that are used to make jewelry such as beads, wires, clamps, and other items since she is dedicated to this.

It is notable that this group has worked and managed to join together more among the members. They have learned to work to together to make their payments.

loans.use: to buy beads, wires, clamps, and other items to make jewelry.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Aldo es una persona muy trabajadora, es vendedor ambulante, y por medio de su trabajo esta luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en la compra de insumos para la venta, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
El manifiesta que le ha sido de mucha ayuda formar parte de la fundación paraguaya. Hoy pide este préstamo para la compra de frazadas, manteles y sabanas y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Aldo is a very hardworking person. He is a street vendor that is fighting hard in order to be able to improve his and his family's living conditions. He describes how he used his previous loan to buy supplies to later sell and that this was very helpful. 

He indicates that being a member of fundación paraguaya has really helped him. Now he is asking for this loan in order to buy blankets, tablecloths and sheets among other things, which will allow him to carry on selling and striving every day to improve his situation.

loans.use: to buy blankets, tablecloths and sheets among other things

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.es:
Victoriana trabaja con un grupo de señoras en la elaboración de miel de caña dulce, es de la ciudad de Pilar, está casada y tiene 3 hijos y también es docente de la escuela de la zona.
 Es una persona muy trabajadora, con buenas referencias  comerciales,  buen movimiento en su negocio y una amplia clientela.- 
 Solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio en la compra de materia prima consistente en caña dulce para poder seguir haciendo su miel de caña.
texts.en:
Victoriana works with a group of women to make honey from sugar cane. She is from the city of Pilar. She's married and has three children and also is a teacher in her area's school.

She is a very hard working person with good commercial references, good movement with her business and a large number of customers. She is requesting the loan to invest in her business by purchasing raw materials consisting of sugar cane to be able to keep making cane honey.

loans.use: to buy sugar cane to make honey.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Oñondivepa, se formó en la ciudad de Luque, son 18 mujeres, que forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permite conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar para mejorarlo.
Elsa tiene un modesto copetín en el que trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, vende todo tipo de productos, y con ello tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Elsa está poniendo todo de sí para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de comestibles, golosinas, bebidas y otros, para poder surtir su copetín y con ello poder seguir con su emprendimiento como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group is named Oñondivepa. It was formed in the city of Luque by 18 women who are part of a poverty elimination program that allows them to learn each one's living situation and accordingly work to improve it.

Elsa has a modest store where she works every day from the early hours. She sells all types of products and, with that, has the means to be able to help her family and her loved ones. Elsa is putting forth her all in order to improve her living conditions. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of consumable products, candies, drinks and other items to be able to stock her store and thus be able to keep going with her business as it's been going.

loans.use: to buy consumables, candies, drinks and other items.

loans.name: La Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Milagrosa es un grupo nuevo, que tiene las esperanzas de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del trabajo unido de todas. 
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes de este grupo, además es la tesorera, ella se destaca por el trabajo arduo que siempre hace, todo esto para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Ella vende prendas variadas, y con ello quiere salir adelante e ir mejorando.
Maria pide este préstamo para la compra de remeras, short, camisas, entre otras cosas, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y luchando por mejorar cada día. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group "La Milagrosa" (the miraculous one) is a new group that has hopes of being able to improve their living conditions through all working together. Maria is one of the members of this group, as well as the treasurer. She stands out through the hard work she always performs in order to be able to improve her living conditions and that of her family. She sells a variety of clothing and with this desires to get ahead and keep improving.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy shirts, shorts, blouses, among other items, so she can keep up her sales and continue to work hard to improve every day. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to grow and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts, blouses, among other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Valientes se llama este grupo, es de la ciudad de  San Ignacio, ellas demuestran unidad y solidaridad entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, y están esforzándose cada día por ser mejores.
La Sra. Cynthia es la presidenta del grupo, es estudiante y también está trabajando en la venta de joyas. Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, quiere emplear el préstamo para la compra de joyas y su respectiva venta, de tal forma a poder generar ingresos para solventar sus estudios, y también poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante y dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que no pudo tener.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Valientes" (courageous women) is the name of this group. They are from the city of San Ignacio. They show unity and solidarity among them. They work together on activities and work hard every day to be better.

Cynthia is the president of the group. She is a student and also is working by selling jewelry. She is a very hard working person. She wishes to use the loan to buy and later sell jewelry so she can generate income to pay for her education and also be able to help her family.

She is a very hard working and entrepreneurial woman who wishes to get ahead and give her loved one all that she couldn't have.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es: FLORENCIO: Es un señor afable de 41 años de edad, originario de Bilwi, Municipio de Puerto Cabezas, de la etnia miskita, está casado, tiene 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria.  Con el propósito de celebrarle el cumpleaños a su hijo, solicita financiamiento para comprarle ropa, calzado, pastel, debido a que con su bajo salario no le alcanza. El y su esposa sueñas con reparar su vivienda de tambo y madera.
texts.en: Florencio is a good-natured man, 41 years old, originally from Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas municipality, of Miskita ethnicity.  He is married and has 3 adolescent children who are in primary and secondary school. With the goal of celebrating his son's birthday, he asks for a loan to purchase clothing, shoes, and a cake for him, since with his low salary, he doesn't have enough. He and his wife dream of being able to repair their stilt house made of wood.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes for his son who will have a birthday.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras es de la ciudad de San  Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, manifiestan que están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres para que puedan ellas aumentar sus ingresos y ser cada vez más independientes.
La Señora Mariela es la presidenta del grupo, ella vive con su Marido y  sus 2 hijas, en  la casa colaboran en el desarrollo y el crecimiento del nivel de vida de la familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de lencerías y cosméticos, y por medio de sus ventas, ayuda a su marido en mantener su casa y  a sus seres queridos.
 La Señora Solicita  este crédito para invertir en su negocio que es la venta de lencerías y cosméticos, ya que tiene mucho éxito con sus ventas. Ella desea progresar cada día más y gracia al programa está logrando sus objetivos.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Emprendedoras" (entrepreneurial women) is from the city of San Ignacio. They are united and work together on activities. They say they are satisfied and feel the support of the program of the committee of women so they can expand their income and be more independent each time.

Mariela is the president of the group. She lives with her husband and her two daughters. At home they collaborate in the development and growth of the family's living conditions. She is dedicated to selling lingerie and cosmetics and, through her sales, she helps her husband support the family and their loved ones.

Mariela is requesting this loan to invest in her business selling lingerie and cosmetics since she's had a lot of success with her sales. She wishes to progress each day more and, thanks to the program, is achieving her objectives.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: La Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité LAS EMPRENDEDORAS está en su ciclo número 3º del programa de comité de mujeres y son actualmente 18 integrantes, donde desarrollan el trabajo en equipo y la ayuda solidaria. A todas ya se les ha aplicado el semáforo de eliminación de la pobreza.
La Sra. Filometa  es una  las integrantes quien se dedica a la venta de planta, es una mujer muy trabajadora, se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, con la cual tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y seres queridos. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar semillas, abonos, bolsas, insecticidas  entre otros elementos que le ayudan a producir las plantas quien posterior mente lo venderá.  Ella es una persona que no se deja vencer pese a los contratiempos que surgen en el día a día, y también siempre trata de poder ayudar a sus compañeras del grupo, incentivándolas a luchar.
texts.en:
The LAS EMPRENDEDORAS committee is in its third loan cycle in the women's committee program and currently has 18 members, where they develop the work as a team and with mutual help.  All of them have already completed the poverty elimination tool.

Filometa is one of the members who works selling plants. She is a very hard-working woman, she has developed a very good customer base, with which she has the means to be able to help her family and loved ones. She asks for this loan to be able to purchase seeds, manure, bags, insecticide, and other things that will help her to produce the plants that later she will sell. She is a person who doesn't let herself be beaten despite the setbacks that come up day to day, and she also tries to be able to help her group-mates, motivating them to struggle.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, bags, insecticide, and other things.

loans.name: Ara Pyahu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ara Pyahu está en su ciclo número 6° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 17 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que todas están en un nivel de pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cipriana, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta ropas está luchando y esforzándose por poder mejorar sus vidas y ayudar a su familia. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha por capacitarse y crecer cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, como remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y con ello luchar por su familia.
texts.en:
The Ara Pyahu group is in its 6th loan cycle in the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other get ahead. They are completing the poverty elimination questionnaire, where 17 are below the poverty live, which is to say they are all at a level of extreme poverty.

One of the members is Cipriana who, through her efforts and continuous work, and through her sales of clothing, is fighting and working hard to be able to improve their lives and help her family. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who fights to train herself and grow each day.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase various clothing to sell, such as t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, and more, so that she can continue with her sales as she has been doing, and with that, fight for her family.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, and more.

loans.name: Jackylou

texts.en:
Jackylou is a hard working entrepreneur from Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is single, 32 years old and has been managing a fish farming business for eight years already. Her earnings helped meet her and her parents everyday needs and expenditures.

Fish farming has gained popularity due to the increased global need for fish as healthy and nutritious food. Farmers in the Asian countries enjoy raising fish as livestock because it requires minimal land for a high profit. Catfish is the second most important freshwater food in the Philippines. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 17,000 monthly.

Jackylou is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan assistance to purchase and raise various kinds fish such as milk fish, carblets and shrimps. She is encouraged by an increasing demand at the market for fish. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial aid that will be given her for it will be a big help in their daily sustenance.

She aims to grow her business and have a permanent store in the town market. She prays for good health, long life for her parents and to have a quiet and victorious life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy fish to harvest and sell.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 38 years old and married. She has four children aged 13, 10, 8 and 4 years who she supports.

Florida has been running a retail shop for four years now. 

She has applied for her second loan to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, beans and matchboxes to sell to her customers.

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hope and dream is to open another business.

loans.use: to purchase stock like sugar, rice, beans and matchboxes

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rhea has been in this business for 5 years. Rhea earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rhea has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 51 years old and has four children. Zenaida is married and has one child in school.

Zenaida is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Zenaida has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Telma

texts.es: TELMA: Es una mujer indígena de 58 años de edad, que pertenece a la etnia miskita, es originaria de Puerto Cabezas. Es alegre y luchadora, tiene 58 años de edad, casada con siete hijos: 5 son mayores de edad, el de 21 años estudia su carrera universitaria y el menor de 14 años cursa su quinto año de secundaria.  Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de utensilios y artículos plásticos para el hogar y peluches usados, en el corredor de su vivienda. Ante la dificultad de no tener garantías materiales, para acceder al crédito formó parte del grupo solidario Alwani, en lengua Miskita significa (TRUENO). Ahora que ha ido mejorando sus ingresos, ha ido adquiriendo bienes materiales como electrodomésticos que ya puede poner en garantía, por lo que se ha desligado del Grupo Solidario y está solicitando su primer crédito individual para comprar en Managua: Una paca de peluche, trastes plásticos, chinelas, tinas, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa, tener su propia local.
texts.en:
Telma is an indigenous woman, 58 years old, who is of the Miskita ethnicity, and is from Puerto Cabezas. She is cheerful and determined. She is 58 years old, married, with seven children, 5 are adults, the 21-year-old is studying at the university and the younger one, age 14, is in his fifth year of secondary school. For the past 8 years, she has worked selling utensils and plastic items for the home, and used stuffed animals, on the outdoor walkway of her house. Confronted with the difficulty of not having material guarantees, to access a loan, she became part of the communal bank group Alwanki, a Miskita word that means thunder.

Now that she has been improving her income, she has been acquiring material goods such as household appliances that she can put as guarantee, so she has left the communal bank group and is asking for her first individual loan to purchase a bundle of stuffed animals, plastic dishes, sandals, dyes, and other products in Managua. Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman, and to have her own retail space.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of stuffed animals, plastic dishes, sandals, dyes, and other products in Managua.

loans.name: Finny

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Finny. Finny lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her two daughters. 

Finny owns a stall that sells female outfits and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income so they can save more money for their children’s education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. 

As the business grows, Finny needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. 

Finny’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community; Ruma’s latest product called 'Mapan'. 

As seen in the photo, Finny is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit

loans.name: Siyeng's Group

texts.en:
A mother of five children living in Kratie province, Siyeng is 36 years old. For her family’s support, she grows cassava as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. She leads a group of three to get new loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Zeledon

texts.es: ZELEDON: Es un señor luchador de 55 años de edad, originario de Bilwi, Municipio de Puerto Cabezas, casado con 7 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Su esposa es ama de casa. Debido a que con su salario como vigilante no le ajusta para mejorar su vivienda de tambo y madera. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar poco a poco materiales de construcción: Bloques, madera y clavos. Sueña con tener su vivienda de concreto (cemento), ya que es de mayor durabilidad y para brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Zeledon is a determined man, 55 years old, from Bilwi, in Puerto Cabezas municipality. He is married with 7 adolescent children who go to primary and secondary school. His wife is a housewife. Due to his salary as a security guard not being enough to make improvements to his stilt house made of wood, he is asking for a loan to purchase construction materials bit by bit: cement blocks, wood, and nails. He dreams of having a cement house, since it is more durable and to offer more security for his family.

loans.use: to improve his stilt house made of wood.

loans.name: Lusya

texts.en:
Lusya is in agribusiness. Specifically, Lusya keeps a cow, 9 pigs and 20 piglets. She lives with her younger son Tigran, who helps his mother with farming activities. 

Lusya's husband and two elder children are migrant workers in a neighboring country. Besides farming work, Lusya also works at a local kindergarten. Due to her hard work, Lusya efficiently implements her farming business.

She has now applied for this loan to purchase oxen and forage for feeding the livestock; this will enlarge her livestock.
 
Because this is Lusya's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for five oxen and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Residing living in Kratie province, Srey is 48 years old and a mother of five children. She can earn income to support her living via growing tobacco and rice on a seven hectares area. She can earn income about 40,600 KHR per day. 

This is Srey's third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid back her past loans successfully. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. 

She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her tobacco farm. 

She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family's living more.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her tobacco farm.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza lives in Kampala. She is married with six children; two go to school. She has two additional family members (grandchildren). She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, utilities and school fees.

Tereza is a poultry farmer and operates her business from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 23 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy chicks, poultry feed and vaccines. 

Her business challenges include poultry diseases. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land. .

loans.use: to buy chicks, poultry feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 63-year-old mother from Kakamega region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is widow who she supports seven people in her family and was blessed with six children.

She has a second-hand clothes stall that has been operating for the last 20 years and generates a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She is taking her fourth loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to purchase clothes. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the current business.

Her dream is expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 37 years old, married and he and his wife are blessed with two children. He ha been practicing dairy farming for the last five years and earns KES 12,000 per month.

Shadrack has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to increase milk supply to his clients. He plans to use the generated profits to educate his children.

His future hopes are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase milk supply.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alina is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

Alina has a buy and sell beauty products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional products to sell like lipstick, etc..

In the future, Alina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell like lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cresencia is 60 years old now.

Cresencia has a seafood vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional seafood to sell on her food stall like shrimp, etc..

She has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Cresencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional seafood to sell on her food stall like shrimp.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita, 56, is a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Angelita has a buy and sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Angelita has been in this business for six years. 

Angelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy clothes to sell.
 
In the future, Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: Yesenia de 33 años de edad es madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 3,11 y 14 años. Desde hace 18 años, adquirió su expereincia comercial, proveniente de la tradición transmitida por su madre tambien fiel representante de su oficio como comerciante. Yesenia usa como su estrategia el respeto y gran carisma que de si misma emana para generar una clientela estable y fiel.   Su principal sueño de prosperidad es tener su propia casa y lograr apoyar a sus hijos en la educación universitaria, para responder al desafio de mejorar su nivel de vida. En la actualidad está aplicano a un credikiva, mediat el cual comprará Productos varios, poncheras, canastos, y ropa en general, con esta inversión Yesenia mejorará su oferta haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Yesenia, 33 years old, is the mother of 3 children ages 3, 11, and 14. For the past 18 years, she has gained commercial experience from a tradition carried on from her mother, who also is a loyal representative of her job as a salesperson. Yesenia uses as her strategy respect and a great charisma that emanates from her to generate a stable and loyal customer base. Her primary dream for prosperity is to have her own house and manage to support her children in their university education to respond to the challenge of improving her standard of living.  Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan with which she will purchase a variety of products, basins, baskets, and general clothing. With this investment, Yesenia will improve her offerings, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products, basins, baskets, and general clothing.

loans.name: Sokkhet's Group

texts.en:
Sokkhet, 40, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kratie province. She is a mother of five children, three of whom are in school and other one is too young. To support her family, she grows cassava and works for others for a fee to earn more income. 

This is the fourth cycle for Sokkhet with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. She leads a group of three to get new loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get a greater yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en:
Amalya and her family live in Taperakan village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband, father-in-law and grandmother-in-law. 

Years ago, Amalya and her family were struggling like many farmers in Armenia to earn a living. Their farm was poor and all the available resources were used for survival and basic living costs and nothing remained to invest in a farming business at that time. After hard and tireless work, Amalya and her family were able to reestablish their farm. They keep thirty chicken and grow apples. 

Amalya's family also owns a grape orchard, which needs to be re-constructed. That's the reason why Amalya is asking for this loan. She plans to pay for reconstruction of the grape orchard and cover renting costs for a tractor and purchase fuel and fertilizer for the farm. 

As this is Amalya's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

This enthusiastic and hard working farmer waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay renting costs for a tractor, purchase fuel and fertilizer and start the re-construction of the grape orchard.

loans.name: Komezimihigo Group

texts.en:
Komezimihigo is a group led by Annonciatte who is 45 years old. The group name means “Aim high” in English. 

She is married with seven children aged between 6 and 20 years. She has a shop and has been doing this business for the past 15 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is married and has three children who all go to school. She also takes care of her sister. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for business premises. 

She sells motor spare parts. She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis only for six days a week. She generates additional income through rental houses. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy motor spare parts. Her major business challenges include the high cost of operation. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to start importing spare parts.

loans.use: to buy motor spare parts.

loans.name: Natali

texts.es:
La socia  Natali pertenece al banco comunal LAS INMACULADAS.
La socia continua dedicándose  al negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua elaborando  diferentes platos como caldo de gallina y caldo de cordero, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, arroz, carnes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Natali belongs to the communal bank LAS INMACULADAS. She sells food. She has worked in this for years, and she is doing very well thanks to her daily hard work. She prepares different dishes such as chicken soup and lamb stew, and this is the way she supports her family. Natali is requesting the loan to buy oil, rice, meats, among other things. She is grateful for the loan, and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, meats, among other things.

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan that she used for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help for the schooling of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for the maintenance of her jeepney. It is important that her vehicle is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service and steady income. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She thanks God for a good turnout of her transport service and the financial aid that will be given her.

Mamerta dreams to own another jeepney to improve her income. She prays for love and unity in her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 30 years old. He is a married with two children. He does farming. He has been in the business for 15 years. His monthly income is 18,000 Kenya shillings, which he uses to support his children.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for use on his farm for better yields. 

He plans to use the profits to educate his children.

In future he hopes to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Benialita

texts.en:
Benialita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Benialita is 59 years old now

She has a buy and sell accessories business in the Philippines. Benialita has been in this business for 10 years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like bracelets, watches, rings, etc.

In the future, Benialita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase necklaces, bracelets, watches and rings to sell.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 27 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 3 and 8 years; they all go to school. 

She sells sorghum, and she has been in a business for the past five years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. 

In future, she wishes to earn at least 500,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum

loans.name: Duterimbere Group

texts.en:
This group is called Duterimbere, which means “vision” in English. They sell various products and they wish to expand their businesses for building their better future. 

Bonifride is a group leader, age 37. She is married and has four children between 3 and 8 years old. She has a shop and has been doing a business for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 42 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school. Editha is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Editha has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Elesia

texts.en:
Elesia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elesia is 48 years old now.

Elesia has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber to use in her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber to use in her business

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Battambang province, Ren is 41 years old and a mother of five children. She grows rice as the main source of income. Moreover, she can earn extra income via teaching in school. 

For Ren, this is her fifth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She is leading a group of two to get new loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides, rice seeds and pay the  plowing fee. She hopes that she can get more income to buy a decent motor.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, rice seeds and pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Battambang province, Thy is 60 years old and a mother of three dependent children.  She grows rice as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has involved this business for ages, and it earns her about 27,600 KHR per day. This is her eighth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. 

In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and pay for the plowing fee. 

She hopes that she can get more income to buy a decent motor.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Grendel

texts.es: GRENDEL: Es una mujer luchadora, originaria de Bilwi, Municipio de Puerto Cabezas, pertenece a la etnia Miskita. Es madre soltera de 3 hijos: uno es mayor de edad e independiente, el de 27 años estudia su carrera universitaria y el menor de 9 años cursa su quinto grado de primaria. Con el propósito de brindarle a sus hijos una vivienda segura y digna, solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: bloques, cemento, hierro, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es construir su vivienda de concreto con todas las condiciones necesaria para el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en: Grendel is a fighter.  She is original from Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. Her ethnicity is Miskita.  She is a single mother to three children.   One is now an independent adult.  The 27 year old is studying at the university and the youngest is 9 years old and in 5th grade of primary school.  With the goal of providing a safe and dignified house to her children, she requests financing to buy construction materials:  bricks, cement, iron, zinc, nails and cost of labor.  Her dream is to build a house of concrete with all the necessary conditions to ensure the well-being of her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materias: bricks, cement, iron, zinc, nails and cost of labor.

loans.name: Naran's Group

texts.en:
A local resident from Kratie province, Naran is 48 years old and a mother of three schoolchildren. She earns income via growing cassava and rice cropping. 

For Naran, this is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans. She leads a group of three members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Synuon's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Battambang province, Synuon is 34 years old and a mother of three schoolchildren. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn more income. 

For Synuon, this is her sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans successfully. She leads a group of five members to get new loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm. 

She hopes that she can get more income to update her family better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Ее зовут Назира. Ей 24 года. Она проживает в городе Душанбе. Она замужем и с мужем мечтает о ребенке. Назира умная, добрая и верующая девушка. Назира дома занимается шитьем одежды. Она обратилась за кредитом, потому что хочет купить больше ткани и швейных принадлежностей для расширения деятельности. Она верит, что ей не откажут в кредите, и она сможет купить необходимое количество тканей, сшить больше одежды и увеличить доходность.
texts.en:
This is Nazira. She is 24 and lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is married and she and her husband both dream of having children. She is an intelligent, kind and faithful young woman who sews clothing at home. 

Nazira is looking for a loan because she wants to buy more fabric and sewing accessories to expand her business. She believes that she won't be turned down for a loan and that she will be able to buy the necessary quantity of fabric so she can sew more clothing and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy sewing accessories and fabric

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS INMACULADAS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Patricia continua con su negocio de venta de pollipapas, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo en uno de los mercados de la zona, la socia es una persona responsable ye empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de papas, pollo entre otros.
texts.en:
Patricia belongs to the communal bank Las Imaculadas, the bank is located in the district of Santa Ana, in the province of La Convención and in the Cusco region.

Patricia is continuing with her food business selling chicken and chips, she feels very thankful for the offered loan and is committed to meeting her set repayments. 

Patricia continues to sell her food in one of the markets in the zone where she lives, she is a diligent and responsible woman, as a result she has been able to provide a future for her family. 

Patricia seeks this loan to buy potatoes and chickens, and other food supplies.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and chickens, and other food supplies.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last two years. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 900,000  from MCDT – SACCO to buy onions, tomatoes, carrots,oranges and pineapples. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her shop on a wholesale basis. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, carrots and oranges

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El socio Rafael pertenece al banco comunal LAS INMACULADAS, el socio continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida, el socio se siente agradecido  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, él socio continua elaborando  diferentes platos como caldo de gallina y caldo de cordero, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar productos como arroz, aceite entre otros.
texts.en:
Rafael is a member of the Las Inmaculadas communal bank. He still has his business selling food. He is grateful for the loan and he is committed to making his payments.

He is still making different dishes such as chicken soup and lamb soup. By doing this he helps his family get ahead. He is requesting the loan to buy products such as rice and oil, among others.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and other supplies.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El socio Ignacio  pertenece al banco comunal LAS INMACULADAS ,el socio continua  dedicándose  al negocio de venta de pollipapas,el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para  de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar pollos,aceitre entre otros.
texts.en:
The partner that Ignacio belongs to is the communal bank Las Inmaculadas, and he continues engaging in the business of selling pollipapas. He brings good time to his business, which is doing well thanks to the effort that he puts every day into his business. Ignacio wants to continue working in this way to continue supporting his family.

Ignacio is requesting a loan to buy chicken and oil, among others.

loans.use: to buy chickens, oil, etc.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a 25-year-old mother of one child. She is married to Meshack, who is a businessman, and he supports the family by providing income. She also supports seven members of her family. She has a food stall in Kisumu town and makes a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more food stock, such as vegetables, rice and flour, as well as tables and plastics seats. This will enable her to serve more customers and make more income. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her business, make more income and support the family.

loans.use: to buy food stock, such as rice, flour and vegetables, and serve more customers and increase her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase the amount of milk supply for more income gain.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 36-year-old married man with three children. He has had a retail shop business for four years. He will  use the loan to purchase rice, flour, sugar and cooking oil and hopes this will help him to earn more income to buy more stock of flour, milk, bread and paraffin. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to improve his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, sugar and cooking oil..

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is a single woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aiza is 24 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Aiza has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Aiza requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Aiza has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvira is 43 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Elvira has a buying and selling of beauty products business in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy roll-on, lipstick and other items.

Elvira has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy roll-on, lipstick and other items

loans.name: Cerena

texts.en:
Cerena is a married woman with 4 children.  She works hard to support her family.

She has a sugar cane business  and a earns additional income raising pigs. Cerena requests15,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her  sugar cane business.

Cerena has sustained her business activities through 6 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
Samnang is a 29-year-old  mother with three children, one attends school.   They live in a rural area of the Battambang province. 

She raises pigs as her main source of income. This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid  her previousl loans. She leads a 2-member group and will spend her loan portion to buy piglets. 

She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Garukurebe Group

texts.en:
Garukurebe is a group led by Xaverine, who is 38 years old. The group name means “Come and see” in English. Xaverine is married and has two children, 1 and 5 years old and not yet in school. 

She sells clothes and has been doing business for the past six years. The group members sell various items but they have the same idea for changing their lives. 

With the loan, she would like to buy shirts and skirts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and make savings.

loans.use: To buy shirts and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 44 года, в разводе, 2 детей. У Бактыгул высшее образование, работает секретарем. С 2005 года в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством на участке мерою 1,0 Га, выращивая арбузы и рис. Бактыгул известна, как ответственный, честный, порядочный и добросовестный человек. Ее ежемесячная прибыль доходит до 20,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений. Расширение бизнеса позволит накопить на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en:
Baktygul is 44 and divorced with two children. She has a higher education and works as a secretary. Since 2005 she has also been working in agriculture as an additional source of income. She has 1 hectare of land where she grows watermelon and rice. She is known as a responsible, honest, fair and kindhearted person. Her monthly income is up to 20,000 KGS.

In order to further develop her business, Baktygul has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase seeds and fertilizers. An expansion of her business will allow her to save toward purchasing a car.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds in order to grow organic rice and watermelons

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 35 years old. She is married and has four children between age 5 and 16 years. All of them go to school. 

She sells clothes and she has been in business for the past two years. Her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 41 years old, married to Mackline and blessed with four children. He has been in a dairy business for the last five years, and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 11,000.

Stephen has applied for his first loan of KES 25,0000 from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to buy a cow to enable him to get school fees to educate his children. His plan is to use the gained profit to repay the loan and start a retail shop.

His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a cow to enable him to get school fees to educate his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase kale, tomatoes, onions, English potatoes and fruit.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 37-years-old lady from Manyatta (in Kisumu city) which is  in the western part of Kenya. She is married and supports two people in her family.

She has a butche4 shop which has operated forfive years and generates a monthly income of 12,000 KES. she has applied for her first loan with VISION FUND KENYA LTD to purchase raw meat other shop items in bulk.   She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business  to provide for her family's needs.

Her dream is to have a big business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase a new balance scale.

loans.name: Resty Ian

texts.en:
Resty Ian is a 37-year-old married man. He and his wife have managed a restaurant in their town for  two years and earn a daily net income of  1,500 PHP.

He has insufficient capital to run his business and would like  a 10,000 PHP loan to pay for the expansion of his new business. He's hoping that his business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for the expansion of his new business.

loans.name: Nanyingae

texts.en:
Nanyingae is a 29 year old female and married. She has five people that she supports.

Nanyingae grows and sells wheat and potatoes, a business she has done for the last eight years. She is taking her 8th loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase fertilizers, seedlings and chemicals to use in her farm .

She intends to use the anticipated profit to expand her current business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand into large scale farming.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase milk supply for more income.

loans.name: Degiena

texts.en:
Degiena works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a  personal care product business for 3 years.  She earns additional income growing rice.

Degiena requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase toothpaste, soap, and shampoo.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and married with one child who is in school. Gloria works very hard to provide for the family.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo, home care products and other groceries.

Gloria has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods and soft drinks. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Janette is 46 years old, and both children are still in school.

Janette has a farming of rice business in the Philippines. Janette requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Janette has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is from Ejmiatsin town, where she lives with her two daughters. Her elder daughter works, and her younger daughter Anush is a student at university. 

Gohar is employed in the private sector, and works day and night to sustain her family's living. 

To be able to cover her daughter Anush's university tuition, Gohar asks for this loan. She will be grateful if lenders support her with this loan, to enable Anush to study in university and get a higher education.
 
Gohar says: "The education of my children is the top priority."

loans.use: to pay for her daughter Anush's university tuition

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 45-year-old married woman with five children, 1 attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Emma has had a food vending business for 12 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 58 years old, widowed and has three children.

Juana is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farming materials and equipment.

Juana has been in business for fifteen years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farming materials and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Edgar Santiago

texts.es:
Edgar  es un joven de 19 años de edad es ecuatoriano ,  es soltero , gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio de sus padres pudo terminar la secundaria  y desde muy joven ha trabajado muy duro para poder ayudar a su madre y hermanos, hoy en día Edgar vive con su familia en casa de sus familiares ya que vienen de escasos recursos económicos, él se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida típica como guatitas, secos de pollos, etc la persona que lo ayuda en este negocio es su madre los dos tienen un pequeño puesto cerca del mercado central de la ciudad de Latacunga. 
A pesar de todo el tiene un negocio estable y sobre todo con muy buena clientela, ya que el lugar donde está ubicado es muy concurrido y existe mucha afluencia de gente de todas partes, este es un trabajo que demanda mucho esfuerzo y tiempo sobre esto el se dedica mucho para poder salir adelante y  sobresalir en esta vida, el arte de la cocina lo aprendió de su madre, prepara exclusivamente platos fuertes como guatita, secos de pollo, caldo de pollo, secos de carne.   Gracias a todo lo que Edgar  ha hecho su negocio es propio y lo tiene un año. 
Su estado civil lo ha llevado a vivir de manera independiente un año y medio, su vivienda se encuentra ubicada en el Barrio El Bosque el  misma que está en la  ciudad de Latacunga en la provincia de Cotopaxi un sector urbano de la ciudad
Edgar  agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral ya que él invertirá en la compra de materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en:
Edgar is a 19 year old, single Ecuadorian young man.  Thanks to the efforts and sacrifice of his parents he was able to finish secondary school. Since he was very young he has worked very hard to help his mother and siblings. Currently, Edgar lives with his family, who come from scarce economic means. 

He makes a living through the preparation and sales of typical food such as beef tripe stew, chicken stews, etc.  The person who helps him is his mother.  The two have a small stand close to the central marker in the city of Latacunga.  

Despite everything, the business is stable and above all, has a very good clientele, as the location is well-traveled and there is a wealth of people from all parts.  This is a job that requires a lot of effort and time.  He dedicates a lot to it to be able to move forward and get ahead in life.  He learned the art of cooking from his mother.  He exclusively prepares entrees such as beef tripe stew, chicken stew, chicken broth, and meat stew.  Thanks to all that Edgar has done in his business, it is his own and he has had it for one year.  

HIs marital status has led him to live independently for a year and a half.  His home is located in the El Bosque neighborhood, in the city of Latacunga and the province of Cotopaxi, in an urban sector of the city.  

Edgar thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the possibility of growing professionally, as he will invest the money in raw materials for his business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: María Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi, de 55 años de edad, está soltera, tiene 3 hijas, pero todas están casadas y solo una de ellas vive e su casa.

Deysi, se dedica a elaborar pan francés y pan dulce en horno artesanal; el pan elaborado en horno artesanal es mucho más sabroso que el elaborado en horno industrial, pero también es más trabajoso.- Deysi, se ha dedicado a esto toda su vida, gracias a su trabajo logro criar a sus hijas y ahora quiere crecer como negocio.

Deysi, necesita el crédito para comprar harina, azúcar, levadura para elaborar pan, ella quiere producir más y también modernizar un poco sus condiciones de trabajo.

Deysi, sueña con hacer crecer su  negocio de pan,  ella quiere salir a vender su producto a las comunidad.- Quiere que su panadería sea reconocida por sus clientes y lograr tener un vida más tranquila y prospera.
texts.en:
Deysi is 55 years old, is single, and has three daughters, but all of them are married and only one of them lives at home.

Deysi makes a living making French bread and sweet bread in a handmade oven. The bread made in the handmade oven is much tastier than the bread made in an industrial oven, but it is also more work. Deysi has made a living in this all of her life, and thanks to her job has managed to raise her daughters and now wants to grow as a business.

Deysi needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, and yeast to make bread. She wants to produce more and also to modernize her work conditions a bit.

Her dream is to grow her bread business. She wants to go out and sell her product in the community. She wants her bakery to be recognized by her customers and to gain a more peaceful and prosperous life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and yeast to make bread.

loans.name: Melvin Noe

texts.es:
Melvin, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, no pudo continuar sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos de su familia, está acompañado y tiene 2 niños, su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa y a cuidar a los niños.
