Melvin, es un humilde y bondadoso campesino, que se dedica a la agricultura y también es corralero, él sabe hacer todo tipo de trabajo agrícola, por eso cuando tiene la oportunidad de trabajar la aprovecha al máximo, para poder sacar adelante a su familia.     

Melvin, necesita el crédito para poder comprar una vaca lechera de raza, con esto mejorara su patrimonio y la leche la venderá y así podrá obtener más ingresos.

Melvin y su compañera de vida anhelan, ver a sus hijos graduados de una carrera universitaria y están seguros que con ayuda y esfuerzo lograrán realizar sus sueños y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Melvin is 24 years old and studied up until 9th grade. He wasn't able to continue with his education because his family didn't have the economic resources.

Melvin has a partner and two children, his partner spends her time taking care of the children and household tasks. Melvin is a humble and caring country-man. He makes a living from farming and he can also work with horses. Melvin knows how to do all types of farm work, when he has the opportunity to work he makes the most of it, to ensure he can give his family a good life. 

Melvin needs a loan to be able to buy a purebred dairy cow, in this way he can improve his position. He can increase his income by selling the milk. Melvin and his partner long to see their children graduate from university one day. They feel confident that with support and hard work they can realize their dreams and improve thier quality of life.

loans.use: to be able to buy a purebred dairy cow.

loans.name: Oy

texts.en:
Oy, a farmer living in Kampong Cham province, is 47 years old and has four children. She grows rice  on two hectares area and earns additional income growing cassava. 

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully repaid her previous loan which  improved her living conditions at a gradual pace. 

She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed. She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Khmet

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Khmet is 43 years old and a mother of one child. 

She can earn income to support her family through rice cropping on an area of four hectares. This is her sixth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticide and pay labors fee. 

She hopes that she can get more income to renovate, update and improve her house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pesticide and pay labor fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her salon.

loans.name: Santo Francisco

texts.es: SANTO FRANCISCO: Es un señor cordial de 37 años de edad, casado con 4 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Debido a la falta de un empleo formal y con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 7 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Su sueño es comprar un motor de borda, para tener otra fuente de ingresos y alquilarlo como medio de transporte acuático.
texts.en: Santo Francisco is a friendly gentleman of 37 years, who is married with four adolescent children who study in primary school. Due to a lack of formal employment and in order to raise his family, seven years ago he established a small grocery store in the wood corridor of his home. He is asking for financing to buy basic grains and snacks among other products. His dream is to buy an outboard engine, to have another source of income and to rent it as a means of water transportation.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, among other products.

loans.name: Minto Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photograph is Evalyne, a member of Minto Women Group. She is married and has two children.

Having undertaken the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise creation and management, Evalyne decided to expand her maize and bean farming business. To facilitate this expansion, she is borrowing from Kiva in order to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. She trusts this will enable her to increase her harvest thus generating more income. This will put her in a position to provide for the basic necessities for her family with ease.

Evalyne is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs to increase her productivity and thus gain more income.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 32 years old with three children. With three children in school, Jenalyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like condiments, canned goods, home care products and other groceries. Jenalyn has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods, soft drinks etc.

In the future, She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like condiments, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is a married woman with three children. She is 37 years old and three of her children are presently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Maricar has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Maricar requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith, de 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, es originaria de la zona costera de El Salvador, es reconocida por la elaboración de cócteles de mariscos.

Edith, tiene una gran experiencia en la elaboración de cócteles, ya que desde su niñez realizó está actividad, ella vivió mucho tiempo en las playas de El Salvador y ha sido empleada de una coctelera por muchos años, hasta que decidió poner su propio negocio.

Ella desea comprar conchas, camarones, tomate, cebolla y chile para la elaboración de cócteles, ella quiere hacer cócteles de conchas y también de camarón para ofrecer variedad y diferentes sabores a sus clientes y obtener mayores utilidades.

Edith, planea hacer crecer su negocio desde su vivienda, para ahorrar y posteriormente trasladarse a un local más céntrico y más concurrido, donde pueda tener más clientes y ser reconocida en toda la ciudad  por la elaboración de los cócteles más exquisitos.
texts.en:
Edith, age 44, is a single mother with two children.  She is from the coastal region of El Salvador.  She is well-known for making seafood cocktails.  Edith has a lot of experience in making cocktails because she has been engaged in this business activity since she was a child.  She lived on the beaches of El Salvador for a long time, and she has been employed by a cocktail company for many years.  Then she decided to establish her own business.

She wishes to buy clams, shrimp, tomatoes, onions, and chili pepper in order to make cocktails.  She wants to make clam cocktails and shrimp cocktails in order to offer variety and different tastes to her customers and to get greater profits.

Edith plans to make her business grow from her house in order to save and later move to a more central and busier place.  By doing so, she will be able to have more customers.  She will be well-known throughout the whole city for making the most exquisite cocktails.

loans.use: to buy clams, shrimp, tomatoes, onions, and chili pepper in order to make seafood cocktails.

loans.name: Blerim

texts.en:
Blerim is married and the father of 2 children.

For the last 4 years, in order to earn a living he has been growing fruit such as apples and raspberries. He then sells the fruit, making him enough to provide for his family. Sometimes he has a lot of fruit to harvest and his wife helps him collect and ready them for sale. He really enjoys doing this and is grateful that his wife is able to help in addition to being home for the children. Currently he has over 1,500 apples and hopes that they will continue to increase in number.

At this time he is in need of a loan so he can purchase pesticides and guano for planting. He promises to pay on time and thanks all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and guano for planting.

loans.name: Roth

texts.en:
A mother of one child, living in Kampong Cham province, Roth is 22 years old. 

She grows cassava as the single main source of her income to support her family’s living. This is her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans, wisely improving her living conditions at a gradual pace. She will spend her entire loan portion to purchase pesticide and pay labors fee. 

She hopes that she can get more income to update and improve her house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pesticide and pay labors fees.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 22 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a hotel. Her husband sells different types of edible items e.g chicken karahi, beef karahi, matan karahi and etc. Her husband bears the sole responsibility of feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Nasreen's husband needs to purchase different types of edible and other items for his business so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to their unfavorable financial position her husband is not in a position to purchase these items for his business purposes.

Therefore Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will be able to help her husband purchase the above items for business purposes.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase edible items etc for her husband's hotel business.

loans.name: Azem

texts.en:
Azem is 33 years old and is married. He lives in an Ashkali community and like most there, has always lived under poor conditions.

In order to earn a living for his family, Azem had been working by transporting goods for others for a fee. However, it was a low salary and the work was not consistent so, 2 years ago, he started to also cut wood to sell to others. He thinks that by having 2 jobs, he will be able to improve his and his family's living conditions and he is happy to do the work.

Now, he is asking for a loan in order to purchase a machine used for cutting wood. His goal is to be able to eventually purchase a motor cultivator and also be able to transport the wood he cuts for more of a profit.

He promises to pay on time and thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a machine used for cutting wood

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is a capable and hardworking woman. She was born in a village into a family of workers in 1991.

Rano had five months experience working as a teacher in a government agency. Then, since 2013 she has worked as a teacher in a secondary school. She is teaching literature and the tajik language to students. She likes to work as a teacher and she loves her students.

Rano’s salary is not enough to renovate her house, so she requested a loan from Kiva lenders. She wants to buy cement, sand, and wood to renovate her house.

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cement, wood and sand to renovate her house.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 27 years old. She is not married with four children. She has had a farming business for 12 years. She will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs, and she hopes this will help her to pay her children's school fees.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a prosperous business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs with the hope that it will help her to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Norma works hard to support her family. She has a farming rice business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  Norma is borrowing 17,000 PHP through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), to  buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies for her rice farming  business. Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en: Sinat, 43, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia and is a mother of five children. For her family, she earns income by growing cassava on three hectares. This is the sixth loan for Sinat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. She leads a group of two members to get this new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Ajrije

texts.en:
Ajrije is very thankful to the Kiva lenders for the previous loan she was given, which she used to purchase food for the cow and calf. She is still selling the milk in her village and has been very satisfied with the loan results and the process. 

Now she is asking for a second loan, this time to purchase materials for her handicraft business. She had been making handicrafts as a way to increase her income, but up until now, she had been only completing orders and favors for her family. With the feedback she has gotten from everyone, she is confident she can sell her work in the community and make a profit. With the upcoming summer and spring seasons, she knows it is her chance to be busy and find customers. 

She works very hard to provide for her family and wants to thank the lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her handicraft business

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 50-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Shaheen is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to the management of the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods like needles, threads, pieces of cloth, and machine oil for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and also will be helpful for her in increasing monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie, 47, is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Her children are presently in school. For six years, Tessie has operated a business selling construction supplies in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy more construction supplies to sell such as sand, cement, gravel and other construction supplies. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more construction supplies to sell like sand, cement, gravel and other construction supplies

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merlinda is 52 years old, and both children are currently in school.

Merlinda has a rice farming business in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase sacks of fertilizers and farm supplies.

Merlinda has been in this business for 10 years and earns additional income from direct selling. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a member of Minto Women Group, is married and has eight children. A dairy farmer, she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training in enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her business management skills. 

Grace is requesting a loan to buy higher quality fodder for her cows. This will increase their milk production, helping Grace meet the increased demand for milk. She hopes this will increase her level of income in order to continue supporting her family and in the long run improve their living conditions.

Grace is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy quality fodder to increase milk production

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 24 years old, married, and has one child. He is a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, he earns a limited salary in the construction field specializing in painting to cover the needs and expenses of his family.


Kaled is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to renovate his house through applying necessary maintenance to his house's toilet. This loan will help to make it a healthier place for his family. In the future, he hopes to start working on his own to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain his house's toilet

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: FERNANDO: Es un hombre trabajador, cordial de 34 años de edad, originario de Puerto Cabezas de la etnia miskita, casado con 4 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Desde hace 12 años habita en una casa de tambo y madera que se encuentra en mal estado. Esta solicitando financiamiento para cambiar madera y comprar materiales de construcción: madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es construir su vivienda  de concreto (cemento) porque es de mayor durabilidad y para brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando is a hard-working, cordial 34 year old man.  He is from Puerto Cabezas, and is ethnically Miskita.  He is married with 4 adolescent children who study in primary and secondary school.  

For the past 12 years he has lived in a stilt (elevated) home made of wood, that is currently in bad condition.  He is requesting financing to change the wood and to buy construction materials such as planed timber, nails and to cover the costs of labor.  His dream is to construct a home of cement that will be more durable and give better security to his family.

loans.use: to change wood and buy construction materials such as planed wood, nails, and to cover the costs of labor.

loans.name: Paul's Group

texts.en:
"Paul is 28 years old and is often described as a very experienced farmer. He has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, Paul is representing his group of 11 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with the One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Paul's desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to study. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest he plans to rent more land to cultivate in.

Paul and his group will receive a total of 12 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Zekri

texts.en:
Zekri is 30 years old and single, living in the southern part of Kosovo with his family. He is very hardworking, and in order to earn a living he works as an auto painter. He has a workshop in his home, allowing him to provide his services rent free and save money. He has been in business for more than five years. With the experience he gained while working for others and now owning his business, he is confident in the quality and professionalism of his work. 

Now, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new paint machine. This machine has better technology and options than his current one, which he believes will allow him to be more effective and efficient at his work and to produce better quality products. He hopes in the future to be able to expand his business more, hiring employees and adding more services such as auto repair. He is very positive about his future and hopes to be able to start his own family in the near future. He is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a new paint machine

loans.name: Wilmer Alexander

texts.es: Wilmer, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado, reside en una aldea del municipio de trinidad Santa Bárbara junto a su esposa. Wilmer siempre se ha dedicado a obtener sus propios ingresos, anteriormente se dedicaba a producir lazos y matates de hilos. Actualmente, tiene un taller de zapatería donde elabora y vende calzado en general. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar materia prima como ser cuero, plantillas, pegamento, cordeles, hilo y otros que ocupa para la elaboración de calzado. Con esta inversión piensa en aumentar la producción y venta de calzado. Su meta es ampliar el negocio para obtener más ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 36 years old, married, and lives in a village in the municipality of Santa Bárbara with his wife. Wilmer has always been dedicated to making his own income. He was previously engaged in producing ties and other items from thread. Currently, he has a shoemaking workshop where he makes and sells footwear in general.

He decided to ask for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to purchase raw materials such as leather, templates, glue, string, thread, and others to use in making footwear. With this investment, he plans to increase production and sales of footwear. His goal is to expand his business to obtain more income and help his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as leather, templates, glue, string, thread, and others for making footwear.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia Teresa se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere salir adelante y sacar adelante su familia. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teresa works in agriculture. She is a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead and help out her family by working in this capacity. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is 48 years old and is married to Olwa, who is a farmer and supports the family. They have been blessed with two children, and she also supports three people in her family.

Risper has a tailoring stall which she has been operating for the last 10 years, and it has been profitable. She is taking her seventh loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase textile materials to make more clothes and dresses to sell. This will help Risper satisfy her customers' needs as well as make more income. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand the current business by buying more tailoring materials.

Her future hopes and dreams are to educate their children and open more tailoring businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth materials for her business to prosper

loans.name: Vergelita

texts.en:
Vergelita works hard to support her family. Vergelita is widowed and has a rice farming business in the Philippines.

Vergelita requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Vergelita has been in this business for 30 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm supllies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Pert's Group

texts.en:
Pert is 31 years old, and has two children. She lives in Kampong Cham province. She grows cassava and rice, which she has been doing for many years. She earns about 45,000 KHR per day. 

Pert requested her second loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizer and seed and pay the land fee.  Pert is the leader of a group of two. She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed and pay the land fee.

loans.name: Paytsar

texts.en:
Paytsar lives, works and studies in Ejmiatsin town. She is a teacher at a local school, and in addition to working, is getting her bachelor's degree in a university, in the pedagogical department. 

Despite her age (Paytsar is 51 years old), Paytsar perfectly manages to work, study and take care of the household.
 
She lives with her daughter, and her husband, a hairdresser by profession, is a migrant worker in a neighboring country.
 
Paytsar asks for this loan to be able to pay for her university tuition. She hopes for lenders' support, as getting a higher education degree is the top priority goal for her.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Dora Esther

texts.es:
Dora, de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, por la situación económica de su familia, desde muy pequeña se dedicó a trabajar, está casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tiene siete hijos y todos ellos ya tienen su propio hogar, ella vive con su esposo y además le ayuda en los estudios a uno de sus hijos.

Dora, se dedica a la elaboración de pan dulce, además tiene crianza de tilapia y una parcela de hortalizas, toda su vida se ha dedicado a estos negocios, aprendió todo eso, porque tenía la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia, todo esto lo hace en su casa, su esposo es su mayor apoyo en el negocio. 

Con el financiamiento ella comprará 3 quintales de comida para tilapia y pagara mano de obra para la siembra de caña de azúcar.
 
Dora, en un futuro desea ampliar su casa, también quiere poner una panadería en donde se elabore, toda clase de pan, para poder seguir ayudándole a su hijo en los estudios.
texts.en:
Dora is 54 years old and studied up to Grade 2. Due to the economic situation of her family she worked since she was young. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. She has 7 children and all of them have their own home. She lives with her husband and also helps with the studies of one of her children.

Dora works making sweet breads and also raises tilapia and has a vegetable plot. She has dedicated all her life to these businesses which she learned out of the need to have a source of income for herself and her family. She does all this at home and her husband supports her with the business.

She will use the loan to buy 3 quintals of feed for the tilapias and to pay for labor to plant sugar cane. Dora in the future wants to expand her house and also install a bakery where she can make all types of bread so she can continue to support her son in his studies.

loans.use: to buy 3 quintals of feed for tilapia and pay or labor to plant sugar cane.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA INMACULADA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Micaela se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz y papa, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "La Inmaculada" (The Immaculate). The communal bank is located in the district of Kosñipata, which belongs to the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco.

The member Micaela makes a living through her agriculture business. She has a plot of land for cultivation where she plants corn and potatoes. The member works from 8:00 am until 6 pm. She has been in this business for several years, and she does very well. Her dream is to expand her agriculture business.

The member is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is happy to receive this loan, and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA INMACULADA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Lucia  se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva maiz y pap, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the loan group “LA INMACULADA”. The group is located in the Kosñipata district in the province Paucartambo in the region of Cusco.

The member Lucia works in agriculture. She has some land where she grows corn and potatoes. She works from 6 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. She has been doing this for several years and it is going really well. Her dream is to expand her farmland. The member is asking for the loan to buy seeds and fertiliser. 

The member is happy to receive the loan and is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
El socio Sebastian se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte, el socio tiene un taxi donde hace servicio público, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Sebastian continues to work in transportation. He has a taxi with which he provides service to the public. He works from 6 am until 7 pm. He has been in this business for several years and things are going very well. His dream is to have a new car. He is requesting a loan to buy tires for his car. He is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of the loan.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA INMACULADA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Alejandrinase dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cacao y café, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the loan group “LA INMACULADA”. The group is located in the Kosñipata district in the province of Paucartambo in the region of Cusco.

Alejandrinase works in agriculture. She has some land where she grows cacao and coffee. The member works from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. She has been doing this for several years and it is going really well. Her dream is to expand her farmland. The member is asking for the loan in order to buy seeds and fertiliser.

The member is happy to receive the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Flor Catalina

texts.es:
Flor, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato, está casada y su pareja actualmente trabaja como agricultor, tiene un niño de 7 años de edad que está estudiando primer grado en la escuelita de su cantón.

Flor, se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y tamales, desde que tenía 19 años se dedica a dicha actividad, aprendió viendo a su madre como lo hacía, ya que ella era una de las mejores panaderas de su lugar, decidió dedicarse a este negocio, dada su situación económica en que se encontraba.- Antes de este negocio, solo se dedicaba a los oficios de su casa, su esposo le ayuda encender el horno, busca la leña y también se encarga de meter el pan al horno.

Con el préstamo comprará una bolsa de harina, un quintal de azúcar, huevos y levadura, para la elaboración del pan, también comprará gallinas para hacer 300 tamales que le han encargado. 
 
Ella en el futuro, desea tener una panadería más amplia, con más variedad de pan y además de eso poder tener un puesto de tamales todos los fines de semana, para poder sacar adelante su hijo junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Flor is 26 years old who studied through her 3rd year of university.  She is married and her partner works in agriculture.   She has a 7 year old son who is studying in first grade in the local school.

Flor has dedicated herself to selling sweet breads and tamales since she was 19 years old.  She learned by watching how her mother did it, as she was one of the best bakers in the area.  She decided to dedicate herself to this business, given the economic situation she was facing.  Before this business, she worked to complete all the household chores.  Her husband helps her to light the oven, search for firewood, and put the bread in the oven.  

With this loan she will buy a bag of flour, a 100 lb. bag of sugar, eggs and yeast to make bread.  She will also buy chickens to make 300 tamales that someone has requested.  

In the future, she would like to have a larger bakery, with a greater variety of breads.  She would also like to have a tamale stand on the weekends, to be able to help her husband and son get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a 100 lb. bag of sugar, eggs and yeast to make bread, and to buy chickens to make 300 tamales.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 42 years old, married and has three children.

She manages a store for income, selling grocery items to the people in her village. She wanted to increase her earnings. That is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to invest in her store. She will buy canned goods, biscuits, noodles and soft drinks to sell.

Someday, she hopes to gain a good income and continue generating good profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, noodles and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Masline

texts.en:
Masline is a 26-year-old lady from Kisumu. She supports two people in her family. She sells second-hand clothes, a business she has been doing for the last five years, generating a monthly income of KES 9,000.

Masline has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to add more stock.

Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to increase her working capital to add more stock of used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products like sugar, beans, rice, corm , bread, eggs, dairy products, cold cuts and cleaning products to stock her store.

loans.name: Jarius's Group

texts.en:
Jarius is a 70-year-old, proud father of 9 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Jarius has noticed that he has learnt a lot from farming training.

Jarius described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Jarius’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 43-year-old mother of nine children, who lives outside of the main Honiara city.

She has a small cocoa plantation and buys wet cocoa beans in order to make a living for her family. 

She currently uses copper to dry her wet beans, so Agnes requested a loan to buy material like nets, timber and nails in order to build a proper tool for drying cocoa beans. She has been a SPBD member since 2014. 

She believes that accessing more loans will enable her to build a proper drying shed for her cocoa beans and also to expand her business. Her future plan is provide a better education for her children and also to improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy material like nets, timber and nails in order to build a proper tool for drying cocoa beans.

loans.name: Tek's Group

texts.en:
Tek, 31, lives with family members in a rural area of the Siem Reap province. She is a mother of four dependent children, three of whom are in school and another who is too young. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice cropping, her main source of income. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her about 13,400 KHR per day. 

In a group of four, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can upgrade her family's living condition to promote good health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Jenna

texts.en:
Jenna is a 22-year-old married woman with 1 child, and lives in a community in central Honiara town.

She runs poultry business to earn a living and has been doing this for three years now. With her profit she managed to provide for her family's demands and also for her business as well.

Jenna now needs a loan to buy 100 more broiler chicks and their feeds such as starter, grower and finisher. Her business is growing and she believes that accessing a future loan will enable her to expand her poultry business and also provide a better living for her family. She has been an SPBD member since 2013.

loans.use: to pay for 100 broiler chicks and their feeds (starter, grower and finisher)

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the leader of her group. Rose is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Rose has been a farmer for more than 30 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this coming season, Rose is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 4.5 acres will be planted by Rose's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Akoko vit avec son conjoint et leur enfant de 02ans à Lomé. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et revend en même temps des produits cosmétiques et tissus. Son troisième crédit lui servira d'acheter des marchandises afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients. Elle espère bien élever son enfant avec les profits qu'elle va réaliser.
texts.en:
Akoko lives with her husband and their two-year-old child in Lomé. She's a trained hairdresser. At the same time, she resells cosmetics and fabrics.

Her third loan will be used to buy supplies in order to satisfy the needs of her customers. Thanks to the foreseen profits, she hopes to be able to raise her child properly.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, hair extensions, and fabrics

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman who engages in raising poultry. She raises and sells chickens to the locals in her area. She is 31 years old and a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol. 

She is asking for a loan to buy chicken feed and purchase materials for house repair. With this input, Lucia would be able to raise and sell more chicken and start earning higher income. She would be able to balance her finances and start to expand into another business venture.

Lucia dreams of expanding her current business to a sustainable level in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and purchase materials for house repair

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 25 years old married to Caroline. He has been a dairy farmer for the last two years, and the business earns a monthly income of KES 8,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to buy a cow to enable him supply milk to customers. He plans to use his resulting profit to repay the loan and start a cyber business. 

His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a cow to enable him to supply milk to customers and earn income to start a cyber business.

loans.name: Parsapiyio

texts.en:
Parsapiyio is 66 years old and married. He supports 10 people. He grows wheat, which he has been doing for 20 years. 

Parsapiyio requested his seventh loan, which he will use to purchase farm inputs. He intends to use the anticipated profit to expand his current business. In the future, he hopes to have a large scale farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Criste Luz

texts.es:
Criste, de 52 años de edad, es una señora luchadora, con alto espíritu de servicio y ánimos de superación muy concretos y realizables, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltera, pero tiene un hijo que se dedica a la albañilería. 

Criste, tuvo la oportunidad de aplicar en un programa impulsado por el gobierno, que le paga por la prestación de su servicio, desempeñándose como auxiliar de servicio, en donde realiza actividades de ordenanza en una clínica municipal, tiene 10 años de trabajo como auxiliar de servicio, su lugar de trabajo está a 500 metros de su casa y tiene horarios variables de acuerdo a la demanda en la clínica.

La vivienda en donde vive Criste con su familia, no está construida completamente y no presenta las condiciones de seguridad básicas, es por eso que junto con su hijo han decidido terminar de construir lo que hace falta. Está solicitando el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para empezar a trabajar antes que llegue la época lluviosa, aprovechando que su hijo es albañil y tiene la capacidad de realizar los trabajos que hacen falta; esto será de mucha ayuda en su hogar, porque estarán más seguros contra las condiciones ambientales de la zona.

Ella quiere ayudar su hijo para que tenga su propia casa, además de apoyar a su único nieto para que estudie y logre graduarse de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Criste, who is 52 years old, is a feisty lady with a spirit of service and desire to excel at specific and achievable goals. She studied through the ninth grade and is single, but she has one son who is a mason.

Criste had the opportunity to apply to a program sponsored by the government, which pays for her to work as a service assistant performing administrative tasks in a municipal clinic. She has ten years of experience working as a service assistant. Her workplace is 500 meters from her home and she works varying hours depending on demand at the clinic.

The house where Criste lives with her family is not completely built and does not meet basic safety requirements.  For this reason she has decided to finish construction with her son's help. She is requesting a loan to buy building materials so she can start working before the rainy season arrives. She is taking advantage of the fact that her son is a builder and can finish the jobs that still need to be done on the house. This will be helpful in their home because they will be safer from the environmental conditions of the area.

She wants to help her son acquire his own home, as well as help her only grandson go to school and graduate from a career college.

loans.use: buy building materials to finish building her house.

loans.name: Maria Anatolia

texts.es:
María, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y es madre de 3 hijas, 2 de ellas estudian y la ultima de 3 años se queda en casa.

María, se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa, mientras su esposo trabaja en estructuras metálicas desde hace varios años y en temporadas de cortar café, también se dedica a eso.

El crédito lo invertirá para comprar material metálicos para que su esposo continué con su trabajo.

El sueño de María, es que su esposo pueda ampliar su negocio de estructuras metálicas, para que esto pueda asegurar la educación y la calidad de vida de sus hijas.
texts.en: Maria is 38 years old. She studied up to sixth grade. She is married and has 3 daughters: two are studying, and the 3 year old stays at home. Maria works in household chores, while her husband works with metal structures. He has done this job for many years, and during the season of cutting coffee crops, he also works in it. She will use the loan to buy metal materials so that her husband continues with his job. Maria's dream is for her husband to expand his business of metal structures, so that this can assure their daughters' education and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy metal materials for her husband to continue with his job.

loans.name: Beatriz Elizabeth

texts.es:
Beatriz, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, creció con sus padres a quienes apoyaba en la agricultura, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 12 y 11 años de edad.

Beatriz, trabaja cuidando una casa desde hace 2 años, antes trabajaba en una venta de ropa y productos de lencería; para ambos trabajos, ha sido ella quien ha tomado la iniciativa, ya que su situación económica no era muy buena para ella y sus hijos.- Además, ha trabajado en la crianza de especies menores como cerdos y aves de corral.

Beatriz, está solicitando un crédito para comprar tres cerdos, también para comprar ropa de niños, jóvenes y adultos, con el cual comenzara a vender en la comunidad por las tardes, para poder seguir generando mejores ingresos económicos a su hogar.

Sueña con poder comprar un lote de tierra, para poder construir su propia casa, ya que actualmente vive en la casa donde trabaja. Además, quiere ayudarles a sus hijos en sus estudios y en lo que necesiten, para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 34 years old and studied through the ninth grade. She grew up with her parents who supported her by working in agriculture. Beatriz is a single mother of two children, ages 12 and 11.

Beatriz has been working as a housekeeper for two years. Prior to that, she sold clothes and lingerie products. She showed initiative in both of these jobs. However, the financial situation is not very good for her and her children. She also raised small animals, such as pigs and poultry.

Beatriz is requesting a loan in order to buy three pigs. She will also buy clothes for children, teenagers, and adults so that she can begin selling in the afternoons in her community. This will enable her to continue generating more income for her household.

Beatriz dreams of buying a plot of land so that she can build a house of her own. She currently lives at the home where she is employed. In addition, she wants to help her children with their studies and with their needs so that they can excel.

loans.use: to buy three pigs and clothes for children, teenagers, and adults that she can sell.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 59-year-old woman and mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a tea stall where he sells tea and doodh patti (a traditional chai beverage). Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Parveen's husband needs to purchase patti, milk, sugar and other items for his business so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales, and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in the condition to purchase these items for his business purposes. Therefore, Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband purchase the above items for his business. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tea stall offerings

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is 58 years old and has seven children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

John has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. John also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that John's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
Ann is 57 years old and has five children. She lives in Kampong Cham province. To support her family, she grows cassava on two hectares, which she has been doing for many years. She earns about 20,800 KHR per day. 

Ann requested her her eighth loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy pesticide to support her farmland. She is the leader of a group of two. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase pesticide

loans.name: Felix's Group

texts.en:
Felix is 72 years old and has seven children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Felix has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to feed his family and, although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Felix also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Felix's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
In a small store, Khaled sells various kinds of ready-made women's clothes in one of Haja, Yemen's clothes markets. The summer season is coming soon, and most women will go to purchase thin clothes. Khaled has a lot of winter clothes, but the customers don't need them these days. 

He applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB in order to buy various kinds of ready-made women's clothes for his store in order to expand his business. This loan will enable Khaled to fetch stylish and new summer clothes, and then he will be able to meet his customers' demands. His profits will increase, and he will be able to create jobs in his community. 

The loan will support Khaled to rent a better apartment, because his first one is very small and far from his business. This business is the sole source of income for Khaled's family and by this loan, he can support them with a suitable living condition.

Khaled hopes to open a shoe store for both women and men alongside his first one to expand his business even more.

loans.use: To buy various kinds of ready-made women's clothes for his store to expand his business.

loans.name: Lucio Walter

texts.es: LUCIO WALTER: Es originario de Waspam; es un señor emprendedor, tiene 55 años de edad, casado con 4 hijos: 1 mayor de edad y tres adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Debido a la falta de un empleo formal, desde hace 26 años estableció en su vivienda de madera una pequeña pulpería, con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Está solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, chiverías, papel higiénico gaseosas, sopas instantáneas, huevos, entre otros productos. Su sueño es llegar a  tener una tienda de ropa nueva y venta de accesorios para damas, para mejorar sus ingresos y así poder vivir en mejores condiciones
texts.en: LUCIO WALTER is a native of Waspam. He is a 55 year old entrepreneur, married with 4 children. One is an adult and the other 3 are adolescents who study in secondary school. Due to a lack of formal employment he established a small store in his house made of wood 26 years ago with the aim of having his own source of money and help with the household expenses. He is requesting his first loan to buy basic grains, snack food, toilet paper, soft drinks, instant soup and eggs amongst other products. His dream is to have a store with new clothing and accessories for women to improve his revenues and be able to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snack food, toilet paper, soft drinks, instant soups, and eggs amongst other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, boxes of batteries, and Lipton tea

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy salt, Maggi bouillon cubes, and potash

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy salt, Maggi bouillon cubes, and dried baobab leaves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shea butter, beans, and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic shoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy boxes of soaps

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy boxes of soap

loans.name: Ma. Vilma

texts.en:
Ma. Vilma is 41 years old. Ma. Vilma is a single woman.

Ma. Vilma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been raising pigs for 1 year now, and she has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 39 years old and has four children, three of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Lorelie operates a general store in the Philippines which she has been doing for one year. She  sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks. 

Lorelie requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy eggs, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, de 50 años de edad, no estudio, está casado y su esposa trabaja juntamente con él en la agricultura, tiene dos hijas, las cuales ya son independientes.

Luis, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia 11 años de edad y lo hacia en compañía de sus padres, luego se independizo y trato de dedicar más tiempo al trabajo de la agricultura y no solamente a eso, si no que también, se dedico a la ganadería, su trabajo está a un kilómetro desde su casa.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar dos novillas de repasto, para cuidarlas y venderlas y la ganancia invertirla en el cultivo de maíz.

El sueño de Luis, es que la ganancia de la venta de los novillos sea buena, sembrar maíz y poder tener maíz para vender y para consumo.
texts.en:
Luis 50 years old and does not have a formal education. He is married and his wife works with him in agriculture. They have two daughters who are now independent.

Luis has worked in agriculture since the age of 11. He worked alongside his parents and later became independent. He tried to spend more time in agriculture, but now he also raises livestock. His work requires him to travel one kilometer from his house.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy two heifers for grazing. He will care for them, sell them, and use the profit to invest in his corn crop. Luis hopes to earn a good profit from the sale of the two heifers. He dreams of planting corn and having enough to sell and to use for personal consumption.

loans.use: to buy two grazing heifers.

loans.name: Rubiela

texts.es:
Rubiela, a sus 45 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos.

Debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales ha pasado por una situación económica muy difícil, pues no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos y está desempleada; esto la llevó a buscar opciones para salir adelante y desea montar su propio negocio de venta de mercancía variada.

Por esta razón se motiva para solicitar el crédito, que invertirá en la compra de ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza, entre otros.

De esta forma, Rubiela espera poder recibir los recursos necesarios para salir adelante al lado de su familia y poder ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor educación, además esto servirá como impulso para avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es montar un negocio en un local bien acreditado, que le genere buenos ingresos para mejorar a mediano plazo, sus condiciones de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rubiela is 45 years old and a single mother of three children. Due to the lack of job opportunities, she has gone through a very difficult financial situation. She is unemployed and does not have the support of the father of her children. This brought her to the point of looking for ways to get ahead, so she decided to start her own business of selling various merchandise.

For this reason, Rubiela is motivated to request a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of clothing, accessories, beauty products, and other items. By working in this manner, she hopes to earn the necessary resources to move forward along with her family and to provide a better education for her children. In addition, the loan will serve as the momentum needed to get closer to fulfilling her dream of establishing an accredited business that generates good income in the medium term. This would improve her living conditions and those of her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing, accessories, beauty products, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Janet, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by eleven farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Janet will purchase not only maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Janet plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy a cow.

In total Janet’s Group will use this loan to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of ten solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic shoes for resale.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA INMACULADA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Estela se dedica al negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Estela is a member of the Communal Bank “La Inmaculada”. The bank is located in the District of Kosñipata in Paucartambo Province, Deparment of Cusco.

Estela manages a restaurant where she serves different dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and stir-fried beef. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. Estela has been in this business for eight years and is doing very well. Her dream is to continue her restaurant. She is requesting a loan in order to buy products for cooking such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

Estela is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El socio Victor  se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el socio hace servicio de taxi, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de transporte. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Our member Victor still works in transport, running a taxi service. He wants to use his work to get on in life and dreams of expanding his transport business. He is seeking the loan to buy tyres for his car. He his happy about the loan and is committed to pay it all back.

loans.use: to buy tyres for his car

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee un cibercafé ubicado en una zona muy transitada cerca de su casa, tiene muchos clientes por la amabilidad para atenderlos, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como ayuda en su casa con los gastos, el joven vive con sus padres en casa de ellos, y está solicitando un crédito para la compra de computadoras con sus escritorios ya que tiene mucha demanda y las que actualmente tiene no le alcanzan y asi el podrá seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en su casa.
texts.en:
The young man whose face is pixelated is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He owns a cybercafé that is located in a busy area near his house. He has many customers because of the friendly service he offers. With the income he earns from his work, he is able to contribute toward the household expenses. The borrower lives with his parents at their house.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy computers and desks since there is great demand and he does not have the funds to cover this investment. This will enable him to continue his work so that he can earn more income and continue helping out at home.

loans.use: to buy computers and desks.

loans.name: Sirere

texts.en:
Sirere is a 53-year-old male who is married. He has four children aged 20, 19, 15 and four years old respectively, whom he supports. Sirere has been doing slaughtering of animals for five years now.

He is taking his second loan to purchase animals like cows and goats to slaughter for his customers. He intends to use his anticipated profits to expand his current business. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase animals like cows and goats to slaughter for his customers .

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is 31 years old and married to Rose and blessed with three children. 

He has been practicing dairy farming for the last 3 years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000 from it after selling milk to his clients. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to buy a cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to his increasing number of customers demanding milk. 

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and educate his children to higher levels of education. His dream is to have a stable family and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: To buy a cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to his increasing number of customers demanding milk.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 33 years old. He is married with two children. He has had a farming business for 12 years. 

He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs for crop production and hopes this will help him to pay school fees for his children.
 
His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a prosperous business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for crop production to help him pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock of food such as flour, rice, and potatoes so she can sell more food to her customers as well as increase her income.

loans.name: Redempter

texts.en:
Redempter is 36 years old. She is married and they have two children. She runs a retail shop. She has been in business for six years. Her monthly income is 32,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase stock like sugar, rice, and cooking fat. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for their children. In the future she wants to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: To purchase stock, like sodas, rice, clothes, and sugar

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
Rosa, de 24 años de edad, actualmente esta estudiando bachillerato a distancia, está acompañada y su pareja administra un comedor, no tienen hijos y viven en casa familiar.

Rosa, se dedica a vender en un comedor que tienen junto a su pareja, el negocio lo tienen desde hace varios años en casa de su suegra y el horario de atención es de 6:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m.
 
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar materiales para la elaboración de los alimentos y comprar pollo, carne, arroz entre otros alimentos, que se utiliza para la elaboración de almuerzos y cenas; de esa manera logrará continuar con su negocio.

El sueño de Rosa, es seguir trabajando junto a su pareja y tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 24 years old and currently studying for her high school diploma through distance learning. She is in a relationship and her partner manages a diner. They have no children and live in the family home.

Rosa sells food from the diner that she manages with her partner. The business has been in operation for several years and is located at her mother-in-law’s house. The hours of service are from 6:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M.

The loan will be used to buy supplies for preparing dishes. Rosa will buy chicken, meat, rice, and other ingredients for preparing lunches and dinners. This will allow her to continue her business. Rosa dreams of continuing her work with her partner and having more customers.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, rice, and other ingredients for preparing lunches and dinners.

loans.name: Sophjia

texts.en:
Sophjia is well established and living in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, which is an area with very high productivity. She has been farming for the past 15 years. Her main source of income comes from the sale of milk and eggs. 

When farming, she enjoys working on her land and taking care of her animals, but her biggest challenge is marketing problems. She is kindly requesting a loan to start horticulture farming. Kapsowar area has good weather conditions that support horticulture farming. Sophjia chose Juhudi Kilimo because they help farmers to uplift their living standards. During the training, she learned that MFIs help the poor access loans. 

Through the use of this loan, Sophjia's income base will increase, and she will better educate her children.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Mdidimua Group

texts.en:
Said, who is in his mid 40s, is a widower with two children who are still at school. He has been running two businesses--a food shop and a food vendor business--for four years now. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Said's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on the food shop and on the food stock. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees and to cover household expenses.

He will use this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, flours, salt, maize (corn), and cooking oil and to buy stock of food for his food vendor business. He dreams of getting an individual big loan.

Said will share this loan with his loan group "Mdidimua," which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, flours, salt, maize (corn), and cooking oil and to buy stock of food for his food vendor business.

loans.name: Engracia

texts.es:
La socia Engracia  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de pollipapas, la socia realiza platos como pollipapas es un plato a base de pollo y papas, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar papas y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Engracia still runs her business preparing and selling chicken and chips. She is an enterprising woman who wants to use her business to make progress in life. Her ambition is to own her own restaurant. She is seeking a loan to buy supplies for cooking potatoes and chicken. She is happy about the loan and guarantees that she will pay it all back.

loans.use: to buy supplies for cooking potatoes and chicken.

loans.name: Juan Cancio Edilberto

texts.es:
El socio Juan Cancio Edilberto se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,el socio tiene un terreno donde cultiva café ,el socio es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a su familia. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y semillas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Juan Cancio Edilberto still works in agriculture, cultivating coffee on his own plot of land. He is a hardworking man who uses his income from his business to support his family. He is seeking the loan to buy fertiliser and seeds. he is happy about the loan and promises to pay it back in full.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser and seeds

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita has been running her retail store for three years. Aside from her store, she also raises hogs and crops as an additional source of income.

Elenita plans to buy stock of grocery items but her capital is not enough. For this reason, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 allowing her to purchase grocery items such as soft drinks, biscuits, seasonings, noodles, eggs, and canned goods.

She knows that through this financial assistance, she could be able to increase her income and satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, biscuits, seasonings, noodles, eggs, and canned goods for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc City, Leyte. 

Rachel is engaged in a hog raising business. She is asking to take a loan  to buy more piglets to raise, and animal feed. 

A loan will help her improve her hog raising business, as well as her income. 

Rachel hopes to expand her business in the future in order to make it sustainable and productive. 

She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise, and animal feed

loans.name: Sirindah

texts.en:
Sirindah is a 53-year-old married woman. She has five people whom she supports.

Sirindah has been growing maize and wheat for four years now. She is taking her ninth loan to purchase farm inputs. She intends to use anticipated profit to expand her current business.

Her hope and dream is to have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 41-year-old businesswoman from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is engaged in retail sales of animal feed and supplements. Jocelyn has been in the business for more than seven years now. This is the source of her income.

Jocelyn is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as animal feed and supplements. A loan will help her improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

In the future, Jocelyn hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as animal feed and supplements.

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos Group

texts.es:
En los primeros años del asentamiento de la ciudad donde se conformó el grupo “Unidos Venceremos” se encontraron reliquias arqueológicas de las culturas Totonaca y Olmeca como las famosas “Caritas Sonrientes” que ahora adornan la entrada a la población. 

Cada uno de los miembros del grupo se dedica a una actividad económica que les permite desarrollarse y proveer a los suyos, ellos son: Severiana quien se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, perfumes, coronas, guías, juguetes y accesorios; Miguel y Norma, a la venta de ropa; Luis, a la venta de refrescos; Concepción, al servicio de sastrería; Ernestina, a la venta de bisutería; Ana, a la venta de artículos decorativos; María, a la venta de perfumes; María Yaneli, a la venta de cosméticos y María del Carmen, a la venta de antojitos.

Doña Severiana es madre de una niña de 7 años y un joven de 18 quien le apoya económicamente, ella es mejor conocida como doña Seve, siempre se ha esforzado por darle lo mejor a su familia apoyando a su esposo. Hace 10 años recibió su primer préstamo de VisionFund México (antes Fundación Realidad) con el que compró floratel, papel celofán, celoseda, alambre, hojas de color y cera para elaborar coronas y guías. Más tarde tuvo la oportunidad de iniciar otro negocio: la venta de ropa. 

Gracias a su dedicación e iniciativa, la vida de Seve cambió, se siente orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado. Hoy en día también vende perfumes, juguetes y accesorios. Cada uno de los préstamos que ha recibido le han ayudado a mantener sus negocios estables comprando la mercancía o materiales necesarios. Con sus ganancias ha remodelado su casa, renovado muebles y sus hijos continúan estudiando. En un futuro le gustaría tener un local para exhibir todos sus productos, mientras tanto necesita prepararse para las fiestas del pueblo que se acercan ya que es una buena oportunidad de venta y quiere comprar pantalones, faldas, blusas, playeras y camisas. 

“Agradezco a Lidia, nuestro asesor de crédito hace tiempo, quien nos dio pláticas para hacer buen uso de nuestros préstamos e invertirlos en una actividad productiva, parte del éxito de nuestras actividades se lo debemos a ella”.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de doña Severiana, en la fotografía se observa parte del brasero o fogón común en las casas de la región. Severiana es quien viste blusa color rosa.
texts.en:
When the city where the “Unidos Venceremos” loan group lives was created, archaeological relics from the Totonaca and Olmeca civilisations were found, including the famous “Caritas Sonrientes”, or smiling faces, that now adorn the entry to the city.

Each member of the “Unidos Venceremos” loan group makes a living in a trade that allows them to progress and to provide for their loved ones. These members are: Severiana, who sells clothes, shoes, perfumes, garlands, toys, accessories and other items; Miguel and Norma, who make a living selling clothes; Luis, sells soft drinks; Concepción, a seamstress; Ernestina, who works selling costume jewellery; Ana, who sells decorative items; María, sells perfumes; María Yaneli, sells cosmetics; and María del Carmen, who makes a living a selling snacks.

Severiana is a mother to one seven-year-old girl, and one 18-year-old man, whom she supports financially. Severiana is best-known as Seve, and she has always worked hard in order to give her family the best that she can by supporting her husband. 

Severiana received her first loan from VisionFund México (previously Fundación Realidad) ten years ago, and used it to buy cellophane, wire, coloured sheets, wax, and other items in order to produce garlands and other products. Later on, Severiana had the opportunity to start another business, this time selling clothes.

Thanks to her hard work and initiative, Seve’s life has changed and she is proud of everything that she has achieved. Today she also sells perfumes, toys and accessories. Each one of Seve’s loans has helped her to keep her businesses stable, buying merchandise or the necessary materials for making products. 

Seve has used her profits to remodel her house, change her furniture and give her children an education. In the future, Seve would like to have her own shop where she can display all of her products. In the meantime, she needs to prepare for the local town festivals that are approaching as it will be a good sales opportunity. Seve wants to buy trousers, skirts, blouses, t-shirts and shirts for her business.

Seve says, “I am grateful to Lidia Galicia, our loan advisor for some time, who has given us talks on how to make good use of our loans and to invest them in productive activity. Part of our success is because of Lidia.”

*The photograph was taken in Severiana’s garden. In it, part of the stove, common to many houses in the region is visible. Severiana is wearing a pink top in the photo.

loans.use: to buy trousers, skirts, blouses, t-shirts and shirts.

loans.name: Merlinda
