texts.en: Merlinda is a 54-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She is from Leyte, Philippines. For more than 17 years, Merlinda has earned an income through her hog raising business. As of now, she is requesting to take a loan to buy more piglets and animal feed. This loan will enable her to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 61 years old and widowed with three children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, shampoo, home care products and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 20 years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods,, noodles, shampoo, etc.. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, shampoo, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 44 years old and married, with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks.

In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 45 years old and has three children. She is married, and two of her children are in school.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mary Ann has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two cows for slaughtering. She will then sell the products and will have raw material for making sausages.

loans.name: Abraham's Group

texts.en:
Abraham is 32 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has two children and is married. As a group leader, Abraham is representing his group of 14 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Abraham's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

Abraham and his group will receive a total of 13 solar lights, as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sarou

texts.en:
A local farmer from Banteay Meanchey province, Sarou is 57 years old. For her living, she grows rice as the single main source of her income. She has been involved this business for ages, and it earns her about 27,000 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm. 

She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Phnom Srok District

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Lastrabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Antonia (la segunda del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de blusa celeste) es una mujer casada de 37 años de edad, tiene una linda familia de 6 hijos de las cuales una ya está casada y los demás se encuentran bajo el cuidado de ella, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Antonia para generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa se dedica  a la compra y venta de ropa típica de su región, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace 6 años, ella vende sus productos como ambulante en una plaza circunvecina de su comunidad.
Antonia desde hace algún tiempo había considerado la posibilidad de realizar una buena inversión en su negocio, mejorando así sus productos como faja, güipil, cortes, aunque lamentablemente Antonia no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder invertirlo en su negocio, por lo que se ha unido a un grupo de personas para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cortes, güipiles, fajas para venderlos respectivamente a un buen precio.
Antonia tiene las esperanzas de poder conseguir este crédito para mejorar sus ingresos  y poder contar algún día con un local donde pueda exhibir mejor sus productos.
texts.en: Antonia (second from the left on the photo and wearing a sky blue blouse) a3 37 and married. She has a lovely family of six children one of whom is married. The others are still dependent on her and the whole modest family lives in a town in Sololá. As a means of earning an income and helping her husband to cover the household expenses, she buys and sells traditional local clothing. She has been doing this for the last 6 years, selling her goods in the street in a square in her town. She has been considering the possibility of making a significant investment in her business in in order to improve her goods such as belts, embroidered blouses and wraparound skirts. Unfortunately, however, Antonia does not have enough capital to invest in her business and so she has joined a group of people who are seeking a loan to buy wraparound skirts, embroidered blouses and belts which they will sell at an affordable price. Antonia hopes to obtain this loan to improve her income and, one day, be able to have her own premises where she can display her goods.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Sari Madu Group

texts.en:
As reported previously, Ni Luh, former head of Sari Madu group, used the loan to support her husband's work in the garden to buy seeds and fertilizer. With good care and supported by the rainy season, all the crops she planted produced maximum results. Rice, cocoa, beans and chilies can grow well and bear fruit well. Obtaining satisfactory results and sufficient to meet the needs of the family and for working capital, Ni Luh decided to quit her membership and continue business with her own capital. She expressed her gratitude for the support of venture capital that had she received so far. ("Ni Luh" in the member list is a difference person with "Ni Luh" that already resign. They have a same first name. In a Balinesse Traditional Name,"Ni Luh" refer to name for the very first daughter was born in the family)

Sari Madu group elected a new leader, and according to mutual agreement, Ni Nengah was elected. Ni Nengah, 47, is married, and has two daughters who are married and a son who is still in junior high school. Her husband works as a farmer and cultivates their own rice fields. 

Ni Nengah, in addition to being a housewife and raising pigs, also helped her husband. The loan was used to buy paddy seeds, insecticide and fertilizer. 

She hopes to get maximum results; and the profits will be used to support their children's education.

The Sari Madu group add a new member, and one member can’t attend the meeting due to illness.

loans.use: to buy paddy seeds, insecticide and fertilizer

loans.name: Las Entusiastas De La 3Ra Etapa De La Era Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Las Entusiastas de la 3RA Etapa de la Era” conformada por 07 mujeres emprendedoras y responsables que buscan mejorar cada día. Ruth de 31 años es separada con 02 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a dar servicio domestico en casas. Gracias a su trabajo Ruth ha podido  sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda.  Su último crédito lo destinará para la  construcción de su casa y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Seguir trabajando positivamente es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Las Entusiastas de la 3ra Etapa de la Era” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Ruth  es la primera del lado izquierdo, viste polo color negro y se encuentra acompañada por su hija.
texts.en:
The lending group "Las entusiastas de la 3ra etapa de la Era" is made up of 7 entrepreneurial and responsible women who try to make every day better. Ruth, 31, is separated and has 2 independent children. Thanks to her hard work, Ruth has been able to help her children get ahead and improve her home. She will use this loan to build her house and give her family a better quality of life. Her greatest wish is to continue working positively.

The group "Las Entusiastas de la 3ra Etapa de la Era" are grateful to the people who make this loan possible. Ruth is the first person on the left, dressed in a black t-shirt and accompanied by her daughter.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
La socia Maria Victoria pertenece al banco comunal LAS HIJAS DE MARIA,la socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de librería y a la vez continua trabajando como asistenta social, la socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo libros, cuadernos, lapiceros, fólderes entre notros  a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar hojas, libros, plumones entre otros.
texts.en:
The member Maria Victoria belongs to Las Hijas de María Communal Bank.  She still earns a living in her bookstore business and also works as a welfare worker.  She sells books, notebooks, folders, and other products to her customers on request.  This is how she gets her family ahead.

She's requesting the loan to buy paper, books, pens, and other products.

She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy paper, books, pens, and other items

loans.name: Naom

texts.en:
Naom is 32 years old, married to Daniel, and blessed with four children. She has been a dairy farmer for the last three years, and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy a cow and to buy more animal feeds to increase the amount of milk her cows can produce per day, to enable her to meet her customers' demand for milk.

Naom plans to use the profit she gains to repay the loan and to expand her agricultural business. Her dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a cow and to buy more animal feeds to increase the amount of milk her cows can produce per day, to enable her to meet her customers' demand for milk

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 19 years old from Talugtug, Nueva Ecija. She has two siblings and her parents earn money through their welding shop.

With the little income of her parents, they find it hard to send her to college. That’s why Regina wants to receive an education loan of 150,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to aid in her college education. She is earning a BS in Information Technology. She chose this course because this is in demand and she is hopeful to easily get a stable job.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is 18 years old and single.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Julie Ann has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Julie Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials and supplies such as rice, flour, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 54 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks.

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, eggs, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Norma has been in this business for 28 years. She would like to save enough to provide future financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, eggs, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Rudica

texts.es:
Rudica es una mujer de 60 años de edad, con necesidades, persona humilde pero trabajadora, separada de su esposo madre de dos hijos y con un negocio de comida que trata de sacar adelante para solventar sus necesidades.
 
Ella es una mujer que ya ha recorrido gran parte de su vida y por eso se concentra en el sostenimiento de su negocio, solo espera que le dé lo suficiente para tener una tranquila vejez.

Esta mujer solicita un préstamo para contar con capital de trabajo, el cual invertirá en la compra de un puesto de alimentos, insumos de la canasta familiar, servilletas, vasos, platos y cubiertos desechables, refrescos entre otros.
texts.en:
Rudica is a 60-year-old woman with needs. She is a humble but hardworking person, separated from her husband, and the mother of two children. She has a food business that she is trying to move forward in order to provide for her needs. 

Most of her life has already gone by, which is why she is concentrating on supporting her business, and she hopes only that it may provide her with enough to have a peaceful old age.

She is requesting a loan in order to have working capital, which she will invest in the purchase of a food stall, basic food items, napkins, glasses, disposable plates and cutlery, and soft drinks, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase a food stall, supplies, napkins, glasses, and disposable plates and cutlery.

loans.name: Zuilma

texts.en: Zuilma is 35 years old, married and has a son. She is a very active woman and always strives to provide the best for her family. For this reason, she began a freight services business from Tijuana to Mexico City in 2010. Her dream is to expand her services to the whole country and to be an internationally recognized company. She is requesting a loan of MXN 10,000 to buy a pickup truck to cover more services and to find new customers by expanding routes. The additional income provided by expanding her fleet with another vehicle will allow her to grow her client base and increase her income even further to provide a higher quality of life for her family. Zuilma considers herself adept in financial planning skills and is very committed to fulfilling her obligations on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy a pickup truck.

loans.name: Tobias De Jesus

texts.es:
Tobias es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 
Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.
El tiene un cultivo de plátano y yuca el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Dabeiba.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción. 

El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de plátano y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa enfrentando la dificultad más grande que tiene que son el clima tan cambiante que afecta su cosecha.
 
Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores de Colombia como lo hace la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Tobias is a veteran farmer with a great deal of experience. He is humble and modest, yet he is great with working with people and has the energy needed to produce any type of crop. Tobias is currently growing bananas and cassava. He works every day to sell his harvest at a plaza market in the town of Dabeiba.

Thanks to his years of experience and the lessons he learned as a child from his father, Tobias is fully capable of working and providing advice to other farmers in the area who need help with their production. He is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers, banana seeds, and pesticides. This will inject capital into his business and significantly improve his harvest. His greatest challenge is dealing with weather changes that could affect his harvest.

Tobias has a great deal of faith in his business and best wishes for the supportive people who assist farm workers in Colombia through Interactuar. Support this humble farmer with a loan so that he can continue working his land!

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers, banana seeds, and pesticides.

loans.name: Aleira Luz

texts.es:
Recursiva, curiosa, talentosa, son alguna de las cualidades de Aleira, una mujer de 40 años de edad, vive en la zona rurales pero cerca de la carretera, ella en su hogar logro montar un restaurante algo informal, su esposo le ayudo a construir el espacio con algunos trozos de madera y un poco de capital para comprar algunas mesas con sillas.

Ella es madre de 4 hijos y su negocio le ha permitido salir adelante, en la foto se puede ver su cocina algo rustica pero tiene un valor agregado y es que cocina a fuego de leña siendo este tipo de cocción muy buscado por los viajeros.

Aleira se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para tratar algunos temas de reformas locativas, su cocina necesita una remodelación, y el resto de capital lo invertirá en la compra de manteles para la mesa, cubiertos y vajilla.
texts.en:
Resourceful, curious, and talented are a few of the qualities of Aleria, a 40-year-old woman who lives in a rural zone but close to the highway.  In her home, she was able to set up an informal restaurant.  Her husband helped her to build the space with some pieces of wood and, with a little bit of capital, to buy some tables with chairs.

She is the mother of 4 children, and her business has allowed her to get ahead.  Her kitchen appears in the photo.  It’s a bit rustic, but it has the added value that it cooks with wood fire, a type of cooking very sought-after by travelers.

Aleira is requesting a loan to deal with some matters of venue renovations.  Her kitchen needs remodeling.  She will invest the rest of the funds in the purchase of tablecloths for the tables, cutlery, and dinnerware sets.

loans.use: to make some much-needed renovations venue and buy tablecloths and dinnerware sets.

loans.name: Jacob's Group

texts.en:
Jacob, featured in the picture above, is representing his group of twelve farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. He is best known in his community for being a very experienced farmer and is very excited to be joining One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Jacob’s decision to join the program was largely due to the fact that he wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In addition, he was keen on purchasing a solar light that he could afford, as he says that by doing so he would be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money, which he is very excited about. With the profits he earns from the coming harvesting season, Jacob plans to send his children to school.

Between the twelve farmers in Jacob’s Group, a total of 4.75 acres of land will be planted using the farming inputs received with this loan. The group will also receive a total of twelve solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Barrio Nuevo Group

texts.es: Marlin, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz y frijoles y café. El cultivo de café es su mayor fuente de ingresos y lo vende en pergamino en la misma zona. Ha solicitado otro préstamo en forma grupal el cual es por 6,000 Lempiras, lleva tres ciclos con la institución. Con este préstamo piensa comprar abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar su finca de café y crecer como productora de café y que su familia  tenga mejor vida. El grupo se llama Barrio Nuevo, formado por 5 miembros que se dedican a la agricultura, y viven en la misma comunidad. El monto total de préstamo es por 33,000 Lempiras para compra de abonos y fertilizar sus cultivos. En la foto se identifica María a la izquierda, luego Marlín, Lucia, Elvia y Orbin a la derecha.
texts.en: Marlin in 25 years old and lives in a civil union with her husband with whom she has two children. They live in a village in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. She has always earned her living in agriculture growing corn, beans, and coffee. The cultivation of coffee is her main source of income and sells it on parchment paper in her area. She has requested another group loan which is 6,000 Honduran Lempiras. It is her third cycle with the institution. With this loan, she plans to buy fertilizers and manure to enhance her coffee farm, to expand her coffee production, and to give her family a better life. The group is called Barrio Nuevo. It consists of five member who are engaged in agriculture and live in the same community. The total loan amount is 33,000 Honduran Lempiras. She will purchase fertilizer to fertilize her crops. The picture shows Maria on the left, then Marlin, Lucia, Elvia, and Orbin on the right.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure for her coffee plants

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.en: María is 46 years old and, regretfully, a widow. For the last three years, she has rented out rooms for people in the region and will soon open two more. She is asking for a loan of MXN 12,000 for renovations on the building, such as doors, windows and bathrooms to increase the value of the property and increase the rent. By the end of this year, she would like to be able to rent out four new rooms. As an active woman, María is constantly learning, always motivated to change and she likes to have healthy communication with their sons, so she takes the time to talk to them both ant to learn from their experiences. Her sons are her motivation to improve her business and be able to increase her income so that she can provide a higher quality of life for them. Today she feels very happy because she has slowly seen her dreams come true and she is very grateful to those who support her efforts every day. The improvements on the property will allow her to earn more each month and make successful repayments on her second loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to pay for construction on doors and windows.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Maria de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee un comedor y venta de pupusas, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y como logra salir adelante, ella quiere construir un pequeño local en la entrada de su casa donde desea poner su negocio pero como no tiene de suficiente capital solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, arena, cemento, hierro, laminas y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener un mejor lugar para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old and lives in her own home along with her family. She owns a diner and also sells “pupusas” [stuffed tortillas]. Her business is located at her place of residence. With the income she generates from her sales, Maria is able to get ahead.

Maria wants to build a small shop at the entrance of her house where she can set up her business. However, she does not have sufficient capital. Maria is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy bricks, sand, cement, iron, roofing sheets, and also pay for labor. This will give her a better place where she can serve her customers.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials and labor in order to build a shop for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for his store to resell

loans.name: Yuvisa

texts.es:
La socia Yuvisa  se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cacao y café, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yuvisa has an agriculture business. She has a plot of land where she grows cacao and coffee. Yuvisa works from 6:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. She has several years of experience in this business and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her farmland. Yuvisa is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Manizha

texts.en: Manizha is a student. She was born in 1995. She is living in the western part of the country. She is single and lives with her parents. She has had a dream of being an agrarian from childhood. She likes to work on the land. Her parents wished to give Manizha a chance to study at an agrarian institute. She passed the entrance examination of the institute with excellence. Now Manizha needs to pay the tuition fees of the institute. She awaits your mercy and has requested loan for paying the tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 38 years old and married with four children. She has had a tailoring business for 10 years and it has been profitable. 

Anne has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will be using to purchase fabric and sewing threads for making more dresses to sell to her customers. This will enable her to generate more income. 

With the anticipated income, Anne will be able to buy additional fabric materials and supply to nearby tailoring shops. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and sewing threads for making more dresses

loans.name: Diana Lucrecia

texts.es: Diana Lucrecia, tiene la edad  de 19 años, está soltera,  vive con su mamá y sus hemanos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para hacer la siembra de plantas hornamentales  y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, y comprar la meger semilla de de las plantas mas comerciales y que se adapten bien con el clima de la zona, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo en estas plantas. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad adecuada, y tener a corto plazo plantas con un tamaña adecuado. Con el ingreso que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Diana Lucrecia is 19 years old, single, and lives with her mother and siblings who are her highest priority. She intends to use this loan to buy fertilizers and other supplies for growing ornamental plants so that they develop well. Diana will buy seeds of the most widely sold plants that are well-suited to the local climate. In addition, she will pay for labor so that the plants are maintained and undergo good development, thus ensuring that the job is done well. Diana intends to take advantage of the good weather and soil conditions in the area for growing these crops. She will also get to utilize her several years of experience with handling these types of plants. In addition to having the best products of the highest quality for her farm, the plants will be able to develop well in adequate conditions and should reach a suitable size within a short amount of time.

With the income she hopes to earn, Diana will contribute to her family’s well-being and the education of her siblings. This will fulfill some of her family’s goals and she can also continue investing more into her crops.

This is the first loan Diana has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not received any other loans previously from the state banks. FUDECOSUR is offering this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and labor for growing ornamental plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so that she can supply milk and increase her earnings.

loans.name: Sameng

texts.en:
A mother of four children living in Banteay Meanchey Province, Sameng is 50 years old. Nowadays, she can earn income via rice cropping to support her family's living conditions. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 40,000 KHR per day.

This is Sameng's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can generate more income to improve her family's living conditions better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Phnom Srok District

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is from Arshaluys village in the Aramvir region, with her husband and two daughters. They all are involved in the farming business. The farm includes potatoes, cabbage and greens and Naira and her husband sell the gathered products in local markets. Their farm is small but profitable. All the available resources are used for survival and nothing remains to invest in the farm and enlarge it.

Naira, with the goal of developing and enlarging their farm, is asking for this loan. She plans to purchase potato seeds (125 kg), cover cultivation costs and purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

Naira and all her family members hope for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds (125 kg), cover cultivation costs and purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Seng Hay

texts.en: Senghay(36) and her husband Ky(33) are farmers. They live in Kratie, a province northeast of Cambodia well known for freshwater dolphins. They both grow cassava​ and Ky sometimes helps neighborhood farming. They have three children: Ly(15) is studying in high school; Ny(7) and Meng(1) are staying at home. Their village has no access to power grid and they usually use battery to light the house and for their farming activities. But this year they decided to apply for Solar Loan after seeing how helpful the solar home systems are. They believe solar Home System will help to improve their standard living and help them to spare their cash for farming. Moreover, their children will be able to study longer than before both day time and night time.

loans.use: buy a Solar home System

location.town: O-Chrey Village, Preaek Brasab Commune, Preaek Bra

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагуль 64 года, вдова, мать героиня 10 детей, старшие самостоятельные, младший сын живет с Айнагуль. Образование - среднее. Уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Айнагуль достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS), в том числе пенсионные платежи. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Айнагуль имеется 3 коровы, 20 овец, также 4,0 Га собственной земли, где Айнагуль выращивает фсоль для реализации. Доходы Айнагуль очень низкие, их не зватает на достойную жизнь.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнагуль обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 12 овец. Доходы от кредита Айнагуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве.
texts.en: Ainagul is 64 years old, a widow and a mother-hero of 10 children. All of her older children are independent, and the youngest son lives with Ainagul. She has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for many years. Thanks to her back-breaking labor and capable work, Ainagul achieved significant successes in developing her business and started to earn a monthly profit of 10,000 som (KGS), inclusive of her pension. Today Ainagul's farm contains 3 cows, 20 sheep and also 4.0 hectares of her own land, where she grows beans for sale. Ainagul's earnings are very low and are not enough for a decent life. In order to further develop her business, Ainagul requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 12 sheep. Ainagul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing the livestock headcount on her farm.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch is 55 years old, the mother of three children and lives in Kandal provence. She earns a living and suports her family by growing rice on two hectares of land. She has been involved this line of work for many years, and requesting her first loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use this loan to pay tuition fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree in nursing. Her goal is for her daughter to get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her daughter, who wants to earn a Bachelor's degree in nursing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Kim Sron

texts.en: Kimsron(42) and her husband Nea(47) are farmers. They live in Kratie, a province northeast of Cambodia well known for freshwater dolphins. They grow cassava for living​. They have two children: Nak(19)and Neng(13)both are students. Their village does not have access to electricity. They want their children to study well at night. However, their current power sources car battery is not reliable.They have to charge battery every 2 or 3 days or else they will live in darkness for the whole day. This year they decided to apply for Solar Loan. They believes Solar Home System will help improving their standard living. Moreover their children will be able to study properly during the night.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system

location.town: Buk Toek Village, Preaek Brasab Commune, Preaek Br

loans.name: Brisas Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Brisas” is located in the rural Department of Totonicapán where handicrafts are a very important part of the economy.  The highest Department of Guatemala is Totonicapán, which is in the Sierra Madre Mountains, a region that can be very cold.  “Brisas” has nine members who have just completed their first loan cycle with Kiva.  They are now looking forward to a second productive loan cycle.  The women are K’iche Maya.

One of the eldest members of “Brisas” is Sabina, who is 54 years-old, married and has four children.  Although Sabina only had two years of education, she knows the importance of having a good education. Therefore, she is providing an education for all her children in order that they have more opportunities than she had, as well as a good future.  Sabina has only been a member of “Brisas” for one year.  In that year, she has learned a lot about business and other important subjects through educational seminars at the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank.  Sabina’s business is selling clothing for babies, children, teens and adults.  Three days a week, she gets on a bus to travel an hour to another community where her clothing is in higher demand.  She is asking for a loan to increase her inventory of clothing, especially summer clothes, which are in high demand during the upcoming Holy Week in April.

Sabina and the other members of “Brisas” thank the Kiva lenders for providing the loans that help them build brighter futures for themselves and their families!!!

loans.use: to increase her inventory of clothing, especially summer clothes, which are in high demand during the upcoming Holy Week in April.

loans.name: Senan

texts.en:
Senan is a 21-year-old, single man living with his parents. He is a starting farmer and helps his father at their farm. They have a big land and raise their crops to sell. They also raise different plants, fruits and vegetables. 

Senan joined his father a year ago after he returned from military service.  Now Senan plans to become a farmer and run together with his father. He applied for 1,000 AZN loan in order to install an irrigational system in his small garden. He built this garden after his return and now raises different fruits and vegetables to sell. He hopes that one day he will be as experienced as his father.

loans.use: to install an irrigational system in his small garden.

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra is a 37 year old farmer. She is married and her husband is a labourer. They have a daughter and two sons. Zohra raises and fattens cows and her sons help her in this. Her husband also helps her when he has time. They fatten cows and then sell their milk or meat.

Zohra has been a farmer for 16 years and she is very experienced. Though the job is very hard and is in high demand Zohra earns only 185 AZN. She has three cows but they are not productive and her income has fallen. She applied for a loan of 1500 AZN in order to buy one additional cow and recover the productivity of her small farm.

loans.use: to buy one additional cow and recover productivity of her small farm

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 48-year-old married man and a father to five children and a Palestinian refugee. He lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Mohamad has worked in transportation since 2008. He likes his business a lot and is well known in the region. Mohamad is a man with a good reputation, and is devoted to his work and customers' needs. He is recommended by most of his clients, who are neighbors, relatives and foreigners.
Mohamad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to do necessary maintenance on his car which is his only source of income.
Mohamad hopes to develop his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his car.

loans.name: Agakerim

texts.en:
Agakerim is 56-year-old pensioner. He is married and has a son and two daughters. His wife is a houskeeper and takes care of family. His children are married and live separately, except his son. He and his wife live with parents. 

Agakerim has been a gardener for 23 years. He raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. He uses the harvest for his family and for sale, too. His son helps him in gardening. They sell the harvest at local bazaars, and he earns 270 AZN monthly. 

Agakerim bought a piece of land and built there for his son a house and expanded his garden. He prepared everything, and now he needs to install water pipes, a water tank and a water pump in the new house. He applied for 500 AZN in order to call a master and install the water system in the house. He wants his son to have his own house and live happily with his young family.

loans.use: to install a water system in the house

loans.name: Qasem

texts.en:
Qasem is a 24-year-old single man from a village near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small house in the city. His father has a carpentry workshop where he gets a good income, but not stable. Qasem has his own business which is a stall for selling women's clothes.

Qasem took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of clothes for his stall. By taking this loan, Qasem will increase his income and also his family's condition.

Qasem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes for his stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 28-year-old married man from Khanyounis city. He is a father for one small son. Salah opened his own business three years ago; it is a store for selling men's clothes. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Salah took a USD  loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of men's clothes to resell in his store. By taking this loan, Salah's sales will be increased and also his income.

Salah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of men's clothes to resell in his store.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 31-year-old married man from Khanyounis city. He lives with his wife and one small daughter. Mahmoud has a small store, where he sells electrical machines. It has been open for the past four years.

Mahmoud took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more electrical machines to resell in his store. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to increase his sales and also his income.

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more electrical machines to resell in his store.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
El socio Hilario se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de pollipapas que es un plato a base de pollo con papas,el socio por medio de este pequeño negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de pollipapas.El socio solicita el credito para comprar pollos y papas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Hilario, continues to sell pollipapas, which is a basic dish of chicken and potatoes. Through this small business, this member wants to move ahead in his life. His dream is to expand his pollipapas business. This member is requesting a loan to buy chicken and potatoes.

This member is happy for the loan and promises to pay his monthly installments.

loans.use: buy chickens and potatoes.

loans.name: Placida Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia Placida Luzmila se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de pollipapas que es un plato a base de pollo con papas,la socia es una mujer trabjadora que por medio de este peuqeño negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollos,aceite y papas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Placida Luzmila, continues to run her business selling pollipapas, which is a basic dish of chicken and potatoes. This member is a hard worker and through this business wants to get her family ahead. This member is requesting a loan to buy chicken, oil and potatoes.

This member is happy for the loan and promises to fulfill the payments.

loans.use: buy chickens, oil and potatoes.

loans.name: Grace María

texts.es: Grace María, tiene la edad  de 46 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo, el cual es su mayor prioridad. Ella con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de frutas, verduras y hortalizan de buena calidad y a un precio justo, y venderlas en su puesto de venta al detalle a sus clientes y al publico en general, tambien la idea es tener una mayor variedad de artículos para ofrecerle a las compradores y que sean productos con la mayor frescura y calidad para tener un buen posicionamiento en el consumo humano. Con esta compra pretende tener mejores ingresos para invertir más en su frutería y cumplir metas que en el futuro le mejorará su calidad de vida para ella y su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Grace María is 46 years old, married and lives with her husband who is her greatest priority.  With the loan she hopes to buy quality fruits, greens and vegetables at a fair price to sell them to her clients and to the general public in her retail stand.  The idea is to also have a greater variety of products to offer to the buyers and that the products are fresh and of great quality and have a good product placement with the consumers. With this purchase, she hopes to have better income to invest in her fruit stand and meet goals that will improve the quality of life for her and her family. This is the first loan received from FUNDECOSUR. She has not had any other loans from state banks, but FUNDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es: María Cristina, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de unos terneros para el engorde y que tengan buenas características en el rápido desarrollo y ganancia de peso en un plazo adecuado para poderlos vender y comprar mas. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima fresco que el varano faborece al mejor desarrollo y rendimiento del pasto para poder tener estos animales y desarrollar animales para en el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: María Cristina is 24 years old, is single, lives with her parents and siblings, who are her greatest priority. With her loan, she plans to purchase some calves to fatten and so that they have good characteristics in the rapid development and increase of weight at a good pace to be able to sell them and purchase more. The idea is to take advantage of the space that is pasture and the good conditions of the land and the cool climate that the summer brings to develop and grow more grass to be able to have these animals and develop animals to sell them in the future for meat. With this purchase, she will be able to develop her work more, and at the same time have savings that will allow her to have more animals and invest more in her property. This is the first loan that she got through FUDECOSUR. She has never had other previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase calves to fatten.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 44-years-old married female. She has one child age 20 years, whom she supports. Nancy has been growing potatoes for 9 years now.

Nancy is taking her second loan to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and other chemicals to use in her farm. She intends to use the anticipated profit to expand her current business.

Her hope and dream is to have a successful life.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and other chemicals to use in her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a skilled farmer who lives in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. He never thought of being engaged in work different from farming and even never thought of having a higher education. So farming is the only occupation in which he is engaged to support his family. Karen is married and has two sons who help him on the farm, where they have cows, calves, bulls, pigs, sheep and lambs. Karen mentions that the assortment of his farm products for sale is great but the sale of meat is most profitable. He has a great assortment of meat, selling mutton, beef and pork to the city butchers. His farm also produces milk and other dairy products his wife sells right from their house. Karen has a rather big farm but still he thinks of its expansion
With this Kiva loan he plans to buy a calf for his farm and animal fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: to buy a calf for his farm and animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to promptly pay for labor and machinery to mill the 'guate' (corn leaves used for forage or grass for the livestock) that will be used to feed the cattle.

loans.name: Mayeku's Group

texts.en: Mayeku is 52 years old, has seven children, and leads a group made up of 12 farmers in the Webuye District of Kenya. He has been farming with the One Acre Fund since 2010. He joined the Fund to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although he described his most recent harvest as very good, he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with the One Acre Fund. Mayeku also decided to buy a solar light with part of the money from this loan. He is very excited by this, as it will allow him to reduce his consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save money. Obtaining this loan means that the members of Mayeku's Group will receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as enough farming supplies to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to buy a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 47 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by twelve farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Beatrice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Beatrice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Beatrice's Group will be able to receive a total of eighteen solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of seven acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 40 years old and lives in Metsamor town in the Armavir region. She is the mother of two children. Her daughter is married and lives separately with her family, and her son is 21 years old. Aida and her husband are farmers who grow tomatoes, peppers, greens and grass and also keep thirty chickens. Because this family is supported by its farming activities, it is very important for them to earn a good profit. Aida is requesting a loan to buy a polyethylene cover and supplies to rebuild her greenhouse, and fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. She is sure that this loan will help them harvest more vegetables and improve their lives. Because this is Aida's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance Loan Program provides loans to people who don't have access to traditional credit products because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to rebuild her greenhouse, and buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es:
Su vocación es la de buscar la verdad, el bienestar social y abogar por que se haga lo justo. Pablo es un joven de 22 años, apasionado del derecho y que estudia el último año de su carrera. Él se interesó en esta profesión porque siempre le ha llamado la atención la parte legislativa de su país. Su madre es la persona que le ha dado apoyo hasta el momento. 
Pablo solicita el crédito porque desea pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera ya que tener su título le permitirá obtener una mayor ventaja en el ámbito laboral. Sus metas y planes son poder terminar su carrera e instalar su propio bufete de abogados para así comenzar una nueva etapa de su vida y desarrollarse como profesional.
texts.en:
Pablo’s vocation is seeking the truth, promoting social welfare, and being an advocate for doing what is right. He is a young man who is 22 years of age. Pablo is passionate about the law and is studying in his final year toward earning his degree. He became interested in this profession because his country’s legislature has always captured his attention. His mother is the person who has supported him to this very day.

Pablo is requesting a loan because he wants to pay for a course for his degree. Having this degree will be a great advantage in the workplace. His goals and plans include finishing his education, establishing his own law practice, and beginning a new stage in his life where he can develop as a professional.

loans.use: to pay for a course in his degree program.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is from Taronik village, where she lives with her big family: her husband, son, daughter, younger son and his family.

Susan runs a farm. She keeps three cows and calves, and she also cultivates cabbages, cucumbers, tomatoes and greens. Her family members help her with the farming work, and they earn income that helps them to cover their minimal daily needs. As her children and grandchildren grow up, the family needs more and more resources to make ends meet.

Susan asks for this loan to be able to invest in her farm and develop it. She plans to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for land cultivation as well as a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse.

As this is Susan's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for land cultivation and to buy a polyethylene cover for her greenhouse

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 60-year-old proud mother of six children. She is often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Jane has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Jane described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, along with fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Jane’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jacob's Group

texts.en:
Jacob is a 55-year-old proud father of seven children. He is often described as a very hardworking individual. As a group leader, he is representing his group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Jacob notes that since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Jacob described his harvest as very good last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Jacob’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sokorn

texts.en: Sokorn is a 37 years old farmer. He is living with his wife and 2 young children in Kampong Chnang. He also owns a small business at home to earn extra income. Using car battery days by days to sustain family usage and his business, he needs to spend a lot of money and time. After getting recommendation from his neighborhood about how useful solar home systems is, he decided to apply for KIVA loan in order to buy a high quality solar home system. He believes that after using home solar systems, his family would improve living conditions and safety.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system

location.town: Koh Tamov Village, Kampong Preahkorki Commune, Bor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home system

loans.name: La Felicidad Group

texts.en:
“La Felicidad” meaning “Happiness” is the name of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank located in the Western Highland town of Chichicastenango composed of 11 motivated women in Guatemala. Their average age is 39 years and their average number of children is five. Most of them have had an average of three years of formal education. The women are focused to empower themselves, educate their children, raise their standard of living and eliminate poverty. They are happy to be members of the Trust Bank and thus, their name “La Felicidad”. This is their second loan with Kiva. The ladies report that their first loan was paid back fully and on time.

Anastasia is a 38-year-old member of the Trust Bank who is married with eight children. The oldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is only two. They are her motivation to work hard each day to support their needs. She is very proud that four of them attend school. Anastasia has a mobile food business and sells vegetables, fruits and fish in the local market. She also raises animals and creates beautiful traditional textiles. She is requesting a new loan to expand her food business and offer more variety of vegetables and fruits to the increasing number of customers that faithfully purchase from her each week. Anastasia will use a small portion of her loan to purchase various colors of thread and other supplies for her textile business.

Each month, the 11 women of the “Felicidad” Trust Bank participate in non-formal educational trainings provided by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer in their native language, Kiche. The ladies are eager to learn about so many topics like self-esteem and women’s rights, medicinal plants, nutrition and health. They immediately apply new knowledge about effective business practices, accounting and budgeting to their small businesses. Customer service is another relevant and useful subject for them.

loans.use: to expand her food business and offer more variety of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Claudelino

texts.es:
El Sr. Claudelino tiene 42 años, el comenta que proviene de una familia que se dedica netamente a la fabricación y venta de artesanía como la tradicional sobrecama y hamacas, desde muy joven acompañó a su padre en la ventas viajando a lado Argentino, así de apoco comenzó a trabajar solo, hoy en día ya tiene una muy buena clientela formada donde cada fin de semana se va a cobrar y colocar su mercaderías. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra sobrecamas, hamacas, frazadas y otros productos para poder vender y seguir luchando por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Claudelino is 42 years old. He says that he comes from a family that works solely in the crafting and sale of artisan items like the traditional bedspreads and hammocks. When he was very young he began to accompany his father on sales trip, traveling to the Argentinian side. From there he gradually began to work on his own, and today he has a very good set of clients, where he goes every weekend to collect payments and distribute his merchandise.

He is requesting this loan to buy bedspreads, hammocks, blankets and other items, so he can sell them and continue working to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, hammocks, blankets, and other items to sell

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and the mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She is also looking after her mother. Teopista rents a house with access to electricity but no plumbing. Her major monthly expenses are rent, transportation, school fees and water. For the last seven years, she has earned a living by selling charcoal at the local market. She works there six days a week, and supplements her income by selling used clothes. She has requested a loan from UGX 600,000 from MCDT- SACCO to bags of charcoal to sell. Her challenges include transportation, and her goal for the future is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Elena Karen

texts.es:
Elena es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de un año, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan.
Ella es buena madre, dulce, optimista, feliz, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona 'plan 3000' un área periurbana, calles de tierra y exagerada vegetación adornan el ambiente, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 22-35 grados centígrados. 
Elena es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa recogido estilo cola de caballo, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada,  su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con su bebé, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan, como; Cuñapé (bollo hecho de harina de yuca con queso), Zonzo (Puré de yuca mezclado con queso y formado en un palito para luego cocinarse en una parrilla o al horno), Empanada de jigote (Masa delgada de harina de trigo rellena con mezcla de carne o pollo y verduras y frita en aceite), y otros, que elabora en su cocina en un pequeño horno muy desgastado, hasta llenar una canasta y salir a vender de forma ambulante. “aprendí a hornear porque mi abuela me enseñó, con este trabajo me alcanza para alimentar a mi hijo y también lo puedo cuidar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la venta diaria y constante de los alimentos, la desventaja es la poca capacidad de producción de su horno. Su sueño es abrir una panadería, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de un horno industrial y una garrafa de gas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Elena solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial y una garrafa de gas para abrir una panadería.
texts.en: Elena is a young 20 year old woman. She lives with her domestic partner. She has a one year old son, and her business is to make and sell bread. She is a good mother. sweet, optimistic, happy, responsible and hardworking. She has her business in the "plan 3000", a suburban area, with unpaved streets and a lot of vegetation which ornament the landscape; of tropical warm weather with an average temperature between 22-35 degrees Celsius. Elena is of dark skin, long black hair - which she uses in a pony tail - brown eyes, short height, and thin. She speaks her native language of Guarani with her family, and Spanish as general culture and in her business. She shares her life with her partner, who works as a builder, and with their baby in a rented brick and cement house with corrugated iron roof, running water, electricity and sewerage. Her business is to make and sell bread, such as Cuñapé (cake made of tapioca flour with cheese), Zonzo (Tapioca mixed with cheese and shaped as a stick to be cooked on the grill or in the oven), Empanada of jigote (thin dough of wheat flour stuffed with a mixture of meat or chicken and vegetables and fried in oil), and others, which she makes in her kitchen in a heavily worn small oven until she fills up a basket and then goes out to sell as a street vendor. "I learned to bake, because my grandmother taught me. With this job I earn enough to feed my son, and I can also take care of him...", she says. The advantage of her business is the daily and constant sale of food, the disadvantage is the low production capacity of her oven. Her dream is to open a bakery. She wants to expand her business through the purchase of an industrial oven and a kitchen gas container. This is the first cycle of loans with the institution in the year in which she has been working in this job. For these reasons, Elena is requesting a loan to buy an industrial oven and a kitchen gas container to open a bakery.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and a kitchen gas container to open a bakery.

loans.name: Clorinda Matto De Turner Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CLORINDA MATTO DE TURNER”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Grimaneza ella es conviviente y tiene 34 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de jugos, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Clorinda Matto de Turner”. The bank is located in the District of Calca in Calca Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Grimaneza. She is 34 years old and in a common-law relationship. Grimaneza works at her grocery business where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. Grimaneza has been in this business for five years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is requesting a loan in order to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

The other group members engage in businesses such as selling juice, selling clothes, managing a grocery store, and managing a restaurant.

Grimaneza appreciates those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Huilda Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Huilda Francisca  se dedica al negocio de venta de pollipapas ,la socia es un amujer trabajadora por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un lugar mas amplio para vender las pollipapas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollos,aceite y papas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member, Huilda Francisca, makes a living through her business selling "pollipapas" (a dish made of chicken and potatoes). The member is a hard-working woman. With the help of her business, she moves her family forward. Her dream is to have a larger space for her sale of "pollipapas".

The member is requesting a loan to buy chicken, oil, and potatoes. She is happy to receive this loan, and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, oil, and potatoes.

loans.name: Hulpizar

texts.en: Hulpizar is a generous woman. She has five years of experience of doing agriculture. She knows well her business and plants wheat and cotton. Hulpizar is a responsible, kind and hospitable person. She is planning to buy fertilizer and seed to plant for a new harvest in the coming season. She has two children and her husband died. Her sister helps her with the business and in supporting her family. It is hard for Hulpizar to raise two children. She works and tries hard so her children do not suffer. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy seed and fertilizer. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 40 years old and married with two children. With her two children in school, Zenaida works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Zenaida has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Zina

texts.en:
Zina hopes for her second deal with Kiva as the first one was rather nice to her (a computer and some literature for her courses). Zina, as it was mentioned, lives in Vanadzor city, in the Lori region. She is married and she has three children. After graduating from the State Pedagogical Institute, Zina started her teaching activities and she still works at the school as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature. She is a beloved teacher and greatly respected woman. Zina also gives paid courses in Russian Language and Literature at her home and prepares pupils for entrance examinations. 

Zina needs a loan this time as she wants to buy a printer and pay for her training courses of methodology, which are very useful and she greatly wants to take part in them.

loans.use: to buy a printer and pay for her training courses of methodology. which are very useful

loans.name: Tugenderehamwe Group

texts.en:
Tugenderehamwe is a group led by Stephanie, who is 40 years old. The group name means “Work together” in English.

Stephanie is married, with seven children aged between 9 and 16 years. They all go to school. She sells clothes and has been doing a business for the past 21 years.

The group members sell different items, and they have same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, Stephanie would like to buy more shirts, skirts, and trousers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more shirts, skirts, and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Ginush

texts.en:
Ginush is from Taronik village where she lives with her husband and three sons. 

In the greenhouse, which the family owns, Ginush cultivates tomatoes, peppers and greens. Her greenhouse is old and needs to be renovated so Ginush is able to enlarge the variety of vegetables growing there.  All she needs is some financial resource to purchase a polyethylene cover and pipes for the greenhouse, so Ginsuh has applied for this loan. 

Ginush has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately she wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to hard work during more recent times, Ginush has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Ginush and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover and pipes for the greenhouse

loans.name: Teresa Marleni

texts.es:
Teresa, de 30 años de edad, solo estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente siembra granos como maíz, frijol, maicillo y otros granos, tiene 2 hijas.

Teresa, tiene negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, ella se encarga de llevar las verduras y frutas hasta los hogares de la gran mayoría de su pueblo, ya tiene un aproximado de 8 años en el negocio, inicio con este negocio debido a que tenía que buscar una fuente de ingresos para cubrir su necesidades y las de su familia, en el negocio le ayuda su hija mayor, cuando llega de la escuela.

Teresa, necesita el financiamiento para comprar vara de tusa, polines, 500 tejas y además para pagar mano de obra para reparar el techo de su vivienda.
 
Teresa, sueña con tener su negocio de frutas y verduras bien surtidas en el pueblo y también ver a sus hijas convertidas en profesionales.
texts.en:
Teresa, 30, studied until grade 7. She is married and her husband is a farmer, specifically his crops are grains, like corn, beans, sorghum and other grains. She has 2 daughters.

Teresa, has a fruit and vegetable buisness. She is in charge of taking fruits and vegetables to the homes of most of the town. She has been running this business for close to eight years. She started this business because she needed to find a way to cover the expenses of the household and her family. Her daughter helps her with the business when she gets home from school.

Teresa needs this loan to buy corn husk sticks, beams, 500 tiles and also to pay for the manual labour needed to fix the roof of her home.

Teresa's dream is to have a well-stocked fruit and vegetable business in town and also see her daughters become professionals.

loans.use: buy corn husk sticks, beams, 500 tiles and also pay for manual labor to fix the roof of her home.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es:
Marcos, de 51 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, que estudio hasta quinto grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su casa, tienen seis hijos, de las edades de 18, 16, 14, 11, 9 y 7 años, de los cuales solamente cinco viven con ellos, el mayor ya está acompañado.

Marcos, se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente siembra hortalizas como pepino, tomate, chile y huisquil, pues desde pequeño su padre le enseño a trabajar; ahora tiene sus propios cultivos.- Todas sus hortalizas están sembradas cerca de su casa, es por eso que no se le hace difícil poder estar al pendiente de los cultivos.

El financiamiento del crédito lo utilizara para poder comprar insumos agrícolas para poder tener en excelente condiciones sus cultivos, libres de plagas, de esta manera podrá tener mayores ingresos económicos.

Marcos, planea para un futuro poder sembrar mayores cantidades de tierra, para poder obtener más hortalizas y tener mayores ingresos económicos.-  También, desea ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios, para que puedan desarrollarse mejor y puedan tener un mejor trabajo y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcos is 51 years old, and he is a very hardworking person. He completed school through the fifth grade. Marcos is married, and his wife takes care of the household duties. They have six children, ages 18, 16, 14, 11, 9, and 7. Only five of their children live with them though, the oldest is now in a relationship.

Marcos makes a living in agriculture, specifically by growing vegetables such as cucumbers, tomatoes, chili peppers, and huisquiles. His father taught him this work at a young age, so now he has his own crops. All of his vegetables are planted near his house, so it's not difficult for him to look after his crops.

Marcos will use this loan to buy agricultural supplies to ensure that his crops are in excellent condition and free from plagues, and as a result Marcos will be able to earn more income.

Marcos plans to be able to farm larger areas of land in the future, to be able to grow more vegetables and earn more income. Also, he would like to help his children with their studies, so that they can flourish and be able to get better jobs and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anne's Group

texts.en:
Anne, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is 42 years old and a married mother of five children. She is often described as a very trustworthy person. 

Although Anne has been a farmer for more than 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Anne wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Anne hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 10 solar lights. Even though Anne decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Marie Paulette

texts.fr: Vendre des vêtements d’occasion pour homme et pour femme, c'est la spécialité  de Marie Paulette. 50 ans, veuve, mère de cinq enfants, c'est une femme optimiste et courageuse. Les revenus de son commerce de vêtements d’occasion est l'unique source de revenus dont elle dispose pour prendre soin de sa famille. Avec l’appui financier de Palmis Mikwofinans Sosyal, elle est parvenue à développer son activité et accroître ses revenus. Elle a besoin d’un nouveau microcrédit pour diversifier son activité en vendant aussi des draps et des rideaux.
texts.en: Selling second-hand clothes for women and men is Marie Paulette's specialty. She is 50 years old, widowed and mother of 5 children. She is an optimistic and courageous women. Her second-hand clothes selling business is her only source of revenue which helps her take care of her family. With the financial support of Palmis Mikwofinans Sosyal, she has succeeded in developing her business and increasing her revenues. She needs a new microloan to diversify her business by selling bed sheets and curtains.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets and curtains

loans.name: Marie Venance
