texts.fr: Marie Venance est âgée de 37 ans. Mariée, elle n’a pas encore d’enfant. Elle fait de la vente de friandises en gros. Elle exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d’années. Ambitieuse et très déterminée à assurer la croissance de son activité, Marie Venance a recours aux emprunts pour augmenter ses stocks et développer ses ventes.  Elle espère être en mesure d’améliorer sa condition de vie à travers les revenus que lui procure son commerce.
texts.en: Marie Venance is 37 years old. She is married but has no children yet. She sells candies in bulk. She has done so for the last ten years. Ambitious and very determined to ensure the growth of her business, Marie Venance takes out loans which help increase her stock and improve her sales. She hopes she will be able to improve her living conditions with the income from her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of chocolate candy

loans.name: Abner

texts.fr: Agé de 63 ans, Abner est marié et a 6 enfants à sa charge. Il vend des pièces détachées d’automobile depuis plus de vingt ans. Abner a besoin d’un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock. Il s’attend à mieux combler les attentes de sa clientèle et gagner plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: 63 year old Abner is married and has 6 children. He has sold spares parts for automobiles for more than twenty years. Abner needs a loan to increase his stock. He hopes to better satisfy his customers' needs and to make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy oil filters

loans.name: Marise

texts.fr: Marise est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et a quatre enfants à charge. Elle vend des produits alimentaires depuis neuf ans. Dans le but d’assurer la croissance de son activité et de répondre mieux aux attentes de la clientèle, elle a sollicité et obtenu plusieurs prêts Palmis Mikwofinans Sosyal. Le dernier microcrédit en date lui permet d’augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Marise is 43 years old. She is married and has four children. She sells food products for nine years now. In order to ensure the growth of her business and to better answer her customers' needs, she has requested and received several loans from Palmis Mikwofinans Sosyal. This loan will allow her to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy cereal packs

loans.name: Marie Linda

texts.fr: Marie Linda, âgée de 39 ans, est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Ils sont tous scolarisés. Depuis plus de 4 ans, elle a ouvert une boutique de produits alimentaires tout près de chez elle. Elle a beaucoup de clients. Marie Linda désire agrandir davantage son commerce et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie. Sachant que son stock est insuffisant pour répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, elle a demandé un microcrédit pour pouvoir augmenter ses marchandises.
texts.en: Marie Linda is 39 years old, married and mother of 3 children. They all go to school. Four years ago, she opened a shop close to her home where she sells food products. She has a lot of customers. Marie Linda wishes to grow her business and improve her living conditions. Knowing her stock is insufficient to answer the needs of her customer base, she has requested a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to add fruit juices to her stock

loans.name: Regino Francisco

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ES HABITANTE DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE CHINANDEGA ES ACOMPAÑADO TIENE UN HIJO A SU CARGO EN EDAD ESCOLAR EL CUENTA CON UN TRICICLO EL CUAL ES SU FUENTE DE TRABAJO DE LUNES A DOMINGO EL INICIA UN DIA DE TRABAJO DESDE LAS 5:00 AM QUE LE BRINDA SERVICIO DE ACARREO A LOS COMERCIANTES QUE VENDE VERDURAS EN EL TRANSCURSO DEL DIA BRINDA SERVICIO A LA POBLACION EN GENERAL HASTA LAS 6:00 DE LA TARDE QUE FINALIZA SU DIA DE TRABAJO EL SOLICITA FINANCIAMIENTO PARA MEJORAR LAS CONDICIONES DE SU TRICICLO.ES UN HOMBRE MUY TRABAJADOR, RESPOMSABLE Y MUY HUMILDE QUE TRABAJAR FUERTE PARA PODER LLEVAR EL SUSTENTO  A SUS HIJOS Y SALIR ADELANTE.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a resident of the Department of Chinandega. He is in a relationship and has a child who is of school age. The borrower owns a tricycle that he uses to earn an income Monday through Sunday. Starting at 5:00 A.M. he offers transport services to merchants who sell vegetables. Through the course of the day he then offers his services to the general public until 6:00 P.M. when he is done with his work.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to improve the condition of his tricycle. He is a hardworking, responsible, and humble man who does his best to support his children and help them get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Elijah's Group

texts.en:
Elijah is a 53-year-old proud father of 8 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Elijah has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Elijah described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Elijah’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Okod

texts.en:
Okod is a 38-year-old man from Mamboleo town in Kisumu, which is found in Nyanza province in the western part of Kenya. He is married and supports seven people in his family. He has four children who are 18, 16, 14, and 12 years old.

Okod has a retail shop, which has been operating for the last 10 years and generates a monthly income of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES). He has applied for his second loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which he will use to increase his working capital by purchasing more shop items like sugar, sweets, cooking oil, and bar soap, and he will use the anticipated profit to grow his business.

His dream is to have a big business and support the family.

loans.use: to increase his working capital by purchasing more shop items like sugar, sweets, cooking oil, and bar soap.

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits alimentaires(riz, tomate en boite, spaghetti, huile végétale....) depuis 2006,Améyo sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Son profit lui servira d'améliorer son stock et subvenir pleinement aux besoins de la famille. Elle est mariée avec 01 enfant de 06ans en charge. Ce dernier est scolarisé.
texts.en: Ameyo has been buying and reselling grocery items (rice, canned tomatoes, pasta, vegetable oil, etc) since 2006. She is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy additional merchandise. Her revenue will allow her to expand her stock and be able to amply provide for her family’s needs. She is married and has one six-year old child in her care. Her child attends school.

loans.use: to buy grocery items [for resale].

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy footwear as well as supplies for the repair of footwear such as threads, glues, and soles.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Stepanavan city of the Lori region with her lovely husband and two sons. Her elder son is married, and the youngest is still a student at the paid division of pedagogical institute.

Karine has no higher education, but being a clever woman she decided to help her husband somehow to earn for their family's living. Three years ago, Karine established her business; she has a small food shop where she sells a great range of products of first needs, candies, cans, juices, bread, and other food products that we use everyday. She mentions that thanks to her faithful neighbors and friends who live nearby, she always has customers who daily do shopping in her shop.

Karine brings the products for her shop from Yerevan with the help of her husband and she also cooperates with local deliverers that every week bring different products for her shop.

This loan will help Karine to enlarge her business and profit from it as well. She thinks of starting the sale of household good as well, and in order to realize her plans she asks this Kiva loan to buy different household goods that she can nicely display in her shop for sale.

loans.use: to buy different household goods that she can nicely display in her shop for sale.

loans.name: Shadrack's Group

texts.en:
Shadrack is 64 years old and is often referred to as a really experienced farmer. As a group leader, he is representing his group in Webuye District, formed by 10 farmers, including himself.

Shadrack has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2011 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Not only will he get maize seeds and fertilizer with his loan, but also a solar light in order to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. He decided that he will use the profits he gains from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

With this loan, Shadrack’s Group will receive a total of 8 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Nasyikat

texts.ru: Насыйкат 23 года, замужем, есть ребенок. У Насыйкат среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Насыйкат в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2010 года занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 6 коров, 100 овец. Благодаря упорному труду Насыйкат, ее деятельность приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Насыйкат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Nasyikat is 23 years old, married and has one child. Nasyikat has a secondary education and has very good references from her neighbors. To provide the primary income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 2010. Her farm contains 6 cows and 100 sheep. Thanks to Nasyikat's hard work, her business yields about 20,000 som (KGS) per month, which serves as the base for covering the family's food and basic consumer expenses. In order to further develop her business, Nasyikat requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories such as chargers, batteries, covers and protectors and used clothes to increase he inventory and her sales.

loans.name: Arus

texts.en:
Arus lives and runs her small business in Ijevan City in the Tavush region. She lives alone.

Arus established her business in 2003 and she is still running it today. She has a stall of her own near her house where she sells both food and also stationary supplies. She mentions that her stall is very popular in the district where she lives and she has managed to have a lot of regular customers over the years. She brings most of her products from Yerevan city in a rented car and some she buys from her city’s wholesale market. This is the only source of income for Arus and she tries to organize her work carefully and cleverly so as not to lose even one of her customers.

Arus hopes to have this loan as she wants to refresh her stall’s assortment, both the assortment of food and stationary supplies too.

loans.use: to refresh her stall’s assortment of food and stationary supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for his auto repair workshop.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia una madre de 30 años de edad, es casada tiene un hijo de la edad de cuatro años, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Julia es una mujer muy trabajadora y perseverante que para generar sus ingresos, tiene una pequeña tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes en el lugar de su domicilio desde hace diez años, ella cuenta que gracias a este pequeño negocio que es su fuente de ingresos a logrado sacar adelante  a su familia.
Julia es una madre que se preocupa por las necesidades de la familia es por ello que ahora se a dado cuenta que es muy necesario contar con un terreno donde puedan cultivar y generar otro ingreso, pero Julia no cuenta con suficiente dinero para poder comprar el terreno por lo que solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar un terreno para cultivo.
Julia tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para comprar el terreno y tener otro fuente de ingresos para seguir apoyando a su hijo en escuela para que sea buen profesional.
texts.en:
Julia is 30 years old, married and has a four-year-old son. They live in the community of Sololá. She is a hard-working, persevering woman who started a grocery store in her home ten years ago to generate some income. She states that thanks to this little business which is her source of income, she has been able to raise her family.

Julia is a mother who is concerned about her family's needs and that is why she has now realized that is it very necessary for her to have some land where she can grow a crop and generate more income. But Julia doesn't have enough money to buy the land, and that is why she is asking for a loan. She will use the money to buy land for cultivation. Her hope is that the extra income generated by her purchase of land and the crops she grows on it, will allow her to continue to support her son in school so he can be a good professional.

loans.use: to buy land to cultivate.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Patrick, often described as an extremely experienced farmer. He is 52 years old. As a group leader, he is representing his group of 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Patrick is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again. He will be able to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Patrick says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2012, he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Patrick will use the profits from this season to buy a cow.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.5 acres. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light. With this loan, the group will receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane and her family members run a farm. The farm includes livestock of cows, heifers, chickens and two turkeys. The family also cultivates a large variety of vegetables, including haricots, onions and greens.

They earn income from selling their harvest in local markets. All the available resources and gathered income are used for survival and nothing remains to invest in a farm. Gayane has asked for this loan to buy fertiliser and pesticides for land cultivation as well as to purchase a cow. This is her first loan, and it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

Gayane hopes to receive lenders support, aiming to boost her farm's productivity and improving her family's living a little.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and pesticides for land cultivation as well as to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Pacut 1 Group

texts.es:
Miguel(es el primero del lado derecho)  es un hombre de 41 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre seis y dieciséis años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Miguel un hombre trabajador y responsable que para generar sus ingresos para mantener a su familia, se dedica a la venta de café desde hace quince años en un lugar cercano de su domicilio.
Miguel desde hace algún tiempo tiene cultivando una cuerdas de café que en estos tiempos ya necesitan de su mantenimiento, pero Miguel con lo que gana no se da abasto para poder darle el mantenimiento necesario, por lo que se ha unido a un grupo de campesinos con la misma necesidad, para solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá para pagar la mano de obra y compra de fertilizantes.
El gran sueño de Miguel  es poder tener una tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Miguel (he is first on the right of the photo) is a 41-year-old man, married with a lovely family of three children, aged between 6 and 16. They live in a community of Solola. Miguel is a hard-working and responsible man who, in order to generate income to maintain his family, has been dedicated to selling coffee for the last 15 years. His coffee is grown near his residence.

For some time, Miguel has been cultivating several rows of coffee which, at present, need maintenance. But with what he earns, he lacks sufficient funds to provide the necessary maintenance. For that reason, Miguel has joined a group of farmers with the same needs, to request a loan to invest in paying laborers and buying fertilizers.

Miguel's grand dream is to be able to have a store where he can buy and sell vegetables.

loans.use: to pay laborers and purchase fertilizers to maintain his coffee plantings.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La socia Rita pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Rita continua  dedicándose a su negocio de constructora la cual realiza edificios, casas, entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio.
La socia solicita el crédito para pagar materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Rita is a member of the Communal Bank “Patrón de San Sebastián”, which is in the city of Cusco. She continues to manage a construction business that is in charge of building edifices, houses, and other structures. Rita is a responsible and diligent individual who wants to continue working at her business. Thanks to her effort, she has been able to move forward each day in her business.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nueva Bolivia Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA BOLIVIA” iniciará el décimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosmery es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de gorras, venta de pantalones, venta de busos, venta de polainas, venta de deportivos, venta de edredones, venta de masitas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosmery es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de edredones; da a conocer que este negocio lo implementó hace varios años, aprendiendo la técnica de costura en su colegio, posterior a conseguir un poco de capital decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en la frontera de Bolivia - Perú. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nueva Bolivia” (New Bolivia) is starting its 16th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Rosmery serves as its treasurer. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling blankets, selling caps, selling trousers, selling leg warmers, selling sportswear, selling bedspreads, and selling snacks.

The loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Rosmery. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation through a mass promotion that the organization conducted in her area. She currently has a business of selling bedspreads. Rosmery has become knowledgeable about this business since she started it several years ago. She learned sewing techniques when she was in school. Afterwards, she secured a small amount of capital and decided to start an independent business.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying fabric in bulk. She acquires her supplies from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and then uses them to make her products. Rosmery sells her goods along the border between Bolivia and Peru. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for supporting her family financially. She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Rosmery said that she enjoys the health services offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy fabric in bulk for making bedspreads.

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es:
La socia Ayde  se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva maiz,papa y trigo,la socia es una mujer trabajadora, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ayde makes a living in the farming business. She has a plot of land where she cultivates corn, potatoes, and wheat. She is a hard worker and has been at this business for many years. It is going very well for her. Her dream is to increase her plot of land for farming. 

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is happy about this loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Los Bailarines Group

texts.es: Los bailarines es un grupo solidario que está integrado por dos mujeres y un varón, son socios emprendedores y laboriosos que solicitan por vigésima quinta ocasión el financiamiento para sus negocios en ADIM, quien lo coordina es Maria  que tiene la edad de 30 años, quien por medio de su negocio, que es la venta de cosméticos AVON en comunidades cercana a su domicilio, ayuda a su esposo con los gastos familiares, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de perfumes para damas, caballeros, colonias para niños, pinturas labiales, pinturas de uñas, vanidades, etc., lo que le permitirá cubrir la demanda de los productos ofrecidos, ya que con los créditos anteriores ha logrado adquirir nuevas clientelas. Otro de los integrantes es Alex que tiene la edad de 30 años ofrece el servicio de transporte (acarreo) en departamentos del país, y Jenny de 32 años, quien ha dedicado los últimos ocho años de su vida para la comercialización de ropa y calzado en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Los Bailarines is a solidarity group made up of two women and a man.  They are entrepreneurial and hardworking associates who are asking for their twenty-fifth loan from ADIM for their businesses.  

Maria is the coordinator.  She is thirty years old.  She helps her husband with the household expenses through her business selling Avon cosmetics in communities near her home,.  She is asking for this current loan to buy ladies’ perfume, men’s cologne, fragrances for children, lipstick, nail polish, compacts, etc.  This will allow her to meet the demand for her offered products, because with her previous loans she managed to acquire new customers.  

Another group member is Alex, who is thirty years old.  He offers hauling services in regions of the country.  Jenny is 32 years old; she has spent the last eight years of her life selling clothing and footwear from her home.

loans.use: to buy ladies' perfume, men's cologne, fragrances for children, lipstick, nail polish, and  compacts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase the amount of milk suppled to customers

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur hopes for one more partnership with Kiva and hopes that this time again he will manage to have significant achievements in his farming, because it was his first deal with Kiva that helped him to buy 3 piglets and fodder for his cattle.

Artur is 24 years old and he lives in his native frontier village Vazashen of Tavush region. Artur has no higher education, but he manages to take care of his small family (he lives with his mother) through agriculture and hired construction work around his village. Artur is also good in agricultural activities and his land cultivation gives him harvest of both vegetables and fruits (apples, figs, persimmons, pears, mulberries, quince, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, beans, etc.). The sale of all his farm products such as meat and milk and also his land’s harvest make his family income, which is meager but manages to cover their first needs.

With this loan, Artur would like to purchase more pigs for his farm and fodder for all his farm cattle, until the time when the pastures for the cattle will be filled with green grass.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for his farm and fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years. She is now proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. She is 62 years old, is married, and has nine children.

Judith likes to think of herself as a very experienced farmer. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. Judith plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Judith’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.25 acres of land. Some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light. With this loan, the group will receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is farmer living in Brnakot village, Syunik region. Her husband passed away some years ago, and since then, Gohar has had to manage the cultivation, harvesting and selling work all by herself. Her only son is an army officer, so he is at home during the weekends.

She has been involved in agribusiness for fifteen years, and over those years of hard work, she has been able to develop a sustainable farm. On the farm, Gohar keeps livestock including cows, calves and chickens as well as cultivating wheat, emmer wheat (farro) and potatoes.

Gohar needs some financial resources to purchase four oxen and forage for feeding her livestock, so she has applied for this loan. As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for four oxen and forage for feeding her livestock.

loans.name: Francis' Group

texts.en: Francis is a hard working young man living in the slums of Nairobi. He's come to iSmart's sales and marketing training with his friend Kennedy in hopes of improving their sales skills so that they can earn a living. Now Francis and Kennedy are now working as door-to-door sales agents for iSmart. Each morning they attend the 8 a.m. morning sales meeting and then go out to sell green products like solar lamps and clean cookstoves in their community.  They earn a commission on each sale that they make. Please support Francis and his friend Kennedy to build their sales skills and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for green energy products to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Los Apus Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS APUS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Mariza tiene 57 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna  sus actividades diarias a la venta de plátanos, la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la zona, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño  que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra plátanos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Maritza belongs to LOS APUS communal bank which is located in the Kosñipata district of Paucartambo Province in the department of Cusco. The member is 57 years old, single, and has four children. 

She alternates her daily chores with the sale of plantains which she sells in one of the local markets. She has been doing this for quite some time and it has been going well for her due to the great effort she puts into her business every day. Maritza wants to be able to continue working and supporting her family so she is asking for a loan so she can buy plantains and other items. She feels very grateful for the loan and promises to make all of her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy plantains and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cement, sand, bricks, corrugated metal sheets, beams, and labor in order to make home improvements.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 1 child. She takes care of one additional family member. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family.

Paulina sells local brew from her home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years, and she works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling piped water. 

Paulina has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy jerrycans of local brew. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for transporting her merchandise.

loans.use: To buy jerrycans of local brew

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh, 56 years old, is an amazing woman who wants to help her retired husband in any way.

Amneh's husband could not cover the household expenses because his pension is very low. She is facing all the obstacles with a positive spirit. Amneh  started her business more than 5 years ago. She puts balloons in small bags then her husband goes to any street or in front of a park or mall to sell these balloons.

She wants to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living, therefore she applied for a loan to buy more products to sell and expand her work.

loans.use: to buy more balloons to sell and expand her work

loans.name: Roselyne's Group

texts.en:
Roselyne is 61 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Roselyne has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family, and although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Roselyne also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, about which she is very excited, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save her more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Roselyne's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Velonise is a group leader, aged 41. She is married with three children aged between 7 and 20 years; they all go to school. 

The group is called Twitezimbere, which means “Vision” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses for changing their future. 

Velonise sells food stuffs and has been doing this business for the past 11 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to make savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 54 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store such as condiments, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Liza has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods and soft drinks. 

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as condiments, eggs, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 46-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and she is representing her group of 15 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Mary has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Mary described last year's harvest as very good, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Mary’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Yunila

texts.es: YUNILA: Es una mujer alegre miskita, originaria de Waspam, tiene 39 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Su casa es de madera y  actualmente se encuentra bastante deteriorada.  Es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para reparar su vivienda. Con el préstamo va comprar madera cepillada, postes de madera, clavos y pagar la mano de obra. Ella y su marido sueñan con tener una casa bonita de minifalda (cemento y madera), con mejores condiciones de seguridad y ambiente para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Yunila is a happy Miskita woman from Waspam. She is 39 years old, married, and has three teenage children who are all in school.

Her house is made of wood but is currently in pretty bad shape, so she is asking for a loan so she can do repairs. She will use the money to buy planed wood, wooden posts, nails, and to pay for labor.

She and her husband dream of having a pretty minifalda [literally, miniskirt] house (concrete on the bottom and wood on top), with a better environment and improved safety for the whole family.

loans.use: to make repairs to her wooden stilt house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more jerrycans of cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Populares Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “POPULARES” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Magaly es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, venta de verduras, costura de chompas, venta de juhuitas (empanadas tradicionales), venta de juguetes. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Magaly es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años al conocer a su pareja quien trabajaba elaborando prendas de vestir, con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la facilidad de la obtención del crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The group “Populares” will begin its sixth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the organization’s “Centro Focal de Panamericana.” The group is composed of nine members and is directed by a board of directors where Mrs. Magaly is the President. The businesses that the members of the group bring forward are varied; among them are: selling blankets, selling food, sewing blankets, selling vegetables, making sweaters, selling “juhuitas” (traditional empanadas), and selling toys.

The loan that they take out will benefit the small businesses from the group in which Mrs. Magaly is a member. She says that it has been six years since she joined Pro Mujer; they were admitted based on an invitation from a friend, who is a client of the institution. At present, she has a sewing workshop business. She started this business many years ago upon meeting her partner, who worked in making clothing. Over time, she decided to start an independent business.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase capital—by buying fabric wholesale—that she will acquire from the sellers in the city of El Alto, and then she will sell it in her shop. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is single and has two children. 

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the ease of obtaining a loan the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Haniya

texts.en:
Haniya is a 52-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working as a tailor and selling shoes from her house for three years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Haniya is a hard worker who is trying hard to improve her family's living conditions. This is why today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her child's school tuition fees.

Haniya hopes to develop her business in the future to stay capable of satisfying her child's needs.

loans.use: to pay her child's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
La socia Marlene se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  joyas, ceramicas, mantas y telares,  la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos,ceramicas,joyas, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marlene continues to manage her handicraft business. She sells jewelry, ceramics, blankets, and looms. Marlene has been in this business for eight years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her business of selling woven goods and looms. She is requesting a loan in order to buy woven goods, ceramics, jewelry, sweaters, and looms.

Marlene is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy woven goods, ceramics, jewelry, sweaters, and looms.

loans.name: Solidario Superación De Villa Nueva Group

texts.es:
Solidario Superación de villa nueva
Glenda es casada, tiene 49 años de edad, inicio su negocio hace 14 años cuando por problemas de enfermedad de su esposo ella se vio en la necesidad de obtener ingresos para el hogar, inicio vendiendo helados de puerta en puerta, luego empezó a vender lácteos,  actualmente ella inicio un negocio de confección de ropa para toda la familia, solicita el crédito para poder comprar una máquina de coser, ya que la que tiene no está funcionando bien, agradece a fape la oportunidad de obtener crédito para seguir trabajando en el negocio, anhela que su ultimo hijo termine los estudios para que tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Glenda is married and is 49 years old. She started her business 14 years ago, when she saw the need to earn income for her household, because her husband had problems with illness. She started selling ice cream from door to door. Then, she started selling dairy products. Now, she has started a business making clothing for all of her family. 

She requests a loan to be able to buy a sewing machine, since the one she has is not working well. She is thankful to FAPE for the opportunity of obtaining the loan to continue working on her business. She wants her last son to finish his education so that he has a better future.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing.

loans.name: Adma Diang's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 16 Juillet 2012 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son sixième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes la même localité. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Adama Diang (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de27 ans, divorcée et mère d’un enfant. Elle s’active dans la coiffure depuis 03 ans et la vente de produits cosmétiques et accessoires pour femmes.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter divers accessoires : 03 douzaines de montre, 02 douzaines de bonnets et divers produits pour femme pour les revendre en détails.

Les bénéfices réalisés, lui permettront de prendre en charge la scolarité et les besoins sanitaires de sa fille.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was created and inaugurated on July 16, 2012. The group is entering its sixth loan cycle and consists of women who all live in the same area. They get along well and share a good team spirit. Their main business activity is small trade. 

Mrs. Adma Diang (standing at the far right and raising her hand) is the group’s featured borrower. She is a 27-year-old divorced mother to one child. She has been a hairdresser for three years, and she also sells cosmetic products and women’s accessories. 

She will use this loan to buy various items to retail, namely 3 dozen watches, 2 dozen bonnets and miscellaneous ladies’ accessories. 

Her profits will help her to cover her daughter’s tuition and healthcare expenses.

loans.use: to buy 3 dozen watches, 2 dozen bonnets and miscellaneous ladies’ accessories to retail.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She is also looking after her mother. She has been operating a restaurant at the market for ten years, working six days a week. She gets additional income from selling piped water. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to buy green bananas, sweet potatoes, peas, beans, charcoal and cooking oil. Her challenges include seasonality of food. Her dream is to buy better serving dishes to attract more customers. She lives in her husband`s house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, sweet potatoes, peas, beans and charcoal.

loans.name: Grimael

texts.es:
Grimael tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la agricultura, cultivo de arroz, cacao, café, etc.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con una finca de cacao en produccion, además cuenta con fincas fruteras como son limas, naranjas, paltas, café, entre otros. Tiene más de 10 años de experienca en el rubro y clientes fijos quienes dan buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El crédito lo utilizará para realizar deshierbos y compra de abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, con esto Grimael espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clienteslo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Grimael is 34 years old and in a common-law relationship. He lives with his wife and two children in the District of Pomahuaca in Jaén Province. This area is situated in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The residents of this district engage in agriculture, particularly the cultivation of rice, cacao, coffee, and other crops.

Grimael works in agriculture. He has a plot of land set aside for cacao production. He also has other plots of land where he grows limes, oranges, avocados, coffee, and other products. Grimael has more than 10 years of experience in this trade and his established customers have provided personal and work-related references on his behalf.

This loan will be used to pay for weeding and to buy compost and fertilizers for his crops. As a result, Grimael hopes to offer a better product to his customers so that he can increase his earnings and eventually improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for his crops and to pay for weed removal.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгуль 40 лет, замужем, есть 2 сыновей. У Назгуль среднее образование, много лет занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая семью дополнительным доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Назгуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 20 овец. Также имеется земельный надел, мерою 1,0 Га арендованной и 1,11 Га собственной земли, где она  выращивает фасоль. Младший сын в свободное время активно помогает по хозяйству. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). Назгуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Развитие хозяйства позволит увеличить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Nazgul is 40 years old, married and has 2 sons. Nazgul has a secondary education, and she has been involved in agriculture for many years to provide her family with additional income. Thanks to Nazgul's hard work, today her farm contains 20 sheep and 1.0 hectare of leased and 1.11 hectares of own land, where she grows beans. Her youngest son helps with the business in his free time. Her combined monthly income amounts to 8,000 som (KGS). Nazgul requested a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 10 sheep. Developing her farm will allow her to grow her business and improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Shirinbi

texts.ru: Ширинби 59 лет, замужем, 5 детей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Ширинби в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 20 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ширинби обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Она является лидером группы "Кош-Болот", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Доходы от кредита Ширинби планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Shirinbi is 59 years old, married and has 5 children. To provide the primary income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry for 30 years. Thanks to Shirinbi's hard work, today her farm contains 3 cows and 20 sheep. In order to further develop her business, Shirinbi requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock and increase her livestock headcount. She is the leader of the Kosh-Bolot group that, besides her, consists of 2 more people, with three of them all together. Shirinbi plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is 46 years old and he lives with his big family in the frontier village Kirants of Tavush region. He is the father of three boys: the eldest lives and works in Russian Federation and from there he tries to help is family with money, while his two smaller sons greatly help their parents in farming and agriculture. Artak has a rather big farm and correspondingly a lot of work to do in it. In his farm Artak has cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. He has a large plot of land it also demands great care and work and from it, as a reward, Artak gathers perfect harvests of potatoes, beans, greens, tomatoes, peppers and also fruits such as an apples, persimmons and figs. With his farm’s dairy products and land’s harvest sales, Artak earns money for his family needs. 
This loan will make Artak’s farm bigger, as he plans to buy piglets and a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy piglets and a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Sanabarhan

texts.ru: Санабаркан 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Санабаркан - среднее образование, она трудолюбивая, честная, умеет вести свой бизнес. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, благодаря упорному труду Санабаркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Супруг активно помогает по хозяйству. Накопленные средства стараются вкладывать в развитие и расширение бизнеса. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сомов (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Санабаркан является участником группы "Кош-Болот", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое.  Доходы от бизнеса она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en: Sanabarhan is 53 years old, married and, together with her husband, raising 3 children. Sanabarhan has a secondary education. She is hardworking, honest, and is capable of running her business. To provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and, thanks to Sanabarhan's hard work, today has 3 cows and 20 sheep. Her monthly income amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS). Her husband actively helps her with the business. They try to invest their savings into developing and expanding the business. She requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to increase her livestock headcount. Sanabarhan is a member of the Kosh-Bolot group that, besides her, consists of 2 more people, with three of them all together. She will invest the earnings from the business into further developing it.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik, a farmer living in Vanadzor, formerly bred pigs, but unfortunately they died from disease some years ago. He currently keeps cows, calves and chickens, and also grows potatoes, cherries and grapes. 

Since the house and barn are suitable for keeping pigs again, Garik wants to return to pig breeding and so has requested this loan to purchase seven piglets and forage for feeding the livestock. 

He had previously taken a loan from a local financial institution, but wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to hard work during more recent times, Garik has been able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people with a bad credit history and no access to credit products. 

Garik will be very grateful to all lenders for giving him an opportunity to restart his pig-breeding business.

loans.use: to pay for seven piglets and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Sumomei 2 Group

texts.en:
This is the Sumomei 2 group, which consists of seven ladies who live in Chorkor-Accra, Ghana. They have applied for a loan of 8,000 GHS to invest in their businesses, which include the sale of cosmetic products, fish selling, and seamstress and hairdressing services. 

Gloria is a hardworking woman. She is a 39-year-old married woman with three dependent children who lives with her family in Chorkor. She is the featured borrower in this group. Gloria studied through secondary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. Gloria started her business providing seamstress services to her customers more than thirteen years ago. She sews at her residence. She started her business with a small amount of working capital, thanks to the assistance of her husband who supported her financially. Year after year, her business has improved, but most of what she earns in profits goes toward family expenses and savings. 

Glorai has good experience in this business. Unfortunately, the income is not enough to expand her business, and she wants to improve it. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 1,500 GHS from ID Ghana in order to purchase more materials and lining to sew clothes for her customers. Gloria looks forward to further expanding her business in order to provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase more materials and lining

loans.name: Ghazal

texts.en:
Ghazal is an amazing girl who is working hard to graduate from university. She is a second year student majoring in business administration and lives with her family that consists of six members in Irbid.

Ghazal's father has had a lot of financial crises that led him to work out in Saudi to get a better income to help him cover his financial obligations, but he has a lot of these obligations and that makes him unable to cover Ghazal's tuition costs. Therefore, Ghazal applied for an education loan to cover her semester fees and achieve her dream to find good work.

loans.use: to cover her semester fees and achieve her dream to find good work

loans.name: Manushaqe

texts.en: Manushaqe again wants to do seasonal planting and is requesting this loan to buy potato and onion seeds.

loans.use: To buy potato and onion seeds for planting.

loans.name: Onofre

texts.es:
Onofre es un hombre de 62 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de ocho hijos de las edades entre catorce y treinta años de edad, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Onofre para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la agricultura desde hace veinte años, para el trabajar en el campo es una bendición pues es la única forma que él tiene para generar sus ingresos y cuidar la naturaleza.
Onofre es un hombre que le preocupa las necesidades de su familia, por lo que ahora se ha dado cuenta  que una de las necesidades primordiales es la construcción de unos cuartos porque hasta en este tiempo sus cuartos son de tabla por lo que él ha considerado hacerlos de block, aunque para esto el necesita de una buena cantidad de dinero que es la limitación que él tiene , por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemente, block, arena y hierro.
El gran anhelo de Onofre es hacer su casa de bock para que su familia tenga una buena comodidad.
texts.en:
Onofre is a 62-year-old man. He is married and has a beautiful family with eight children between the ages of 14 and 30 years old. They live in a community of Sololá.

To generate income and take care of his family, Onofre has been dedicated to agriculture for 20 years. To work on the farm is a blessing, since it is the only way he has of generating an income and taking care of nature.

Onofre is a man who worries about the needs of his family. Now, he has determined that one of their fundamental needs is building some rooms in their home because until now, his rooms are made of boards. As a result, he has considered making them from blocks. For this, however, he needs a good amount of money, which is the limit that he has. Because of this, he has decided to request a loan that will be used to buy cement, blocks, sand, and iron.

Onofre’s biggest desire is to make his house out of blocks so that his family has food comfort.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, sand, and iron to build rooms in his house.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of 9 children.

In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, Rehana began a business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated.

Rehana has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses

loans.name: Zakaria's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Zakaria, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to three children; he is known by his community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Zakaria joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to save more money. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Zakaria plans to send his children to school.

Between the 14 farmers in Zakaria's Group, a total of 10.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock of fabric materials for making dresses

loans.name: Halnisa

texts.ru: Халниса, 57 лет, замужем, воспитала 2 детей. В 1985 году, в поисках источника финансирования своей семьи, Халниса начала свой бизнес в разведении скота, использовав стартовую сумму в 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, Она сумела развить свое хозяйство, с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме до 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, в ее хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы, 15 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Халниса обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец на откорм. Она является участником группы "Кош-Болот", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. В ближайшее время, при помощи доходов от кредита, Халниса планирует увеличивать поголовье скота и построить сарай.
texts.en: Halnisa is 57 years old, married and raised 2 children. In search of a source of income for her family, Halnisa started her own business in fattening up livestock in 1985 with an initial capital of 50,000 som (KGS) used to buy livestock. She was able to develop her business to  have a monthly profit of up to 15,000 som (KGS). Today, her farm contains 3 cows and 15 sheep. In order to further develop her business, Halnisa requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy sheep for fattening up. She is a member of the Kosh-Bolot group that, besides her, consists of 2 more people, with three of them all together. Halnisa plans to increase her livestock headcount and build a barn in the near future with the help of the earnings from the loan.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening up

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Rosemary, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to three children, known by her community as a very reliable person.

Initially, Rosemary joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to save more money. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Rosemary plans to send her children to school.

Between the 10 farmers in Rosemary's Group, a total of 6.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a good father and wants to provide a good life, good education and good standard of living for his family.

He started his career journey in a building supplies store. He gained experience in the commerce field and wanted to start his own business, so he rented a shop which is selling general products. 

Ahmad wants to improve the standard of living for his family, therefore he is thinking of expanding his work. He requested a loan to buy more products to sell and develop his work to increase his income and access his goals.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell and develop his work to increase his income

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. They make balls in different sizes and colors and sell them in their community and in the local market. They are famous in their town for providing good quality footballs. They earn enough through their business to bear the expenses of their family. 

For the improvement of their business, Nasreen has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantities to cater to more customers without delay. 

She is hopeful to get an increase in their sales, and dreams of expanding their business.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantities

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is 39 years old, a married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and sales with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. 

She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 36-year-old mother of three whose husband has been buying and selling animals for many years. She fully supports and assists him with his work. 

Nasreen has requested a loan of 35000 PKR to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all of her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell.

loans.name: Las Margaritas De Chipop Group

texts.es:
Sandra (es la que está en medio de la fotografía de suéter rosada) es una mujer de 23 años de edad, es casada tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Sandra para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa, se dedica a la compra y venta de aguacates desde hace cinco años en una plaza de su comunidad, ella cuenta que gracias a este pequeño negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Sandra su gran sueño es poder incrementar su negocio, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder hacerlo, porque ella tiene que cubrir los gastos de la casa por lo que sus ganancias no se dan abasto,  es la razón que la motivo a ella para formar un grupo para  solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en su negocio de compra y venta de aguacates.
Sandra tiene las esperanzas para conseguir el préstamo, para hacer su sueño realidad, para mejorar sus ingresos y comprar un lote de terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Sandra (the one in the middle of the picture, in the pink sweater) is a 23 year old woman, married, has a two year old son and they all live in the community of Solalá. To help her husband with household income, Sandra has been working buying and selling avocados in the community plaza for the last five years. She notes that thanks this small business, she has been able to support her family.

Sandra’s great dream is to be able to grow her business, but one of the difficulties she is facing is that she does not have enough funds to be able to do it, since she has to cover the household expenses with her profits and there is not enough left. This is the reason that motivated her to apply for a loan, which she will invest in her business of buying and selling avocados.

Sandra has hopes to get this loan to make her dream a reality, to improve her income and buy a plot of land on which to build their house.

loans.use: purchase and sell avocados.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem, a 45-year-old married mother of three, has been buying and selling animals with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life, and she is very motivated to provide to her children a beautiful life that includes a good education, food and clothing. 

Shameem has requested a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase more baby goats and calves for her business. She is hopeful that her enterprise will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna with her family living happily at the frontier village Achajur of Tavush region has been engaged in farming and agriculture since 1995. Ruzanna is married and she has a son who is 22 years old, who decided to become farmer and is engaged in any work about their farm in order to learn all the skills connected with farming. Ruzanna’s husband, during the year with the hope of earning some more money, goes to do seasonal work in Russian Federation. He is in the village only half the year to help Ruzanna in farming. In her farm Ruzanna has cows, calves and bulls. Her plot of land is large and it gives a rich assortment of vegetables and fruits: potatoes, greens, carrots, apples, figs, pears, peaches and nuts. Ruzanna sells all her farm products at the city’s wholesale market with her son's help. Her customers are re-sellers and also city people who have known Ruzanna for many years and who like the quality of her farm products. 

Ruzanna will be pleased to receive this loan as she wants to start swine breeding with the help of Kiva lenders in her farm and she will buy several pigs as well as animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy several pigs and also animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Salaton

texts.en:
Salaton is 27 years old and single. He has a retail shop that has lasted for five years now. He is taking a second loan. He will be using the loan to purchase more clothes. 

He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to open another business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 30-year-old, married woman. She is been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to buy spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and also stock for her boutique

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Mary is 59 years old. She is married with 6 children. She has had a retail business for 20 years. She sells cereal and food items such as rice and maize flour. 

She will be using the loan to purchase rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking oil and hopes this will help her serve more clients and meet the high demands of her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase more cereal, rice and maize flour to sell and she hopes this will enable her to meet the clients' needs and demands.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem has started a business of selling animals to provide her family with a better standard of living. She earns a good amount of income to bear her household expenses.

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Shahkila

texts.en: Shahkila is 42-year- old, married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and sales with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of eight children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: La Familia Luchadora Group

texts.es:
Matilde (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía con blusa azul claro) es una mujer de 35 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Matilde para generar sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la compra y venta ropa típica en  una plaza de su comunidad, para ella esta actividad es muy rentable.
Matilde con el afán de ver crecer su negocio a luchado día con día a mejorar sus servicios, pero esto no ha sido suficiente para  lograrlo pues bien se requiere de un capital para hacer crecer el negocio, pero ella tiene una dificultad que es la de no contar con el capital suficiente para poder realizar la inversión, por lo que ha organizado a un grupo de personas para juntos solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá para comprar una diversidad de ropas típicas y compra de hilos porque ella ahora  ha pensado en elaborar pulseras.
Matilde tiene las esperanzas puestas en este crédito, para poder realizar su sueño que es la de ver su negocio prosperado y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Matilde (the first on the left side of the picture, with the light blue blouse) is a 35 year old woman, single, who lives with her parents in the Sololá community. To generate income and help support her parents with household expenses, Matilde has been working buying and selling traditional clothing in her community since 10 years ago. This is a very profitable business for her.

With the goal to grow her business, Matilde has worked hard on a daily basis to improve her service, but it has not been enough to meet her goal, since she requires capital to grow her business and she has the difficulty of not having enough capital to invest, this being the reason she has organized a group of people to request a loan together, which she will invest in the purchase of a diversity of traditional clothing and threads, as she is also intends to make bracelets to sell. Matilde’s hopes for this loan is that it will be able to make her dream a reality, which is to see her business prosper and the improvement of her income.

loans.use: buy and sell traditional clothing from her region and purchase threads to make bracelets.

loans.name: Sanawar

texts.en:
Sanawar is 31 years old. She is a married woman. 

She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase her income from the sale of milk to her clients.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 23 years old. She is married with 2 children. She has had a retail shop business for 5 years. 

She will be using the loan to purchase clothes to sell and hopes this will help her to educate her children and build a better house for her family. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children to university level.

She has borrowed Kshs 20,000 to be repaid in one year, and her monthly income is about Kshs 10,000. She is in her second loan cycle and she repaid her previous loan well.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fazal

texts.en:
Fazal is a 60-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of purchase and sale of animals with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of seven children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Nasrren

texts.en: Nasrren is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Nasrren  is well known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew more dresses on time in order to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth for her business.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is 59 years old and has 8 children. She has been a farmer for more than 40 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. 

Even though Grace is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Grace started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. 

Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Grace’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 10 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season.

loans.name: Benjamin's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Benjamin, who is representing 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya as group leader. He is married and is a father to four children. He is known by his community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Benjamin joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program, he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to consistently feed his family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Benjamin plans to send his children to school.

Between the 14 farmers in Benjamin's Group, a total of nine acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer purchased with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing solar lights, so the group will also receive a total of 11 solar lights with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a 41-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

Rahila has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 
 
Rahila wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently.
