She hopes to get a boost in her earnings to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices

loans.name: Tipindule Group

texts.en:
Kelita thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her. She used the loan to purchase more materials for her workshop. She used the profits made to pay school fees for her children and to provide them with food three times a day.

Her ambition is to buy a secondhand vehicle for her family, so she would like to get another loan in order to increase her profits so that she can fulfill her dreams.

She plans to continue expanding her business and hopes to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as metals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty salon products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase her income from the sale of milk to her clients.

loans.name: Seleon

texts.en:
Seleon is 37 years old. He is married with four children, ages 12, 8, 5 and 2 years, whom he supports. 

Seleon has been a motorbike transport provider for the last 15 years now.

He is taking  his second loan with VisionFund Kenya which he will use to repair and maintain his motorbike. 

His hopes and dreams for his business and his children are to expand the business and educate his children.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his motorbike..

loans.name: Nthenya

texts.en:
Serah is 39 years old. She is married and has one child. For the past thirteen years, she has run a hotel business.

Serah has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase additional items for her hotel. Ther earnings will help Serah pay for her child's school fees. Serah's dreams for the future are to have a fruitful business and stable family income.

loans.use: to purchase items for her hotel

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 43-year-old male and married. He has one child, 4 years old, whom he supports. 

John  has been in the transport industry via his motorcycle for some years and he is glad to be making profits. 

He is taking his second loan with VisionFund Kenya  which he will use to repair and maintain his motorbike. He intends to use the anticipated profits to expand his current business. 

His hope and dream is to diversify into large scale farming.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his motorbike.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is forty-eight years old. She is married and has nine children. 

Elizabeth is a tailor, and she has been in business for six years. Her monthly income is eighteen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is Elizabeth's first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase tailoring material such as clothing material and threads. 

Elizabeth plans to use the profits to pay school fees for their children. 

In the future, she wants to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material and threads

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 43-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase for many years.

Parveen fully supports and assists her husband with his work. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 45-year-old woman from the Kitale area of Kenya. She has been married to her husband for twenty-six years and they have five children. Her youngest child is five years old and the eldest is twenty-five years old. 

Grace has been a farmer since she got married. She operates her farm on a small piece of land under her husband's name, where she raises dairy animals and poultry and grows crops. Grace is seeking a  loan of KES 50,000 to pay for modern farm implements. With modern tools, Grace will work more efficiently. She expects to see major improvements in the quality and quantity of her yield.

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 70 years old. He is married and has five children. For the past fourteen years, he has had a farming business. 

Simon will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer. He hopes that these inputs will help him grow more cash crops to sell.  This will allow him to make more money, which will go towards paying his grandchildren's school fees. Simon's dreams for the future are to have a prosperous farming business and the ability to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mabkhot

texts.en:
Mabkhot and his nine children live in a small house. The size of his family makes his current housing arrangements inadequate. 

Despite working as a teacher in the public sector, Mabkhot's salary doesn't allow him to expand his house as most of his income goes to cover his family's necessary expenses. Therefore, Mabkhot decided to request a loan of 300,000 YER from Kiva partner, AMB, to purchase construction materials to expand his house. 

Mabkhot plans to build a second floor, which will provide three extra rooms. The expansion will provide space for a washing machine, which he needs very much. Additionally, the expansion will include a reading room for Mabkhot's eldest child, who is a student. Currently, since there isn't a room for him to read for his classes, he has to leave the house everyday and spend a lot of time finding a suitable space to study.  

This loan will allow Mabkhot to provide his family with better living conditions and make the home more spacious and comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand his house

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 44-year-old father of one son. He wants to provide a perfect life and education for his son. 

He started his own business five years ago, which is a retail store for selling food supplies. His income became unable to cover all his household expenses and his son`s education fees. 

Therefore, he is thinking to expand his work and that's why he applied for a loan to buy more products to sell and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell and increase his income.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel is asking for a second credit to complete his house. He is very proud of the new addition to his home, and grateful of the opportunity he has to continue making the changes he needs. He is now asking for a credit to buy the materials needed to add the aluminum installations on the windows, doors and bathroom. Manuel know that hard work is what has given him this second opportunity and through hard work he is going to honor his commitment. Manuel says that by taking small steps by the hand of the people that help him, he is able to build his dream.

loans.use: to buy materials to complete building two rooms and a bathroom

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy thread (silk and other kinds) to make clothing typical of her region.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. 

Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop.

Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their 2 children. 

Currently, Shamim requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items, including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to attract the maximum number of customers to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items, including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to attract the maximum number of customers to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more good flour for the customers.

loans.name: Dúo Trabajadoras Tecpaneca Group

texts.es:
Dúo Trabajadoras Tecpaneca
Doña Lucia, es originaria del municipio de Tecpan, ella tiene 46 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus cinco hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos a mano y a la crianza de pollos.
El esposo de ella trabaja como jornalero y gracias al apoyo de el ella sigue adelante con su negocio, ya que es el único medio que tiene para salir adelante.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en compra de materia prima para elaborar sus tejidos típicos y compro pollos y para crianza.
Ella sueña con ampliar mas su negocio, tener suficiente materia prima para elaborarlo ya que así obtendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor.Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima y pollos para la crianza.
texts.en:
The Dúo Trabajadoras Tecpaneca Group

Lucia is from the municipality of Tecpan. She is 46 years old and takes care of her five underage children. She makes a living making handmade woven products and raising chickens.

Her husband works as a day laborer, and it is thanks to his support that she is able to continue with her business—as this is the only means she has to get ahead.

She invested the loan that she received in the purchase of raw materials to make her traditional handmade woven products and in the purchase of chickens to raise them.

Her dream is to expand her business further and have enough raw materials to make her products. In this way, she will make a better profit and will be able to send her kids to school so that they can have a better future. 

She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials and chickens to raise.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for weaving and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina previously asked for a credit to build a proper roof and walls for her house. Now that she is able to continue working on her house, she now wants to ask for a second credit to make some aluminum installation on the windows and doors. This will help her install proper glass windows instead of just fabric as she currently has and shield her home from temperature changes. Catalina is excited about continue making these improvements that make her feel proud of her house. This is just the next step as she says and is interested in having a great track record so she can continue making more improvements in the future.

loans.use: to finish her home

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 55 years old. She is a widow with three children. She has had an Agriculture business for 16 years.

She will be using this loan to purchase farm inputs and hopes this will help her improve the mode of farming in order to increase production of crops.

Anna's hopes and dreams for the future are for her to have a stable business and her children to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs in order to increase production of crops.

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.en: Emigdio previously requested a credit to build a bathroom. Now Emigdio is taking this opportunity to ask for a credit to install tile in the bathroom and cover the cement floor which will help protect the construction. Emigdio is proud and really enjoying his new life with a bathroom inside his house. He wishes to make this new improvement so that his investment can be protected and make sure that the bathroom will last for generations. Emigdio is excited about this opportunity and looks forward to finish this credit so he can make new needed improvements to his house.

loans.use: to install tile in the new bathroom

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.en: Maria Felix is very happy and excited that she finished the previous construction work and paid off the credit. Now, Maria is thrilled of the opportunity to ask for a second credit to continue working on replacing the roof of her house. The previous credit was used to replace the roof on top of the room, with this credit she will be able to replace the roof on the rest of the house. Not only is she excited about having a new and long lasting roof, but also, she is now aware of the health issue and asbestos roof represents and is looking forward to providing a safer environment for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to replace an asbestos roof and install a floor

loans.name: Maricela

texts.en: This is the third credit Maricela is requesting to build her house. Prior credits where used to do work on the exterior of the house. This new credit Maricela is asking is to complete the interior walls. She needs to buy cement and other materials to cover the brick and electric installation. Maricela is very proud of what she has accomplished. But her joy comes from showing her children the things they can achieve through hard work and commitment.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish interior walls of her house

loans.name: Elica Paula

texts.en: This is the third credit Elica is requesting to build her house. Prior credits where used to do work on the exterior of the house. This new credit Elica is asking is to complete the interior walls. She needs to buy cement and other materials to cover the brick and electric installation. Elica is very proud of what she has accomplished. But her joy comes from showing her children the things they can achieve through hard work and commitment.

loans.use: to finish interior walls

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.en: María de Lourdes is 50 years old and has owned a business making customized picture frames for over 15 years. She is responsible for giving life to photos, paintings, drawings, certificates, and other items. María is requesting a loan of MXN 10,000 to pay rent at her shop in advance and to buy materials such as wood, nails, and glass for frames. María's goal is to increase sales to expand the space and to provide a higher quality of life for her family. In addition, the higher income will allow her to make successful repayents on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to pay rent and buy materials to make picture frames.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (coffee) since 20 years ago. Age 40 years; He is married and has six children. It is clear that Antonio works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Antonio is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Jocelyn Alejandra

texts.en: A passionate and a very responsible business woman, Jocelyn is 36 years old and unmarried. She is an entrepreneur who has always held an admiration for books, so she combined her passion, the desire to build a business, and her goal to improve the culture in society. For this reason, she founded a publishing business in 2010 that provides all editorial services from procedures to design, editing, and printing, and now also offers electronic books. Currently, the business is located in an apartment, but Jocelyn would like to take it into a more formal setting to be able to increase production. She plans to start a family in the near future and would like to provide the highest quality of life for her children. Her dream is to be the most important publisher in the city and to expand to other regions. With the intent on accomplishing this goal, Jocelyn is requesting a loan of MXN 10,000 to pay for equipment maintenance, and to cover printing materials and operating expenses. She has worked hard for four years to achieve this dream and Jocelyn would be very grateful if lenders support her business to enable her have a deeper impact in society. The increased income derived from the use of this loan will allow Jocelyn make successful payments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to pay for equipment maintenance, printing materials, and operating expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Ismakhon

texts.ru: Исмахону 37 лет. Она проживает на районе Рудаки. В Таджикистане многие улицы, районы и города переименовывают в честь великих писателей и ученых таджикского народа. Рудаки был назван в честь основателя классической таджикской литературы Абуабдулло Рудаки. Исмахон мать одиночка. Она воспитывает своего 8 летнего ребенка одна. Она работает бухгалтером в организации по предоставлению технического сервиса уже 6 лет. Исмахон решила устроить маленький ремонт дома. Она рассчитала все и ей не хватает не большой суммы денег, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Исмахон видит выход из данной ситуации только в получении кредита. Поддержите Исмахон.
texts.en:
Ismakhon is 37 years old and she lives in the Rudaki district.  In Tajikistan, many streets, districts and cities are named in honor of famous Tajik writers and scientists.  The district of Rudaki got its name from the founder of Tajik classic literature, Abu Abdollah Rudaki.

Ismakhon is a single mother.  She raises her 8-year-old child by herself.  For six years already, she has been working as an accountant in an organization which provides technical services.

Ismakhon has decided to perform a few renovations at home.  She has counted her savings and she's only missing a small amount of money.  To her, getting a loan is the only solution.  Please support her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and renovate her house.

loans.name: Abejitas De Pilcopata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ABEJITAS DE PILCOPATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Kosñipata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maritza Antonia ella es soltera y tiene 54 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos, paltas, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
El socio que esta pegado a ala foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de artesania.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong the the “ABEJITAS DE PILCOPATA” communal bank.  This bank is located in the Kosñipata district in the Paucartambo province, Cusco department.

The member, Maritza Antonia, is single.  She is 54 years old and has one child.  She works in her business of growing fruit.  She has a piece of land where she grows bananas, avocados, tangerines, and oranges.  She works from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She has been in this business for several years, and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to increase the land she cultivates.

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  

The member's photo that is attached to the group photo was taken after the meeting.  He asked permission for work reasons.

The other members devote themselves to the businesses of selling animals, selling clothes, a grocery store, and handicrafts. 

Maritza Antonia is grateful to those who form part of this dream by this means.  She pledges to make her payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase various types of thread such as silk, German, wool, and embroidery floss to better develop typical costumes.

loans.name: Dúo El Capetillo De Alotenango Group

texts.es: Dúo El Capetillo de Alotenango está integrado por doña Carmela  quien desde hace 6 años posee una tienda y comenzó su negocio con la venta pocas cosas y desde entonces ha crecido su negocio ella solicita su crédito para la compra de estanterías ya que no posee suficiente espacio para colocar y mostrar sus mercadería. Desde ya les agradese su ayuda en su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmela is a member of the Dúo El Capetillo de Alotenango.  She has had a store for six years.  She started her business by selling a few things.  From then on she has grown her business.

She is requesting a loan to buy shelves because she does not have enough space to place and display her merchandise.  She is already grateful for your help in her business.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Gorrion Dorado Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde se ubica el grupo “Gorrión Dorado” es muy pacífica y sus habitantes muy trabajadores. Ahora que está a punto de iniciar la época de siembra de maíz que es la base de la alimentación durante todo el año, los hombres salen temprano al campo a preparar la tierra.  
Rigoberto es un joven muy trabajador, desde pequeño sus padres lo motivaron a trabajar el campo y criar animales. Ahora, a sus 25 años de edad y con la dicha de tener a su propia familia, las actividades que aprendió de sus padres le ayudan a ofrecer mejores oportunidades a su esposa y a sus dos pequeñas. 
Durante la semana, Rigoberto trabaja como albañil en su propia comunidad, pero en casa tiene becerros, cerdos y borregos que cuida durante algunos meses para después vender. A pesar de que tiene más años de experiencia, fue hace 10 años que comenzó la actividad de manera independiente.  
Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano antes de irse a trabajar Rigoberto prepara la comida y agua para los 20 animales que tiene actualmente. Además, su esposa también lo apoya estando al pendiente. A Rigoberto le fascina criar animales y confiesa que no le agrada mucho ser empleado “Con mi propio negocio soy más libre y puedo disponer más de mi tiempo”.
Actualmente Rigoberto necesita capital para comprar alimento para todos sus animales. “Ya se me terminó todo el zacate y maíz que había acumulado, para eso necesito de mi préstamo”. El apoyo permitirá a Rigoberto a mantener a sus animales en las mejores condiciones para obtener más ganancias a la hora de venderlos. 
Pensando en el futuro, le gustaría tener 15 cerdas y dejar de comprar lechones. “Son animales que se reproducen más rápido y en una sola camada puedo tener 15 cerditos. También se venden mucho más rápido” comentó Rigoberto.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Teófila y Laura quienes invertirán en su tienda de abarrotes y Leticia en pollos. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco del municipio, cerca también se encuentran el palacio de gobierno, una fuente, la plaza y la iglesia católica.
texts.en:
The community where the "Gorrión Dorado" group is located is very peaceful and its inhabitants are very hard-working. Now that the corn planting season is about to begin, which is the nutritional base for the whole year, the men leave early to the countryside to prepare the land.

Rigoberto is a very hard-working young man. Since he was young, his parents encouraged him to work in the countryside and raise animals. Now, at 25 years old and having his own family, the work he learned from his parents helps him to offer better opportunities to his wife and their two little ones. 

During the week, Rigoberto works as a bricklayer in his own community, but at home they have young bulls, pigs and lambs that he cares for during some months to later sell them. Despite having more years of experience, it was 10 years ago that he began this work independently.  Every morning from very early, before leaving to go to work, Rigoberto prepares the food and water for the 20 animals that he currently has.  In addition, his wife also supports him, keeping an eye on them. Rigoberto is fascinated by raising animals and says that he isn't very satisfied by being employed "with my own business, I am more free and I can make use of more of my time."

Currently, Rigoberto needs capital to purchase feed for all of his animals. "I have finished all the fodder and corn that I had accumulated, so I need a loan." The support will allow Rigoberto to maintain his animals in the best condition to get more earnings at the time to sell them. 

Thinking of the future, he would like to have 15 sows and stop buying suckling pigs. "They are animals which reproduce faster and in only litter, I can have 15 piglets. They also sell much faster," commented Rigoberto. 

The other members of the group are Teófila and Laura who will invest in their grocery store and Leticia in chickens.

*The photo was taken on the steps of the municipal kiosk, near where the government palace, a fountain, the plaza and a Catholic church are located.

loans.use: to purchase food for his animals.

loans.name: Los Vecinos Del Rincón Group

texts.es:
“Los Vecinos del Rincón” es un grupo conformado en una comunidad con raíces indígenas de la cultura mazahua. Los integrantes del grupo se sienten orgullosos de pertenecer a un lugar rico en historia y recursos naturales “Tenemos árboles y vegetación por todos lados” comentaron. Además la comunidad está alejada del centro municipal, lo que le otorga aún más tranquilidad a la población. Para los integrantes, la comunidad es su “pequeño rincón” de allí el nombre del grupo.
Don Faustino es un hombre muy amable y sumamente responsable con su esposa y tres hijos. Desde hace tres años se ha dedicado a la cría y engorda de borregos. Empezar su actividad fue iniciativa propia e invirtió sus ahorros para poder comprar 3 borregos y tener ganancias extra aparte de su ingreso como albañil. 
Faustino recuerda que cuando inició, no tenía ningún corral para mantener a los animales a salvo: "Estoy agradecido con VisionFund México porque con sus préstamos pude aumentar el número de animales, y también logré construir un espacio adecuado para ellos.” Con el nuevo crédito, Faustino comprará 3 corderos más para seguir aumentando su rebaño ya que recientemente vendió algunos animales y únicamente tiene siete en casa. Además, se quiere acercar más a su sueño de tener 30 animales y poder mayor cantidad a sus clientes. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Juana y Delfina quienes invertirán en la cría de borregos; Don José Juan y Juan Carlos, en la compra de borregos para vender barbacoa y Eulalia, en pollos y pavos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín municipal, cerca se encuentran también el palacio de gobierno, una plazoleta, un quiosco y la iglesia católica.
texts.en:
“Los Vecinos del Rincón” is a group with indigenous roots of Mazahua culture. The group members are proud to belong to a place rich in history and natural resources. "We have trees and vegetation all over," they said. In addition, the community is far from the municipal center, which grants the population even more calm. For the members, the community is their "little corner" and from that came the name of the group.

Faustino is a very friendly and extremely responsible man with his wife and three children. For the past three years, he has worked raising lambs. He began this work by his own initiative and invested his savings to be able to purchase 3 lambs and have earnings in addition to his income as a bricklayer.  

Faustino remembers when he began he didn't have any corral to keep the animals safe: "I am grateful to VisionFund Mexico because with their loans, I could increase the number of animals and also managed to build a space fit for them all." With the new loan, Faustino will purchase 3 more sheep to continue growing his flock since he recently sold some animals and only has seven at home. In addition, he wants to get closer to his dream of having 30 animals and to be able to improve his customers' quality of life. 

The other members of the group are Juana and Delfina who will invest in raising lambs, José Juan and Juan Carlos, in the purchase of lambs to sell barbecue, and Eulalia in chickens and turkeys. 

*The photograph was taken in the municipal garden, near where the government palace, a large plaza, a kiosk and a catholic church are located.

loans.use: to purchase lambs.

loans.name: Para Vivir Mejor Group

texts.es:
Hace ya varios años se conformó el grupo de préstamo llamado "Para Vivir Mejor". Los integrantes eligieron el nombre porque encontraron en VisionFund México la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamo para invertir o iniciar un negocio que les permitiría mejorar su calidad de vida. 
 La comunidad donde viven, se distingue porque la mayoría de las viviendas están construidas de madera y una de las actividades económicas más sobresalientes es el cultivo de maíz. 
Doña Juana se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora y mantener su espíritu emprendedor lo que le permitió sacar adelante, junto con su esposo,  a sus 9 hijos quienes actualmente ya tienen su propia familia. 

Hace 6 años, Juana inició a criar y vender borregos. Las ganancias le permitieron abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Juana se muestra muy agradecida con VisionFund México ya que los préstamos le han ayudado a ver avances en sus actividades. "Cuando inicié, prácticamente no tenía nada, pero con el tiempo la tienda ha crecido, hay más mercancía y el número de borregos va en aumento” comentó muy contenta Doña Juanita, como la llaman en la comunidad. Precisamente invertirá su nuevo préstamo en más mercancía y en 6 corderos.

Gracias a su visión de negocio, recientemente Juanita compró un molino que renta a los vecinos para moler su maíz y poder hacer las tradicionales tortillas. Esta tercera actividad le permite incrementar sus ganancias un poco más. Dentro de sus planes a futuro, está el mejorar su local que está construido de madera y dar continuidad a sus  tres negocios. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son J. Guadalupe y Josefina quienes invertirán en borregos; Martha y Berenice, en cerdos y Esmeralda, en pollos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco del municipio, Doña Juana lleva un rebozo blanco*
texts.en:
Some years ago now, the loan group called "Para Vivir Mejor" was formed. The members chose the name because they found in VisionFund Mexico the opportunity to access a loan to invest in or begin their businesses which would allow them to improve their quality of life.

The community where they live stands out because the majority of the houses are made of wood and one of the most important economic activities is the cultivation of corn. 

Juana is characterized by being very hard-working and maintaining her entrepreneurial spirit which allowed her to get ahead with her spouse and their 9 children who currently have their own families. 

Six years ago, Juana began to raise and sell sheep. The earnings permitted her to open a small grocery store. Juana is very grateful to VisionFund Mexico since the loans have helped her see advances in her work. "When I began, I had practically nothing, but with time, the store has grown, there is more merchandise, and the number of sheep increase" said a very happy Juanita, as the community calls her. She will specifically invest the new loan in more merchandise and in 6 lambs. 

Thanks to her business vision, Juanita recently bought a mill that she rents to the neighbors to mill their corn and to be able to make the traditional tortillas. This third business permits her to increase her earnings a bit more. Among her future plans are improving her retail space which is built of wood, and to give continuity to her three businesses. 

The other members of the group are J. Guadalupe and Josefina who will invest in sheep, Martha and Berenice in pigs, and Esmeralda in chickens. 

*The photograph was taken on the steps of the municipal kiosk. Juana is wearing a white shawl.*

loans.use: to purchase groceries and 6 lambs.

location.town: Yondece del Cedro, San Jose del Rincon.

loans.name: San Antonio Barrio Group

texts.es:
San Antonio Barrio es un grupo conformado en una comunidad mazahua donde algunos habitantes aún conservan sus tradiciones como los coloridos trajes típicos que llevan las mujeres o la lengua materna que aún se escucha en las pláticas de las personas de mayor edad. Las actividades económicas más importantes son la crianza de animales y el cultivo de maíz, frijoles, habas, trigo y flor de calabaza. 

Isabel es una persona muy alegre, madre de 10 hijos, 8 de los cuales aún se encuentran estudiando  preparatoria, secundaria, primaria e incluso los dos más pequeños, el preescolar. “Los gastos de educación son muy altos y muchas veces con el sueldo de mi esposo no alcanzamos a solventarlos” comentó Isabel. Para ella es muy importante que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y tengan más oportunidades de mejorar su calidad de vida para no tener las mismas dificultades que actualmente ella y su esposo enfrentan. 

Desde niña, Isabel experimentó de cerca la crianza de borregos, actividad que desempeñaban sus padres. Fue precisamente su experiencia lo que la motivó para iniciar su propio negocio. “Cuando mis hijos nacieron, los gastos empezaron a aumentar y me di cuenta que también tenía que apoyar”. Entonces Isabel, utilizó sus ahorros para comprar los primeros corderos y poco a poco el negocio comenzó a dar frutos y las ganancias las volvía a invertir. 

Actualmente, Isabel tiene cuatro borregos medianos en casa pero con su préstamo comprará cinco más. Doña Isabel y el resto del grupo están muy contentos y agradecidos con el préstamo porque les ayudará a mejorar sus actividades. Adriana y Vicente invertirán en la crianza de becerros y Gilberta en su tienda de abarrotes. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco del municipio, cerca también se encuentran el palacio de gobierno, la plazoleta y una iglesia católica. Doña Isabel viste un suéter blanco*
texts.en:
San Antonio Barrio is a group from a Mazahua community where some inhabitants still keep their traditions such as their colorful traditional clothing that the women wear or the native language that is still heard in the conversations of the older people. The most important economic activities are raising animals, and growing corn, beans, broad beans, wheat and squash blossoms. 

Isabel is a very happy person, the mother of 10 children, 8 of whom are still in school, in secondary school, primary school, and even the youngest two are in preschool. "Education costs are very high and many times with my husband's salary we don't have enough to pay them," Isabel said. For her, it is very important that her children complete their education and have more opportunities for a better quality of life to not have the same challenges she and her husband currently face. 

Since she was a girl, Isabel experienced close-up the raising of sheep, work that her parents did. It was precisely her experience that motivated her to start her own business. "When my children were born, the costs started to build up and I realized I would also have to help." So, Isabel used her savings to purchase her first lambs and little by little her business began to bear fruit and then she reinvested her earnings. 

Currently, Isabel has four medium-sized sheep at home but with her loan she will purchase five more. Isabel and the rest of the group are very happy and grateful for the loan because it will help them to improve their work. Adriana and Vincente will invest in raising young bulls and Gilberta in her grocery store. 

The photograph was taken on the stairs of the municipal kiosk, also near where the government palace, the large plaza, and a Catholic church are located.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sheep.

location.town: GUARDA SAN ANTONIO, SAN JOSE DEL RINCON

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Doña Domitila le tiene un gran cariño a la tierra, la ha trabajado con gran dedicación durante años, aprovecha y de verdad disfruta todos los beneficios que puede obtener de ella. 

Domitila se dedica a la crianza de lombrices, actividad conocida como lumbricaria, de la cual obtiene abono orgánico líquido y sólido. Además cultiva, nopales, jitomates, duraznos, chiles y flores que vende o utiliza para crear arreglos florales. Hace apenas algunos días también comenzó a criar pollos. 

La aventura de los negocios inició hace 14 años gracias a un ingeniero agrónomo que la capacitó para poder sacar más provecho de la tierra. Ella está muy agradecida con esta persona y con VisionFund México por todos los préstamos que ha recibido y que le han ayudado a hacer crecer sus actividades. El nuevo préstamo lo quiere invertir para comprar algunos tipos de flores como lilis y orquídeas que necesita para entregar pedidos de arreglos florales en algunas iglesias de su comunidad. 

Doña Domi, como le llaman de cariño, ha recibido y aprovechado cursos de diseño: sus arreglos florales son conocidos en la comunidad y en otros lugares cercanos ya que adornan los mejores eventos de la comunidad.  Afortunadamente, todo el conocimiento que ha adquirido le beneficia sin duda, por ejemplo utiliza el mismo abono orgánico que produce para tener cultivos de buena calidad. 

Con tres hijos mayores e independientes y negocios exitosos, Domitila aún tiene una meta que cumplir, su deseo es que cada vez más personas utilicen el abono orgánico en lugar de recurrir a químicos que dañan la tierra. “Creo que es muy fácil producirlo, nuestros cultivos están mejor y contaminamos menos”.

*En la imagen: Doña Domitila aparece con una de los alcatraces que ella misma cultiva en su invernadero.
texts.en:
Domitila has great love for the earth. She has worked with it with much dedication for years taking advantage of and in truth, enjoying all the benefits that she can get from it. Domitila works raising worms, an activity called Lumbricidae from which she get liquid and solid organic fertilizer. She also grows nopales (cactus) jitomates, peaches, chilies and flowers that she sells or uses to make floral arrangements. A few days ago she started to raise chickens.

Her adventure with these businesses started 14 years ago thanks to an agricultural engineer who trained her to take more advantage of the earth. She is very grateful to this person and to VisionFund México for all the loans she has received that have allowed her to expand her activities.

She wants to invest the new loan buying a few types of flowers like lilies and orchids that she needs to fill orders in some churches in her community. Domi as she is called with affection, has attended and taken advantage of floral design courses and her flower arrangements are known in her community and it's surroundings and adorn the major events in the community.

Fortunately all her knowledge that she has acquired benefits her without doubt for example using the same organic manure that she produces to have high quality crops. With three grown independent children and successful businesses

Domitila still has a goal to reach. Her wish is for more people to use organic fertilizer every time instead of resorting to chemicals that harm the earth. " I think it is very easy to produce them , our crops are better and we contaminate less". In the photo Domitila is shown with one of the lilies that she grows herself in her greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy lilies and orchids.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
Las Rosas es un grupo de préstamo que se unió en una comunidad del estado de Oaxaca donde aún prevalecen pequeños rastros de la cultura mazateca: costumbres, bailes y trajes típicos que elaboran los mismos habitantes. La agricultura es la mayor fuente de empleo ya que se trata además de una región productora de caña. 

Las integrantes del grupo desempeñan distintas actividades económicas pero con el mismo fin de brindar beneficios a su familia. Areli se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa de cama por catálogo; Eva, a cocinar y vender comida; Nancy, a la venta de refrescos; Paola y Tomasa, a la venta de cosméticos y Beatriz, a la venta de tacos. 

Beatriz o Bety, como la conocen en la comunidad, está casada con Antonio quien desde niño apoyaba a sus padres en la taquería familiar. Bety y Antonio han conformado un gran equipo no sólo en su matrimonio sino en el negocio que comenzaron hace año y medio: él transmitió todos sus conocimientos y ella, siempre mostró disposición por aprender y ayudar a incrementar sus ingresos. 

Por lo regular, Antonio se encarga de preparar la carne, los tacos o cualquier platillo que los clientes soliciten, mientras que Bety ayuda a preparar la salsas, las frescas y coloridas aguas de sabores como jamaica, horchata, melón, papaya, piña, fresa, rompope, naranja y sandia, de cobrar y atender a los clientes. Todos los días, de 4 pm a 12 pm la pareja no para en el negocio. 

Bety está muy contenta con su taquería y está agradecida con VisionFund México ya que los préstamos le ayudaron a mejorar  el negocio. Ha comprado sillas, mesas, 2 refrigeradores, 1 enfriador y 1 bocina para ambientar el lugar con música lo que se refleja en el número de clientes que va en aumento.  “Disfruto cuando el local está lleno. “Especialmente los miércoles que los tacos son al 2x1, y los fines de semana que son los días de más trabajo”. El nuevo préstamo lo utilizará para comprar 70 kilos de carne, chiles y fruta de temporada aprovechando que la fiesta del pueblo se aproxima y las ventas serán mejores. 

A Bety le encantaría establecer una sucursal de la taquería en otra comunidad para ofrecer empleo a más personas y así ir conformando un patrimonio para la familia que le gustaría llegar a formar en algún tiempo.

*La fotografía fu tomada en la cocina económica de doña Eva, Bety es quien viste blusa blanca y está detrás de las copas de vidrio.
texts.en:
"Las Rosas" is a communal bank that got together in a community in the state of Oaxaca where small traces of the Mazateca culture still exist, customs, dances and traditional clothing that the people wear. Agriculture is the main source of employment as it is a sugar cane producing region.

The members of the group have different types of economic activities but the same goal of providing benefit to their families. Areli works selling cosmetics and bed-clothing by catalog, Eva cooking and selling food, Nancy sells soft drinks, Paola and Tomasa sell cosmetics and Beatriz sells tacos.

Beatriz or Bety as she is known in the community is married to Antonio, who since he was a child helped his parents in the family Taco shop. Bety and Antonio have formed a great team not only in their marriage but in their business which they started a year and a half ago. He brought all his knowledge and she has shown the willingness to learn and help to increase their income.

Normally Antonio prepares the meat, tacos or whatever plate that the clients order, while Bety helps to prepare the sauces, the natural drinks and flavored water with flavors like hibiscus, horchata, cantaloupe, papaya, pineapple, rompope, orange, and watermelon. She collects the money and attends to the clients. Every day from 4pm to midnight they don't stop.

Bety is very pleased with the taco stand and is grateful to VisionFund México as the loans help to improve the business. She has bought chairs, tables, 2 refrigerators, a freezer and a speaker to give the place some music which is reflected in the number of clients that keeps growing. " I enjoy it when the place is full. Especially Wednesdays when the tacos are two for one and the week-ends are the days with most work".

The new loan will be used to buy 70 kg of meat, chilies and seasonal fruit taking advantage of the community's Saint's Day that is approaching when sales are high. Bety would be thrilled to open a branch of the taco stand in another community offering employment to more people and create a estate for the family that she hopes will come at some time. The photograph was taken in Eva's kitchen. Bety is wearing a white blouse and is behind the glass bottles.

loans.use: to buy 70 kg of meat, chilies and fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing (pants, blouses and shirts).

loans.name: Barahunda Group

texts.es:
Desde el recorrido hacia la comunidad donde se encuentra el grupo de préstamo Barahunda se pueden apreciar sembradíos de caña de azúcar, arboles de algodón y sorgo lo que indica que la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a trabajar en el campo.

Los integrantes del grupo se dedican a una actividad distinta que les ayuda a ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a su familia: María y Lucina se dedican a la venta de dulces; José e Irais, a la cría de cerdos; Elia, a la venta de muebles; María Elena y Alicia, a la venta de comida; Maricela, a la venta de ropa y accesorios; Víctor y Rosa, a la venta de mojarra y Santa, a la venta de carne. 

El gusto por los animales de granja es lo que dio pauta a que Irais  iniciara su actividad hace 5 años. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayudó a construir los chiqueros para los animales y a veces le ayuda a bañarlos cuando regresa del trabajo. Antes de empezar con los quehaceres del hogar, alimenta a los cerdos. En su tiempo de experiencia, Irais perdío una cerda justo después de parir 9 lechones, en aquella ocasión, sus hijos también le ayudaron a cuidar de los pequeños animales alimentándolos con biberones. 

El apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, la educación de sus hijos y tener un pequeño ahorro, satisface a Irais quien está orgullosa de ser capaz de ganar su propio dinero y a la vez estar al pendiente de su familia. También agradece que la estabilidad del negocio se debe a los préstamos de VisionFund México que ha ocupado para comprar alimento especial y suero para los animales, que es justo en lo que invertirá el nuevo préstamo. 

Mirando hacia el futuro, a Irais le gustaría comprar otra cerda para incrementar el número de animales, pero también le gustaría comenzar a vender tacos de carne adecuando un espacio en su casa lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ganancias y los beneficios para su familia. 

Todas las integrantes del grupo se muestran agradecidas por la oportunidad de recibir los préstamos a pesar de vivir en una comunidad muy alejada ya que les han ayudado a mejorar sus negocios o iniciar otras actividades. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de doña Maricela quien adecuado un cuarto en casa como local pare la venta de ropa, Irais viste un suéter de color gris.
texts.en:
Traveling to the community where the "Barahunda" communal bank is located you can appreciate the fields of sugar cane, cotton bushes and sorghum that indicate that the majority of people work the fields. The members of the group have different businesses that offer better living conditions for their families: María and Lucina work selling sweets; José and Irais raise pigs; Elia sells furniture; María Elena and Alicia sell food; Maricela sells clothing and accessories; Víctor and Rosa sell fish (mojarra) and Santa sells meat.

Her love for farm animals gave her the direction for Irene to begin her business 5 years ago. Fortunately she had the support of her husband who helped her build the enclosures for the animals and sometimes helped her clean them when he came home from work. Before starting the housework she feeds the pigs. In her experience over time Irais lost a pig just after it gave birth to 9 piglets. Her children also helped her on this occasion to feed the piglets with milk bottles. She helps her husband with the household expenses, the education of her children and she also has some savings.

This satisfies Irais who is proud of being able to earn her own money and at the same time be there to care for her family. She is also grateful to the loans from VisionFund México for the establishment of the business which she has used to to buy special feed and serum for her animals, which is exactly what she will do with the new loan.

Looking to the future Irais wants to buy another pig to increase the number of animals and she would also like to start selling meat tacos adapting a part of her house which would allow her to increase her income and benefit all her family.

All the members of the group have demonstrated their gratitude for the opportunity of receiving loans in spite of the fact of living in an isolated community as it has helped them improve their businesses or start new businesses. The photo was taken in Maricela's business where she has adapted a room in her house as a place to sell clothing. Irais is wearing a gray colored sweater.

loans.use: to buy feed to promote growth.

loans.name: Dulcero Group

texts.es:
En un pequeño rincón ubicado en la frontera entre dos estados de la República Mexicana se encuentra una comunidad donde las tradiciones familiares se convierten en legado de padres a hijos, especialmente en lo que al trabajo en campo se refiere ya que se trata de una región cañera. 

En este lugar se conformó el grupo de préstamo llamado El Dulcero que también hace referencia a una de las actividades típicas: la elaboración de dulces. Las integrantes del dulcero y sus actividades son: 

Claudia,  Diana – Venta de Dulces 
María – Venta de Zapatos Y Pollo 
Teodora – Venta de Lencería Por Catalogo 
Norma –Venta de Fertilizantes
Escolástica –Venta de Tamales 
Martina, Rosa, Guadalupe –Venta de Ropa 
Ruth – Venta de Repostería 
Esperanza,  Elvia – Venta de Comida 
Brenda – Venta de Calzado Por Catalogo
Ma Antonia – Venta de Comida, Calzado Y Longaniza

Diana  se convirtió en madre de un pequeño apenas hace poco más de un mes. Ella y su esposo José Luis, quien se dedica a trabajar el campo, se esfuerzan día tras día para construir el patrimonio de su pequeño. 

Desde niña, Diana observaba a su madre y a su abuela elaborar dulces como cocadas, jamoncillo, dulce de leche y alfajores para salir a venderlos por la tarde o temprano al siguiente día. La dedicación de ambas mujeres motivó a Diana a seguir sus pasos,  “me gusta hacer dulces es una actividad que durante muchas generaciones ha sido fuente de ingresos en mi familia”.

Desde hace 3 años Diana incursionó de lleno en la actividad, en promedio vende 170 dulces a la semana a pesar de la gran competencia que hay en la comunidad. Con las ganancias, apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y reinvierte en ingredientes. Con el nuevo préstamo comprará maíz, panela, azúcar, semilla de pipián, ajonjolí y coco para aumentar la producción de dulces.

Diana sueña con tener una marca para sus dulces y poder etiquetarlos meta que planea lograr con apoyándose en sus ganancias y en los préstamos de VisionFund México. “Gracias a cada una de las personas que hace posible la oportunidad de recibir un crédito”.

*En la imagen: las integrantes del dulcero, Diana viste blusa color azul marino y se encuentra de pie detrás del pilar del pozo.
texts.en:
In a small corner located on the border of two states in Mexico, a small community is found where the family traditions have become the inheritance from father to child especially the work in the fields in this sugar cane growing region. The "El Dulcero" communal bank was formed here. The name refers to one of the typical businesses which is the production of sweets.

The members of "El Dulcero" and their businesses are: Claudia, Diana – selling sweets; María – selling shoes and chickens; Teodora – selling lingerie by catalog; Norma – selling fertilizers; Escolástica – selling tamales; Martina, Rosa and Guadalupe –Clothing sales; Ruth – selling cakes; Esperanza and Elvia – selling food; Brenda – selling footwear by catalog; Ma Antonia – selling food, footwear and longaniza (hot sausage).

Diana became a mother a little more than a month ago. She and her husband José Luis who works in the fields, work day by day to make an inheritance for their little one. Since she was a girl Diana watched her mother and grandmother making sweets like cocadas (coconut candy), jamoncillo (candy made with milk, sugar and ground pumpkin seeds), dulce de leche and pastries that they went out to sell in the evening or the next morning.

The dedication of both women inspired Diana to follow in their foot-steps. "I like to make sweets which is a business that has been a source of income for many generations in my family". For the past 3 years Diana has entered the business full-time and on average sells 170 candies per week in spite of the fierce competition in the community. With her profits she helps her husband with the household expenses and reinvests in ingredients.

With the new loan she will buy corn, panela, sugar, pumpkin seeds, sesame seeds and cocoa to increase her production of sweets. Diana dreams of making a brand for her chocolate and label them, a goal that she plans to mange through her profits and loans from VisionFund México. "Thanks to each person who makes it possible to have the opportunity to obtain a loan".

In the photo are the members of El Dulcero. Diana is a marine blue blouse and is standing by the pillar of the well.

loans.use: to buy corn, panela, sugar, pumpkin seeds, sesame seeds and cocoa.

loans.name: Honestidad Group

texts.es:
En una pequeña ciudad conocida como “La Novia Del Sol” por las altas temperaturas que alcanza, se conformó el grupo de préstamo llamado Honestidad. Los integrantes y sus actividades son:

Francisca – Venta de Tejidos, Costuras Y Tacos De Canasta.
Teresa – Servicio de Laboratorio Dental
Irma –Venta de Queso
Ernesto – Servicio de Relojería
Sofía – Venta de Cosméticos Y Tamales 
Patricia – Venta de Cosméticos
Angélica –Venta de Postres 

Hace 9 años Doña Irma comenzó a criar y vender puercos. Al cabo de dos años notó que las ganancias no eran las mismas y optó por ayudar a vender productos de la quesería donde trabajaba su esposo. Después de un tiempo, e invirtiendo sus ahorros la pareja decidió independizarse y hasta ahora tiene una actividad estable al grado que se ha convertido en un negocio familiar más completo  ya que son sus tres hijos quienes se dedican a elaborar el queso.

Doña Irma se siente orgullosa con el avance y resultado de su dedicación y la de su familia. Además agradece el apoyo de los préstamos de VisionFund México que le permiten comprar leche, cuajo, calcio y sal. Con su nuevo préstamo pretende  comprar cacerolas, leche, cuajo y más calcio. En el corto plazo, Irma planea adquirir una máquina descremadora para vender crema y ampliar su gama de productos para aumentar sus ingresos.

*En la imagen: los integrantes de Honestidad, doña Irma viste una blusa verde floreada.
texts.en:
The borrowing group called Honestidad [Honesty] was formed in a small city known as "The Bride of the Sun" because of the high temperatures that are reached there. The members and their occupations are:

Francisca- Sales of woven goods, needlework, and basket tacos [tacos prepared ahead of time and sold from a basket]

Teresa- Dental lab service

Irma- Cheese sales

Ernesto- Watch and clock service

Sofía- Sales of cosmetics and tamales 

Patricia- Cosmetics sales

Angélica- Dessert sales

Irma began raising and selling pigs nine years ago, and after two years she noticed that the earnings weren’t the same, and decided to help sell products in the cheese shop where her husband was working.  After a period of time, and investing their savings, the couple decided to become independent; and now they have an occupation that is stable to the degree that it has become a more complete family business, as their three children are devoting themselves to making the cheese.

Irma feels proud of the progress, and the result of her dedication and that of her family. She is also grateful for the support of the VisionFund Mexico lenders that allows her to purchase milk, curdling agents, calcium, and salt. 

With her new loan, she plans to purchase pans, milk, curdling agents, and more calcium; and in the near future, Irma plans to acquire a cream separating machine in order to sell cream and expand her product range to increase her income.

The picture shows the members of Honestidad; Irma is wearing a green floral blouse.

loans.use: to purchase pans, milk, curdling agents, and calcium.

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo de préstamo El Amanecer, se consolidó en una región cañera del estado de Oaxaca que además alberga una de las principales fábricas productoras de azúcar, principal fuente de empleo de los habitantes. 

Las 6 integrantes que conforman el grupo tienen como fin común el bienestar de su familia desempeñando cada una sus actividades:

Luz – Servicio de Ciber Café
Laura – Venta de Calzado Por Catalogo 
Arcenia – Servicio de Estética y Venta de Abarrotes
Daniela – Venta de Ropa 
Anayeli – Venta de Comida 
Kenia – Venta de Productos para el Hogar

Hace 11 años, después de cumplir su sueño de estudiar cultura de belleza, Arcenia finalmente abrió su propia estética. Al principio rentaba un local en el centro de la comunidad “después de superar algunos obstáculos y gracias a los préstamos, tengo mi propio local”. El apoyo incondicional de su esposo y sus tres hijos, es lo que la ha motivado durante todo este tiempo para superar las dificultades y seguir trabajando. 

A pesar de tener un carácter fuerte, Arcenia reconoce que el trato al cliente es elemental para tener su negocio estable. El interés por aprender y mantenerse actualizada con cursos también es otro atributo que le ha ayudado. 

Con las ganancias de la estética, recientemente Arcenia tuvo la oportunidad de abrir una pequeña tienda donde vende botanas, galletas, dulces y refrescos, principalmente. También ha instalado dos maquinitas de videojuegos que renta a los pequeños vecinos. 

Los préstamos de VisionFund México le han proporcionado el capital para fortalecer ambas actividades y en esta ocasión necesita invertir en materiales para su estética como tijeras, talco, acondicionadores, navajas, tintes y peróxido. 

Para Arcenia no existe mayor orgullo que saber que gracias a su esfuerzo pudo darles estudios a sus hijos mayores y que aún apoya al más joven quien actualmente asiste a la preparatoria. Es precisamente por él y para seguir mostrando su apoyo a su marido que quiere seguir trabajando y mejorando sus negocios. Su siguiente objetivo es incrementar la variedad de mercancía en su tienda.

Las 6 integrantes del grupo agradecen la oportunidad de recibir el apoyo económico que les ayudará a seguir creciendo con sus negocios. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Luz, las clientas están paradas delante de la mesa donde coloca las computadoras de su Ciber Café. Arcenia viste una blusa de manga larga.
texts.en:
The borrowing group, El Amanecer [The Dawn] was formed in the State of Oaxaca, in a sugarcane region that is also home to one of the principal sugar-producing factories, a principal source of employment for the inhabitants.

The six members that make up the group have the wellbeing of their families as a common goal, with each one carrying out her activity:

Luz-cyber café services
Laura-footwear sales by catalog
Arcenia-beauty salon services and grocery sales
Daniela-clothing sales
Anayeli-food sales
Kenia-sales of household products

Eleven years ago, after fulfilling her dream of studying Beauty Culture,  Arcenia finally opened her own beauty salon.  At first, she rented a shop in the community center, but she says, “After overcoming some obstacles, and thanks to the loans, I have my own shop”.  It is the unconditional support of her husband and children throughout all of this time that has motivated her to overcome the difficulties and continue working. 

Despite having a strong personality, Arcenia recognizes that customer service is essential for the stability of her business, and her interest in learning and keeping herself up to date by taking courses is another attribute that has helped her.

Recently, Arcenia had the opportunity to open a small store with the earnings from the salon, where she sells mostly snacks, cookies, sweets, and soft drinks.  She has also installed two small video game machines that she charges the neighborhood kids a fee to play. The loans from VisionFund Mexico have provided her with the capital to strengthen both activities.  On this occasion, she needs to invest in materials for her salon, such as scissors, talcum powder, conditioners, razors, coloring, and peroxide.

Nothing makes Arcenia as proud as knowing that thanks to her efforts she was able to give her oldest children an education; and she is still supporting the youngest, who is currently attending high school. It is precisely for him, and to keep demonstrating her support for her husband that she wants to keep working and improving her businesses, and her next objective is to increase the variety of merchandise in her store.

The six group members are thankful for the opportunity to receive the financial support that will help them to keep growing their businesses.

The photograph was taken in Luz’s house; the ladies are standing in front of the table where the Cyber Café computers are placed.  Arcenia is wearing a long-sleeved blouse.

loans.use: to purchase scissors, talcum powder, conditioners, razors, hair coloring, and peroxide.

loans.name: Independencia Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del estado de Oaxaca que es separada de la comunidad vecina del estado de Veracruz tan sólo por una calle, se conformó el grupo Independencia. Los integrantes y sus actividades económicas son: 

Laura – Venta de Agua Purificada, Perfumes, Sabanas y Colchas
Teresa – Venta de Postres y Bisutería 
Juana – Venta de Artesanías y Bolsas de Mano 
Pablo – Venta de Abarrotes 
Francisco – Servicio de Carpintería 
Rogelio – Venta de Comida 
Teresa de Jesús – Venta de Calzado por Catálogo 

Todos los días, Doña Teresa recorre una hora de camino para llegar al consultorio donde trabaja como auxiliar del médico quiropráctico del municipio. A pesar de tener un trabajo estable, hace 2 años comenzó a asistir a cursos para mujeres emprendedoras que imparte el gobierno. En su primer curso aprendió a crear bolsas bordadas en manta y decoradas con pintura acrílica; en el segundo, a elaborar joyería de fantasía y en el tercero, a hornear postres. 

En las tres ocasiones, justo después de terminar los talleres, Teresa inició a vender los productos que elaboraba ofreciéndolos a sus amigas, vecinos e incluso a los pacientes en el consultorio. Su negocio ha crecido gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación pero ha encontrado apoyo económico en los préstamos de VisionFund México para comprar todo el material o ingredientes que más necesita. En esta ocasión, Teresa quiere invertir nuevamente en harina, leche, huevos y mantequilla para los postres así como en manta, pinceles y cristal para sus manualidades. 

Teresa se siente orgullosa y plena al poder aplicar sus conocimientos para producir un poco más de ganancias que finalmente sirven para apoyar a su esposo y a sus dos hijos adolescentes. El sueño de Teresa es poder abrir una pastelería en casa y para lograrlo continúa ahorrando parte de sus ganancias. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Francisco, Teresa viste blusa blanca y falda color verde pistache.
texts.en:
The Independencia Group was formed in the State of Oaxaca, in a community that is separated from the neighboring community in the State of Veracruz by only one street. The members and their economic activities are:

Laura- Sales of purified water, perfume, sheets, and quilts.

Teresa- Sales of desserts and costume jewelry

Juana- Sales of handicrafts and handbags

Pablo- Grocery sales

Francisco- Carpentry service

Rogelio- Food sales

Teresa de Jesús- Sales of footwear by catalog

Every day Teresa travels an hour to get to the clinic where she works as an assistant to the town’s chiropractic physician.   Two years ago, despite having a steady job, she began attending workshops for women entrepreneurs given by the government. In her first class she learned to create embroidered muslin purses, decorated with acrylic paint; in the second, to make fantasy jewelry; and in the third, to bake desserts. On the three occasions, just after finishing the workshops, Teresa began selling the products she was making, offering them to her girlfriends, neighbors, and even to the patients in the clinic. 

Her business has grown, thanks to her effort and dedication, but in the loans from VisionFund Mexico, she has found the economic support for purchasing all the materials and ingredients that she needs most. On this occasion, Teresa wants to re-invest in flour, milk, eggs, and butter for the desserts, as well as muslin, brushes, and crystals for her handicrafts. 

Teresa feels proud and fulfilled by being able to use her knowledge to produce a few more earnings that will ultimately serve to support her husband and her two teenage children.  Teresa’s dream is to be able to open a pastry shop at home, and she will keep saving part of her earnings in order to achieve it.

The photograph was taken at Francisco’s house. Teresa is wearing a white blouse and a pistachio green skirt.

loans.use: to purchase flour, milk, eggs, butter, muslin, brushes, and cut crystals.

loans.name: Flor De Campo Group

texts.es:
Durante el recorrido para llegar a la comunidad donde viven los miembros del grupo Flor de Campo se pueden observar plantaciones de caña de azúcar, fincas de café y árboles de naranja, cultivos que se ven favorecidos por el clima cálido y húmedo de la región. 

Para los integrantes, el nombre de su grupo significa libertad, la que experimentan al vivir en una comunidad rodeada de vegetación y aire fresco. Cada uno de ellos, se dedica a una actividad con el fin de generar ingresos para proveer a su familia María vende pan y comida; Alejandro, sandalias y paraguas; Juana, café, pan y tamales; Tomasa, abarrotes; Aurora, cosméticos y calzado; Grisel, ropa; Raúl, naranjas y Tirso ofrece servicio de reparación y venta de relojes y limpieza de patios. 

La familia de Juana se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de café, actividad a la que ella se suma sólo por temporadas. Fue su mismo gusto por una buena taza de café acompañada de pan lo que la motivó a dedicarse de lleno a la venta de este último. Por las mañanas se apresura con todas las actividades del hogar ya que a las 4 pm acude a la panadería para cargar las piezas en su canasto y comenzar su recorrido por las comunidades. Al día carga alrededor de 150 panes que vende en tan sólo tres horas. Su esposo realiza la misma actividad, pero él recorre las poblaciones más lejanas en su moto. 

Los préstamos de VisionFund México han ayudado a Juana a mejorar su actividad, ahora ya no recorre las comunidades a pie, sino que compró un triciclo. El nuevo préstamo lo necesita para comprar bolsas, más pan y un canasto nuevo. Las ganancias le permitieron comenzar a vender tamales los fines de semana para tener un pequeño ingreso extra, aunque su gran sueño es tener una panadería en su propia casa.

Con orgullo, Juana comenta que con sus ganancias y ahorros y los de su esposo han comenzado a construir una nueva casa para su familia, un nuevo hogar y patrimonio para sus tres hijos. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa de Juana, ella está de pie detrás de Grisel quien  viste una blusa color azul turquesa.
texts.en:
Along the way to the community where the members of the Flor de Campo Group live, one can see sugarcane plantations, coffee farms, and orange trees—crops favored by the region’s warm and humid climate.

For the members, the name of the group signifies liberty, that which they enjoy by living in a community surrounded by vegetation and fresh air. Each one devotes him or herself to an occupation in order to generate  income to provide for their families. María sells bread and food; Alejandro, sandals and umbrellas; Juana, coffee, bread and tamales; Tomasa, groceries; Aurora, cosmetics and footwear; Grisel, clothing; Raúl, oranges; and Tirso repairs and sells watches, and offers backyard cleanup services.

Juana’s family plants and grows coffee, an occupation she only participates in seasonally. It was the pleasure she took in a good cup of coffee accompanied by bread that motivated her to devote herself fully to the sale of bread.  Mornings, she hurries to complete all the household chores, because at 4 P.M. she goes to the bakery to load the loaves into her basket and begin her route throughout the communities. She carries about 150 loaves daily, which sell in only three hours.  Her husband is engaged in the same occupation, but he travels to the villages that are farther away, on his motorcycle.

The loans from VisionFund Mexico have helped Juana to improve her occupation; now she no longer travels throughout the communities on foot, but has purchased a tricycle.  She needs the new loan to purchase bags, more bread, and a new basket.  The earnings allowed her to begin selling tamales on the weekends in order to have a little extra income, although her biggest dream is to have a bakery in her own house. 

Juana says with pride that with her earnings and savings, and those of her husband, they have begun to build a new house for their family—a new home, a legacy for their three children.

The photograph was taken at Juana’s house.  She is standing behind Grisel, who is wearing a turquoise blouse.

loans.use: to purchase bags, bread, and a new basket.

loans.name: Las Chelas Group

texts.es:
Cerca de las vías donde transita el tren conocido como “La Bestia” que recorre el país de sur a norte, se reúne el grupo Las Chelas que debe su nombre a la representante Graciela a quien todos conocen como “Chela”. Cada uno de los integrantes desempeña una actividad distinta como medio de vida: Graciela, se dedica a la elaboración de postres y venta de productos naturistas; Inocencia, Teres, Eva, Aurelia y María, a la venta de calzado por catálogo; Petra, a la venta de antojitos; Felipe, a la venta de fruta; Jazmín, a la venta de cosméticos; Emelia, a la venta de cosméticos y servicio de sastrería; Mirelia, a la venta de comida, perfumes y ropa y Yessenia, a la venta de tacos. 

Hace 15 años Graciela aprendió a elaborar manjar, arroz con leche, empanadas, risueñas, donas, pasteles y gelatinas. Su abuelita, quien recuerda que tenía un sazón sensacional, fue quien le enseñó el arte de la repostería. Los pasteles los hornea sólo por pedido, pero el refrigerador de su casa siempre está repleto de todo tipo de postres, preparada para vender en cualquier momento que algún cliente llegue a su casa. Graciela también vende de manera ambulante y cada que acude a dejar el pago de su préstamo, por ejemplo, lleva postres en un molde de plástico y regresa a casa con el molde vacío. Con sus ganancias y ahorros hace un año Graciela también comenzó a vender productos naturistas. 

La satisfacción de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa es la mejor motivación para Graciela y a pesar de que sus hijos le han pedido que deje de vender y se ofrecen ayudarla económicamente, ella sigue con sus actividades. A Graciela le agrada lo que hace y más aún le hace sentirse útil. 

Ella agradece cada uno de los préstamos que ha recibido de VisionFund México ya que le han permitido comprar refractarios, charolas, domos, una batidora, además de ingredientes para la elaboración de los postres. El nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en harina, leche, azúcar, aceite, durazno, fresa, piña, zanahoria y vasos desechables pues la vacaciones se aproximan y con ellas el incremento de la venta durante el viacrucis del viernes santo en las calles de la comunidad.

A pesar de que sus hijos son mayores, Graciela sigue pensando en ellos. Junto con su esposo ha planeado dedicarse también a criar y vender mojarra para dejar un patrimonio a sus hijos. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en la calle de la comunidad. Graciela es quien tiene en las manos el molde de plástico con postres. En la fotografía hay una persona de más es la madre de María Guadalupe (se tiene su firma en la autorización).
texts.en:
The communal bank group "Las Chelas" meets near the railway of the train known as "La Bestia", which covers the country from south to north.  The group was named after its representative, Graciela, who is known as "Chela".  Each of the members works in a different business activity: Graciela makes desserts and sells natural products; Inocencia, Teres, Eva, Aurelia and Maria sell shoes by catalogue; Petra sells snack foods; Felipe sells fruit; Jazmin sells cosmetics; Emelia sells cosmetics and has a sewing business; Mirelia sells food and clothing; and Yessenia sells tacos.

Graciela learned to make foods like rice pudding, turnovers, pastries and gelatins 15 years ago.  She remembers her grandmother fondly as the one who taught her the art of baking.  Cakes are made only on an order basis, but her refrigerator at home is always full of all kinds of desserts that are ready to sell at any given time to any customer.  Graciela also works as a street vendor, and every time she comes to make a payment on her loan she brings in plastic containers with desserts, but returns home with empty containers.  With the profit she earned and part of her savings, Graciela also started to sell natural products.

The satisfaction of helping her husband with the household expenses is Graciela's greatest motivation.  And despite the fact that her children have asked her to retire, as they are willing to help her economically, she continues with her activity.  Graciela enjoys what she does and, even moreso, feeling useful.

She is grateful for the loans received through VisionFund Mexico which have allowed her to buy pots and pans, ovens and a mixer, as well as the ingredients to make desserts.  The new loan will be used to buy flour, milk, sugar, oil, peaches, strawberries, pineapple, carrots and disposable cups.  Holiday time is approaching and sales will increase over Good Friday in the streets of the community.

Although her children are now adults, Graciela continues to think about them.  She and her husband are planning to raise and sell "mojarra" (crappie fish) to leave assets to their children.

*The picture was taken on a street in the community.  Graciela is the one holding a plastic container with desserts.  There is one non-member in the picture who is the mother of Maria Guadalupe (who signed the authorization).

loans.use: To buy flour, milk, sugar, oil, peaches, strawberries, carrots and cups.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde se conformó el grupo Los Girasoles cuenta con la magnífica vista de una presa que cubre una gran parte del territorio lo que ha permitido que se formen pequeñas islas a las cuales sólo se tiene acceso con lancha particular, chalupa o “pasajeras” como les llaman los habitantes.

Los integrantes del grupo desempeñan una actividad distinta como medio de vida. María vende suplementos alimenticios; Andrea, Aurora y Juan, comida; María Elena, cobertores; María Esther, pollo; Trinidad y Viridiana, mojarras; Ángel, abarrotes; Adrián, billetes de lotería; Beltrán, carne y Daniel ofrece servicio de carpintería.

Ángel es una persona muy alegre, es apreciado por sus conocidos por su sencillez y humildad. En 1992 sus padres abrieron una pequeña tienda de abarrotes para sacar adelante a la familia. Desde hace 15 años, Ángel se hace cargo de la tienda, haciendo frente al gran reto de la competencia de otras tiendas y cadenas que ofrecen un servicio similar. Sin embargo, los precios, la variedad de productos y las opciones de pago, han mantenido su tienda a flote. 

Al igual que sus préstamos anteriores, en esta nueva oportunidad de financiamiento, Ángel comprará agua, arroz, frijol, azúcar, leche, galletas, queso, refrescos, maíz, papel higiénico y detergente, productos que más compran sus clientes. 

Las ganancias de la tienda las utiliza para solventar los gastos del hogar, los medicamentos de su madre y apoyar a sus hermanos. También ha podido renovar algunos muebles del hogar y ha realizado algunas adecuaciones en la tienda. Ángel se siente verdaderamente afortunado por la familia que tiene y eso se refleja en su amor hacia sus sobrinos a quienes ve como hijos. Su sueño es que el negocio permanezca en la familia por más generaciones y piensa heredarla a alguno de sus sobrinos en el momento adecuado. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en la cocina de doña Andrea, Ángel viste playera color beige con rayas color café.
texts.en:
The community where the bank group Los Girasoles established itself has magnificent views of a dam that covers a great part of the territory.  This accounts for small islands having formed which can only be accessed by private boats or ferries.

The members of the group are involved in different business activities.  Maria sells food supplements; Andrea, Aurora and Juan sell food; Maria Elena sells blankets; Maria Esther, chicken; Trinidad and Viridiana, mojarra (crappie); Angel, groceries; Adrian, lottery tickets; Beltran, meat; and Daniel has a carpentry business.

Angel is a very cheerful person who is valued by his acquaintances for his simplicity and humbleness.  In 1992 his parents opened a small grocery store to support the family.  For 15 years Angel has been managing the store, taking on the fierce competition from other stores and franchises offering a similar service.  Nevertheless, thanks to his prices, producty variety and payment options, he has kept the store in business.

As with previous loans, on this occasion Angel will buy water, rice, beans, sugar, milk, cookies, cheese, soft drinks, corn, toilet paper and detergent, which are the most popular items.

The profits from the store are used to cover household expenses, to buy medication for his mother, and to support his siblings.  Angel also has renovated some of the furniture at home and updated his store.  He feels very fortunate for the family he has and it shows in his love for his nieces and nephews who he sees as his own children.  His dream is to keep the business in the family for future generations.  He plans to leave it to one of his nieces or nephews when the time comes.

*The picture was taken in Andrea's kitchen.  Angel is the one in a beige striped polo shirt.

loans.use: To buy water, rice, beans, sugar, milk, cookies, cheese, soft drinks, corn, toilet paper and detergent.

loans.name: La Sorpresa Group

texts.es:
En el camino hacia la comunidad del grupo La Sorpresa, se pueden apreciar sembradíos de caña, plátano y maíz, vendedores de fruta a la orilla de la carretera y de vez en cuando algunas palabras en mazateco que inundan el aire.
